font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The UN IPCC and its\nGlobal Warming agenda is KOSHER political and not a scientific project.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">IPCC reports are &nbsp;based on fake science and\noutright fraud.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MASSIVE AMOUNTS OF\nMETHANE IS LEAKING INTO THE GULF STREAM&nbsp;\nDUE TO US FRACKING ACTIVITIES AND OIL RIG DISASTERS INDUCED SEABED LEAKS\n&nbsp;.. THIS HAS CAUSED GULF STREAM TO SLOW\nDOWN AND BECOME WARMER..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The weaker the Gulf\nStream becomes, the more difficult it will be to predict the future.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gulf Stream is\nslowing down because the circulation of warmer surface waters and colder water\nin the ocean is weakening. The ocean can no longer store heat as it used to,\nwhich &nbsp;also reduces its capacity to\nabsorb carbon from the atmosphere.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Warm water is carried\nin Gulf stream current , all the way from the Gulf of Mexico to the Arctic\nOcean..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a large quantity\nof water from the melted ice is introduced in areas where heavier water would\ndescend towards the bottom, the salinity of the water will decrease, slowing\ndown the descent and, consequently, the circulation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A weaker Gulf Stream\nwill lead to the stratification of the ocean, which in turn accelerates global\nwarming if the warmer waters are prevented from descending. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When AMOC flow&nbsp; slows down, less heat is sequestered in the\nseas and so our land surface temperatures increase. When the AMOC current moves\nfaster, more of the heat that is trapped in our atmosphere is taken and stored\nup to 1,500m below the surface of the ocean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With the huge&nbsp; decline of AMOC flow , less heat goes into\nthe waters and more into the air, leading to higher global temperatures.&nbsp; Extreme weather results from the slowdown of\nthe Atlantic Meridional overturning circulation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Recent summer heat\nwaves weather and extremes in western Europe are related to the slow down\nof&nbsp; AMOC.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gulf Stream is just\na critical part of what is known as the AMOC, or Atlantic Meridional\nOverturning Circulation, which is part of the Great Ocean Conveyor (The ocean\ncirculation then travels all over the globe). As the warm, salty water reaches\nthe far North Atlantic, it cools down. Cooler water sinks, starting the\n\u201creturn\u201d part of the circulation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enhanced melting of the\nGreenland Ice Sheet,&nbsp; adds fresh water to\nthe surface ocean and reduces the density of the water that drives deep\nconvection.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While Atlantic\nmeridonial overturning circulation (AMOC) and THC are two terms that are often\nused interchangeable, the AMOC differs as it involves the total circulation in\nthe latitude depth plane that, in its name alone, does not provide any\ninformation on the driving factors of its circulation, whereas the driving\nfactor of THC is implied in its name as directly related to the creation and\ndestruction of buoyancy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By transporting heated\nwater from the Southern Hemisphere, this ocean circulation system absorbs a\nsubstantial amount of heat from these areas and transports it to higher\nlatitudes for release into the atmosphere. The AMOC therefore play a crucial\nrole in maintaining the climate of nearby coastal areas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crucially, the entire\nAMOC system depends on cool, dense water \u201coverturning\u201d in the northwest\nAtlantic Ocean. Without cooled water plunging into the deep ocean near\nGreenland, and turning back south, the entire conveyor belt will stop.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Atlantic\nMeridional Overturning Circulation ( AMOC is strong, it sends millions of cubic\nmeters of ocean water north every day. A strong AMOC shapes the entire planet\u2019s\nclimate systems. It assures the health of monsoons in India.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Indian monsoon blows\nfrom the northeast during cooler months and reverses direction to blow from the\nsouthwest during the warmest months of the year. This process brings large\namounts of rainfall to the region during June and July.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The westerly\nsubtropical jet stream still controls the flow of air across northern India,\nand the surface winds are northeasterlies.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It has a significant effect on the\noverall well-being of residents and has even been dubbed the \"real finance\nminister of India\". seasonal reversal of the direction of winds along the\nshores of the Indian Ocean, especially in the Arabian Sea, which blow from the\nsouthwest for half of the year and from the northeast for the other half.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Normally, the southwest monsoon can be expected to \"burst\" onto the\nwestern coast of India (near Thiruvananthapuram) at the beginning of June and\nto cover the entire country by mid-July<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Its withdrawal from\nIndia typically starts at the beginning of September and finishes by the\nbeginning of October The northeast monsoon usually \"bursts\" around 20\nOctober and lasts for about 50 days before withdrawing&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A monsoon with excess\nrain can cause floods, and one with too little rain can lead to widespread\ndrought, famine, and economic losses. Therefore, a normal monsoon with mean\nperformance is the most desirable monsoon. Over India, a subtropical westerly\njet develops in the winter season and is replaced by the tropical easterly jet\nin the summer season<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Indian monsoon\ncurrent takes its name from the wind\u2014the monsoon\u2014that drives it. It is one of\nthe very few currents in an ocean gyre that change direction. In the summer,\nthe current flows clockwise, as the monsoon blows in from the southwestern\nIndian Ocean.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the winter, the current flows counterclockwise, as the wind\nblows in from the Tibetan plateau in the northeast.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What is a GYRE?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gyre, in oceanography\nand climatology, is a vast circular system made up of ocean currents that\nspirals about a central point.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In oceanography, a gyre\nis any large system of circulating ocean currents, particularly those involved\nwith large wind movements.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gyres are caused by the Coriolis effect; planetary\nvorticity along with horizontal and vertical friction, determine the\ncirculation patterns from the wind stress curl (torque).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wind, tides, and\ndifferences in temperature and salinity drive ocean currents.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ocean churns\nup different types of currents, such as eddies, whirlpools, or deep ocean\ncurrents. Larger, sustained currents\u2014the Gulf Stream, for example\u2014go by proper\nnames. Taken together, these larger and more permanent currents make up the\nsystems of currents known as gyres.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gulf Stream, a\nwind-driven gyre, which transports warm water from the Caribbean northwards. A\nnorthwards branch of the Gulf Stream, the North Atlantic Drift, is part of the\nthermohaline circulation (THC), transporting warmth further north to the North\nAtlantic<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Gulf Stream (GS) is\nthe western boundary current of the North Atlantic Subtropical Gyre, which in\nturn is part of the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC). As a\nwind driven gyre, the Gulf Stream is sensitive to changes in the dominant wind\npatterns represented by the North Atlantic Oscillation (NAO).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Three forces cause the\ncirculation of a gyre: global wind patterns, Earth\u2019s rotation, and Earth\u2019s\nlandmasses. Wind drags on the ocean surface, causing water to move in the\ndirection the wind is blowing.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Northern Hemisphere, ocean currents are\ndeflected to the right, in a clockwise motion. In the Southern Hemisphere,\nocean currents are pushed to the left, in a counterclockwise motion. Beneath\nsurface currents of the gyre, the Coriolis effect results in what is called an\nEkman spiral.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While surface currents are deflected by about 45 degrees, each\ndeeper layer in the water column is deflected slightly less. This results in a\nspiral pattern descending about 100 meters<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are three major\ntypes of ocean gyres: tropical, subtropical, and subpolar. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Subpolar gyres form in\nthe polar regions of the planet. They sit beneath an area of low atmospheric\npressure. Wind drives the currents in subpolar gyres away from coastal areas.\nThese surface currents are replaced by cold, nutrient-rich water in a process\ncalled upwelling. The Northern Hemisphere has several subpolar gyres, bounded\nby islands such as Iceland, Greenland, and the Aleutians; and the northern\nreaches of Scandinavia, Asia, and North America.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tropical gyres form\nnear the Equator. The Coriolis effect is not present at the Equator, and winds\nare the primary creators of currents. For this reason, tropical gyres tend to\nflow in a more east-west (instead of circular) pattern. The Indian Ocean Gyre is\nactually two distinct tropical gyres\u2014the northern and southern Indian Ocean\nGyres.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the world\u2019s\nmajor gyres are subtropical gyres. These form between the polar and equatorial\nregions of Earth. Subtropical gyres circle areas beneath regions of high\natmospheric pressure. These are placid ocean areas thousands of kilometers in\ndiameter. Unlike coastal zones, these central regions are relatively stable.\nThe ocean water generally stays in one place while the currents of the gyre\ncirculate around it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gyres are comprised of\nocean currents that link up as they follow the coastlines of the Earth\u2019s\ncontinents. Each gyre has a powerful western boundary current and a weaker\neastern boundary current.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The North Atlantic Gyre\nbegins with the northward flow of the Gulf Stream along the East Coast of the\nUnited States. The Gulf Stream is the western boundary current of the gyre.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ngyre then becomes the North Atlantic Current, which flows across the North\nAtlantic to Europe Most ocean gyres are very stable and predictable. The North\nAtlantic Ocean Gyre always flows in a steady, clockwise path around the North\nAtlantic Ocean.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The temperature in an\nocean gyre depends on many factors, including the current. The Gulf Stream and\nsummer monsoon current are warm currents. They are heated by the warm tropical\nwaters of the Caribbean Sea (Gulf Stream) and equatorial Indian Ocean (summer\nmonsoon current).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The North Atlantic Current and winter monsoon current are\ncool currents. They are cooled by Arctic winds and ocean currents (North\nAtlantic) and the winter monsoon blowing from the icy Himalayas (winter monsoon\ncurrent). Ocean gyres circle large areas of stationary, calm water. Debris\ndrifts into these areas and, due to the region\u2019s lack of movement, can\naccumulate for years.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These regions are called garbage patches.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UjQq9AGVl4E/XGAwLCXSIKI/AAAAAAABfxg/xG4BtTombj4-leYhkVdJ8lsQA07rKj2nACLcBGAs/s1600/downlFoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"165\" data-original-width=\"305\" height=\"346\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UjQq9AGVl4E/XGAwLCXSIKI/AAAAAAABfxg/xG4BtTombj4-leYhkVdJ8lsQA07rKj2nACLcBGAs/s640/downlFoad.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The circular\nmotion of the gyre draws in the debris, mostly small particles of plastic.\nEventually, the debris makes its way to the center of the gyre, where it\nbecomes trapped and breaks down into a kind of plastic soup.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-f6wkMeBvyx4/XGAwUnV1QMI/AAAAAAABfxk/N_y1zEHjpw0ZGNBjt1kgPyMWSL0RVMV2gCLcBGAs/s1600/Gyres-PlaDstic-Ocean-Trash-Pacific-Indian_Atlantic-World-Map.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"541\" data-original-width=\"929\" height=\"372\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-f6wkMeBvyx4/XGAwUnV1QMI/AAAAAAABfxk/N_y1zEHjpw0ZGNBjt1kgPyMWSL0RVMV2gCLcBGAs/s640/Gyres-PlaDstic-Ocean-Trash-Pacific-Indian_Atlantic-World-Map.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Garbage patches\ngenerally accumulate far from any country\u2019s coastline, and it is nearly\nimpossible to track the origin of marine debris.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-cP1u3Ufcz0w/XGAwhW9YLMI/AAAAAAABfxw/MqVGUDgZqyM7NlOnGcnIZq5fyUGiKVcAQCLcBGAs/s1600/plastic-Rocean-debris-5-gyres.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"480\" data-original-width=\"640\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-cP1u3Ufcz0w/XGAwhW9YLMI/AAAAAAABfxw/MqVGUDgZqyM7NlOnGcnIZq5fyUGiKVcAQCLcBGAs/s640/plastic-Rocean-debris-5-gyres.jpeg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The tiny plastic particles\nthat make up most of the patches are also very difficult and expensive to\ndetect and remove<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-In9e_v2rmzs/XGAwcdRLPpI/AAAAAAABfxs/JTR7J8-06f8urQkIfZP5HNBxE7PfW0kAwCLcBGAs/s1600/OceanSPlasticGyre.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"686\" data-original-width=\"1203\" height=\"364\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-In9e_v2rmzs/XGAwcdRLPpI/AAAAAAABfxs/JTR7J8-06f8urQkIfZP5HNBxE7PfW0kAwCLcBGAs/s640/OceanSPlasticGyre.jpeg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lifeline for about\none-sixth of the world\u2019s population in the subcontinent, the Indian summer\nmonsoon (ISM) is an integral part of the annual cycle of the winds (reversal of\nwinds with seasons), coupled with a strong annual cycle of precipitation (wet\nsummer and dry winter..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A weakened AMOC will\nlead to considerable changes in climate and precipitation patterns throughout\nthe planet. Before the Gulf stream slowed down there was no El Nino<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/02/el-nino-and-la-nina-mariners-overview.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/02/el-nino-and-la-nina-mariners-overview.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/08/hurricane-season-2011-all-yanks-put-on.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/08/hurricane-season-2011-all-yanks-put-on.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Increasing melt from\nGreenland due to human-forced warming of the atmosphere through the deep ocean\nis freshening the ocean surface of the far North Atlantic.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;To the south, higher\nocean temperatures are increasing surface salt content through greater rates of\nevaporation. Fresh water prevents ocean water from sinking in the north and\nrising salt content generates increased sinking in the south.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a result, the\nrate at which waters move from the Equator toward the Pole is slowing down.\nSince the mid 20th Century, this critical ocean circulation has reduced in strength\nby 18 percent on decadal time-scales.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-pS3fTDqO5WY/XGEjEX7hRyI/AAAAAAABfyY/7yO3SdvKdDY6loHmxOjKwe4zU8JD6oLlQCLcBGAs/s1600/twa_2017_10_hydrCFates_fig6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">UNSCIENTIFIC HASTY\nDRILLING FOR METHANE CLATHRATES BY USA, CHINA AND JAPAN WITHOUT PROPER RISK\nASSESSMENT , IS RELEASING HUMONGOUS METHANE FROM DEEP OCEAN FLOORS ..&nbsp; &nbsp;THIS HAS\nLED TO OCEAN ACIDIFICATION WHICH IS BEING KEPT A SECRET..<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; CHAKKAR KYA HAI ?&nbsp; I THINK I KNOW !!</span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-k4HYeGjTaU4/XGFisLu90uI/AAAAAAABfzw/QLpV4StDzhApdCq301mWPVJiQr5MTpXOACLcBGAs/s1600/281250FXG0060.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; AREA.</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-7XsqB4Ds9XY/XGFi8_2gA9I/AAAAAAABfz4/BDECbavf2fkj5YW0_8X_r1FnbYAHZGBOACLcBGAs/s1600/gas-hydrGGGate.62cdf0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-O7Us1EUuROk/XGFjZ3lQu9I/AAAAAAABf0A/-cC3CQFCuBwEQmceeJxWDkUx28O6cpITACLcBGAs/s1600/dEEownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/_rQkTBC0Rzo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/_rQkTBC0Rzo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-SpUn7IRBbeo/XGFmbY4vkoI/AAAAAAABf0I/uSW1kW0dGuYhiv8imilKexzpE-s_mw7yACLcBGAs/s1600/400px-Methane_HydrTTate_phase_diagram.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"265\" data-original-width=\"400\" height=\"424\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-SpUn7IRBbeo/XGFmbY4vkoI/AAAAAAABf0I/uSW1kW0dGuYhiv8imilKexzpE-s_mw7yACLcBGAs/s640/400px-Methane_HydrTTate_phase_diagram.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like all hydrocarbons,\nmethane contains only two elements -- carbon and hydrogen. It is an example of\na saturated hydrocarbon, or a molecule composed entirely of single bonds and\ntherefore the maximum number of hydrogen atoms allowed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The general formula for\nsaturated hydrocarbons is CnH2n+2. Methane only has one carbon atom, so its\nchemical formula is CH4. Chemists describe this shape as a tetrahedron.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<b><u><span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Hydrocarbons</span></u></b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">:<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdRfdQzzwI/AAAAAAAACaQ/zL88fEmQf90/s1600/hc.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"235\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdRfdQzzwI/AAAAAAAACaQ/zL88fEmQf90/s400/hc.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Hydrocarbons are divided into--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">1) Aliphatic<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Chain like skeleton of C atoms, not arranged in ring structure, but open chains ( ethane )<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdNfx-9gdI/AAAAAAAACZg/pS0uc0_kJCk/s1600/aliphatic.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"377\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdNfx-9gdI/AAAAAAAACZg/pS0uc0_kJCk/s400/aliphatic.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdNyBn_R9I/AAAAAAAACZk/rJip1Vevm4M/s1600/ethane.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdNyBn_R9I/AAAAAAAACZk/rJip1Vevm4M/s1600/ethane.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">2) Aromatic<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">( Rings of carbon atoms , Benzene, Toluene, Xylene ), sweetsmelling, Flammable, burn with smoky flames, stable, toxic, anaesthetic.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdOXm9C9OI/AAAAAAAACZo/uGXbeL96bvg/s1600/aromatic.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"320\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdOXm9C9OI/AAAAAAAACZo/uGXbeL96bvg/s400/aromatic.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Aliphatic HC are further divide into\u2014<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">1) Alkanes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Molecular formula: Cn H2n+2&nbsp;&nbsp; saturated HC containing single bond.&nbsp; No action on Potassium Permanganate. Also called Paraffin.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Ex: all ending in ane&nbsp; --Pentane, Butane, Hexane<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Ch4/ Methane<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C2h6/ Ethane<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C3h8/ Propane<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C4h10/ Butane<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C5h12/ Pentane<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C6h14/ Hexane<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRR6L1yjsMI/AAAAAAAACTU/WRFCYaqnREI/s1600/images+%252844%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"326\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRR6L1yjsMI/AAAAAAAACTU/WRFCYaqnREI/s400/images+%252844%2529.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Thus when n=8, ( 2n+2)=18 and the Alkane is C8 H18 , it is called octane.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">It is one of the Alkanes in petrol.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdOt0dOmKI/AAAAAAAACZs/ARjV7kdRxZE/s1600/alkane.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"221\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdOt0dOmKI/AAAAAAAACZs/ARjV7kdRxZE/s400/alkane.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Petroleum fractions and molecular composition of Alkanes present:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Gas/ C1 to C4<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C5 to C7/ Petrol Ether<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C5 to C9/ Motor Spirit<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C9 to C10/ Naphtha<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C10 to C16/ Kerosene<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C10 to C18/ DO<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C17 to C30/ HO<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">C15 to C50/ LO<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRR66eEkg0I/AAAAAAAACTY/X87N0l2WJEM/s1600/images+%252845%2529.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRR66eEkg0I/AAAAAAAACTY/X87N0l2WJEM/s400/images+%252845%2529.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"398\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">2) Alkenes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Mol formula Cn H2n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; unsaturated HC containing double bond.&nbsp; Decolourises Potassium Permanganate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Ex: all ending in ene<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Ethylene, Propelene, Pentene, Hexene&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdO-oE9y9I/AAAAAAAACZw/Wu8IhbAkYPU/s1600/cnh2n.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"205\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdO-oE9y9I/AAAAAAAACZw/Wu8IhbAkYPU/s400/cnh2n.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdPIliWvoI/AAAAAAAACZ0/WF9CA5XEjlY/s1600/ane+ene+yne.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">3) Alkynes<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">MF: Cn H2n\u20132&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; unsaturated HC containing tripe bond<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdPONZpv7I/AAAAAAAACZ4/HHSSs5vwCfM/s1600/alkyne+3.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdPUepJn8I/AAAAAAAACZ8/cVdw5W_fsVo/s1600/alkyne.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">4) Cyclic Aliphatic<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">All starting with Cyclo and ending with ane/ ene<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdPoXi7OFI/AAAAAAAACaA/L5O8GA1n68k/s1600/cyclic.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"249\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdPoXi7OFI/AAAAAAAACaA/L5O8GA1n68k/s400/cyclic.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Number of carbon atoms in HC:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">1/ Meth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">2/ Eth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">3/ Prop<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">4/ But<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">5/ Pent<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">6/Hex<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">7/Hept<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">8/Oct<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<u><span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Proforma:&nbsp; SG/ BP/ MP<o:p></o:p></span></u></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Methane/ 0.42/ -160C/ -186C<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Ethane/ 0.45/ -93C/ -172C<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Propane/ 0.54/ -40C/ -814C<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Butane/ 0.60/ 1C/ 135C<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Pentane/ 0.63/ 36C/ -130C<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">The smaller saturated HC methane, ethane , propane and butane are all colourless and odourless liquefied gases.&nbsp; They are all flammable and will burn in air to form CO2 and water.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-GxOuPLpzE2U/Tm7hPWiKwDI/AAAAAAAAGGU/eClbhbEdccQ/s1600/imagesCAEIJQH0.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"311\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-GxOuPLpzE2U/Tm7hPWiKwDI/AAAAAAAAGGU/eClbhbEdccQ/s400/imagesCAEIJQH0.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">HC contain only carbon and hydrogen atoms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">4 carbon atoms in molecule/ gases at ambient temp / pressure ( propane )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">5 to 20 carbon atoms/ liquid at ambient conditions&nbsp; ( octane )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">&gt;20 carbon atoms/ solid at ambient conditions&nbsp; ( nonadecane )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">A carbon atom has 4 bonds\u2014while a hydrogen atom has only one.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">For saturated HC the proportion of carbon and hydrogen atoms in the molecule will be in accordance with the gen formula of Cn H2n+2<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdP_hU6FRI/AAAAAAAACaE/MR8-1IxGsN0/s1600/cnh2n%252B2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"411\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdP_hU6FRI/AAAAAAAACaE/MR8-1IxGsN0/s640/cnh2n%252B2.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdQzazsulI/AAAAAAAACaM/7BcaG8Yfg54/s1600/sat2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; text-decoration-line: none;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"226\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdQzazsulI/AAAAAAAACaM/7BcaG8Yfg54/s400/sat2.jpg\" style=\"background: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); box-shadow: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1) 1px 1px 5px; padding: 5px; position: relative;\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Thus methane CH4&nbsp; ethane C2H6 and propane C3H8 are all saturated HC<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MKRQEPH719I/Tm7isjGrUGI/AAAAAAAAGGk/eFZFT9xAGYM/s1600/imagesCA2OK5W2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/_tugjD0mUn6M/TRdQmX9mOtI/AAAAAAAACaI/Ho8pv9c4yGI/s1600/sat.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 17.6px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;calibri&quot; , sans-serif;\">Propylene C3H6 and butadiene C4H6 and ethylene C2H2 are unsaturated HC</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-IVL2S_i5S5M/Tm7iNAluMmI/AAAAAAAAGGc/i4TO_Anu7r8/s1600/imagesCA2OK5W2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"color: #888888; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;
