Bali was the\nson born from their union<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-G9Tp23n0kqI/XF1CoqsJamI/AAAAAAABftg/82__HZkCLhQFMVDWiAWxF7wuKrUGj_H2wCLcBGAs/s1600/imffages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"168\" data-original-width=\"299\" height=\"224\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-G9Tp23n0kqI/XF1CoqsJamI/AAAAAAABftg/82__HZkCLhQFMVDWiAWxF7wuKrUGj_H2wCLcBGAs/s400/imffages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IRIMPU. A Malayalam word\nmeaning 'iron'. The metal iron originated in the following way. The Devas sought\nBrahma's protection against the onslaughts of Tarakasura, who had obtained a\nboon to the effect that he could be killed only by a son born to Siva. And,&nbsp; implored by Brahma and others Siva entered\ninto the&nbsp; <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sex</span> act with Parvati. The\nimpact shook the universe.&nbsp; Agni\nseparated them from the process and the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> of&nbsp; Siva dropped in Agni. Agni deposited it in\nthe Ganga.&nbsp; The Ganga could not bear it\nand it coursed through&nbsp; her (Ganga's)\narteries and out of it was born Subrahmanya. Also from the particles of the\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> gold and&nbsp; silver were produced.\nFrom the intensity of the heat were produced iron and copper. See under\nSubrahmanya. (Valmiki Ramayana, Bala Kanda, Canto 37) .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When god Agni had left\nafter saying this, Rambha&nbsp; went to visit\nMalayaksa, who was attended to by Yaksas. There, they had a treasure known as\nPadma&nbsp; and numerous animals like\nelephants, horses, buffaloes, cows and sheep. Among them was a three-year-old\nshe- buffalo of exceptional charm and Rambha fell in love with her. She was\nalso irresistibly attracted by him.&nbsp; As\nfate would have it, a <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>union took place&nbsp;\nbetween them. The she-buffalo became <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant </span>and Rambha took her with\nhim to his own house in Patala. There, the other Danavas, his kinsmen who came\nto know of his connection with the she-buffalo, expelled him from&nbsp; their midst as one who had committed a\nforbidden act<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once a celestial damsel\nnamed Madhura after observing&nbsp; Somavaravrata\nwent to Kailasa to pay obeisance to Siva. Parvati was absent from the place\nthen, having&nbsp; gone to attend the birthday\ncelebrations of one of her&nbsp; sons. So\nMadhura met Siva sitting lonely and this led to a clandestine <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>union\nbetween them. When Parvati returned she saw traces of the ashes from the body\nof&nbsp; Siva on the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">naked</span> breast of Madhura\nand Parvati in her anger cursed Madhura to live in a well for twelve&nbsp; years as a frog. Siva was stupefied at the\ncurse and he&nbsp; went to the well and\nconsoled her by saying that she&nbsp; would\nafter the twelve years of life as a frog become&nbsp;\na very beautiful maiden and would be married by a man of great fame and\nvalour.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gandrasena invited all\nthe neighbouring Kings for that. The King of Madra Carudesna was also present\nfor the marriage. The King was very charming to look at but was very bad in\ncharacter. Mandodarl was attracted by his external beauty and she expressed her\nwillingness to marry him. Her father was immensely pleased and on the nearest\nauspicious day she was given in marriage to Carudesna.&nbsp; Mandodari went to the palace of Carudesna and\nthey&nbsp; lived happily for some time. One\nday she saw her husband having <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>acts with the wife of one of the palace\nservants. She reproached her husband and yet&nbsp;\ntwo days later she saw her husband with another&nbsp; servant girl. She was greatly disappointed\nand she&nbsp; left the palace for the forests\nwhere she started performing penance.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-j0BukUbZWhc/XF1DABinlDI/AAAAAAABfts/WeX6fFKcEf85rBF1tTrfZdYOrcoJP_gowCLcBGAs/s1600/imagrfs.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"225\" data-original-width=\"225\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-j0BukUbZWhc/XF1DABinlDI/AAAAAAABfts/WeX6fFKcEf85rBF1tTrfZdYOrcoJP_gowCLcBGAs/s400/imagrfs.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Siva married Vikesi\ndaughter of Hiranyaksa. One day while they we^-e engaged in <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> plays Agni\ncame to their presence. Enraged at this the eyes of Siva blazed with anger and\na drop of hot water from his eyes fell on the face of Vikesi and she became\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant</span>. After some days Vikesi found it impossible to bear the embryo of Siva\nthus formed and she aborted it. A&nbsp; child\nwas born and the goddess of earth took it and&nbsp;\nfed it with breast milk. It was that child who later on became Maagala.\n(Skanda Purana) .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He who fasts for one\ntime in a day in the month of Mithuna will become very prosperous. (Sloka 25,\nChapter 106, Anusasana Parva). (8) If one fasts the whole day and night of the\nDvadasi in Mithuna and does Trivikrama puja one would not only get the benefit\nof conducting a Gomedayajna but&nbsp; will be\nable to enjoy <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>pleasures with celestial maidens. (Sloka 9, Chapter 109,\nAnusasana Parva).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Visnu granted the boon\nand disappeared. Several years passed after that and nothing happened. One day\nthe brahmin as usual went to bathe in a pond. When he took a dip in the waters\nhe forgot all his prayers and mantras. There was a change of mind. He&nbsp; felt he was lying dead in his house.\nRelatives were&nbsp; sitting around weeping.\nHis wife was in tears and was&nbsp; holding\nhis legs. In an atmosphere of mourning, his own&nbsp;\npeople weeping bitterly carried his body to a frightening&nbsp; burial ground and put it on a funeral pyre.\nIt was burnt&nbsp; to ashes. He then felt\nhimself in the womb af a Candala&nbsp; woman\nliving in a village near Hunamandala. 'the&nbsp;\nfoetus developed and a black boy was born. The boy&nbsp; grew passing the stages of infancy, childhood\nand boy- hood and became a man, black and stout. He started enjoying <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span>\nlife with a beautiful candala girl. The&nbsp; <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous\n</span>plays were done on leaf-beds, in ' creeper-huts, bushes and in caves and soon\nmany evil-natured sons were born to him.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mayasiva told her that\nhe had picked up the heads of&nbsp; Ganapati\nand Subrahmanya found lying in the battlefield. He requested Parvatl to console\nhim by embracing him. Parvati resented the request. She said, \"What&nbsp; you say is unfit for the situation. <span style=\"background-color: white;\">Sexual</span>\nenjoyment is forbidden in times of misery, fear, meditation, vomiting&nbsp; fever, performing offering to the manes,\njourney, royal&nbsp; visits, marriage\nfestivities and in the presence of elders and teachers. Why do you make this\nrequest to me when I am mourning the death of my sons ? Pretending to be\ngrief-stricken Mayasiva said \"She who&nbsp;\ndoes not give <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>pleasure to a man in distress would&nbsp; go to hell. I have no parsadas now. I have\nlost my&nbsp; sons also. I lost my house. Now\nyou also hate me. I am going to my cave. Let me end my life there<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;An angered look form Visnu sent the demon away\nfrom the place. Vrnda took refuge in the ascetic and the false ascetic said,\n\"I am Devasarma, son of Bharadvaja. Renouncing all worldly pleasures I\nhave come here to do penance and if it pleases you, you can come and stay in my\nashrama and do penance. We can go to another forest far away from here.\"\nAs soon as they reached the ashram Mahavisnu appeared before&nbsp; her in the figure of Jalandhara. They\nembraced each&nbsp; other and lived there\njoyfully for many days. One day&nbsp; at the\nend of a <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> act Vrnda saw instead of Jalandhara the ascetic in embrace with\nher. She was shocked and stood up separated from him. Then Mahavisnu&nbsp; said \"Vrnda, I am Vishnu husband of\nLaksmi. Your husband has gone to conquer Siva and get Parvati for himself. I am\nSiva also. We appear separate. Your husband Jalandhara has been killed in the\nbattle. Join with me.\"' Vrnda got angry. She cursed Visnu ; she said,\n\"You&nbsp; cheated me by pretending to be\nan ascetic. Let your&nbsp; wife also be once\ncheated by a false ascetic.\" The&nbsp; cursed\nVisnu disappeared and Vrnda started penance.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day Parvati called\nher maid Jaya to her side and said \"Jaya&nbsp;\nyou go in my dress to Siva and find out whether he is really Siva or not.\nIf he <span style=\"background-color: white;\">kisses </span>you and embraces you he will surely be a danava come in disguise\nby his Maya.&nbsp; But if he asks you about my\nwelfare he will be real Siva.&nbsp; Go and\ntell me what happens.\"&nbsp; Jaya went to\nMayai'iva. Jalandhara when he saw her istook her for Parvati and caught hold of\nher and&nbsp; immediately <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> flowed out\nfrom him. Jaya returned&nbsp; and told Parvati\nthat it was Jalandhara and not Siva. Parvati afraid of Jalandhara hid in a\nlotus and her&nbsp; companions became beetles\nsitting on the lotus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br />\n###############</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nisakara&nbsp; described his previous life as follows:\nFather, you would please hear about the reason why I became dumb and idiotic.\nIn my previous life I was&nbsp; born in a\nnoble family, my father being called Vrsakapi&nbsp;\nand mother Mala. My father taught me all the Sastras and the Vedas. I became\nconceited over my unique learn- ing and erudition and began doing evil acts.\nConceit led to avarice, and I lost all my scholarship. I became&nbsp; indiscreet. Having thus become a fool, I\nbegan committing sins. I had to hang myself to death on account&nbsp; of my association with others' women and\nstealing&nbsp; others' money. I, therefore,\nfell into the Raurava hell. After a thousand years some sin remained attached\nto me as a result of which I was born as a tiger, and a King trapped and took\nme to his city. When&nbsp; I was caged Sastras\nabout Dharma, Artha and Kama came up in my mind.&nbsp; One day the King went out wearing only one\npiece of&nbsp; cloth and with a club in his\nhands. Then his wife Ajita, a unique beauty came to me, and because of my taste\nin my previous life <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> desire arose in my heart. I told her about my\nfeelings. She also felt like me. So,&nbsp; she\nunchained me and I approached her in great <span style=\"background-color: white;\">passion</span>&nbsp; and seeing me thus the King's servants tied\nme to a&nbsp; peepal tree and thrashed me to\ndeath. My soul again returned to hell. After a thousand years .&nbsp; I was born as a white ass in the house of a Brahmin\n&nbsp;named Agnivesya, who had many wives.\nThen all knowledge and wisdom were reflected in my mind. My&nbsp; duty was to carry the brahmin women on my\nback. One&nbsp; ay the brahmin's wife Vitnati\nof Navarasjra started&nbsp; tor her father's\nhome mounted on my back. Half-way home she dismounted and went to a stream to\nbathe.&nbsp; The exquisite beauty of that lady\nwith wet clothes upset me, and I ran up to her on the stream, pushed her&nbsp; into the water and myself fell upon her. Then\na person came and tried to tie me down. I escaped from his grips and ran\nsouthwards. While thus running the saddle slipped into rny mouth and I fell\ndown. And, within six days I died thinking about her. Thus I fell again into\nhell. My next birth was as a parrot. A&nbsp; hunter\ncaged me in the forest and he sold me to a Vaisya merchant, who put me up in\nthe women's&nbsp; quarters. The young women\nfed me on rice and fruits. One day the wife of the Vaisya merchant hugged me&nbsp; to her breast and petted me. Her touch\nkindled in me&nbsp; <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> feelings and I\nembraced her with my wings. In my hurry about the affair I slipped down and got&nbsp; crushed between the doors. Thus I fell again\ninto hell.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-4BkKgOEwXwo/XF1DNMsMDuI/AAAAAAABftw/hJHZOL4XBaQHDnre-O83a2GiSZDtvpm-QCLcBGAs/s1600/imfages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"194\" data-original-width=\"259\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-4BkKgOEwXwo/XF1DNMsMDuI/AAAAAAABftw/hJHZOL4XBaQHDnre-O83a2GiSZDtvpm-QCLcBGAs/s400/imfages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once Sri Krsna met\nRadhadevI at Rasamandala and in seclusion they spent in <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>sport the period\nof one day&nbsp; of Brahma. Then Krsna\nselecting an auspicious time&nbsp; dropped his\nvital <span style=\"background-color: white;\">fluid</span> into her womb at the end of the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> sexual </span>sport. Tired by the\nprolonged <span style=\"background-color: white;\">carnal </span>sport and&nbsp; shaken by the\nimpact of the hot semen RadhadevI pers- pired profusely and the exhaustion\nproduced deep and long breaths. The whole universe was covered with her sweat\nand her sighs became the goddess of the life-giving&nbsp; breaths of all created animals. From the left\nside of&nbsp; goddess was born Vayupatni and\nto her were born the &nbsp;ancapranas. Besides\nthese, another five younger pranas were also born. From the sweat of the Devi\nwas born&nbsp; Vavuna and from the left side\nof Varuna was born&nbsp; Varunanl. (9th\nSkandha, Devi Bhagavata).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Vyasa was an ugly sage with&nbsp; matted hair and he was dressed in garments of&nbsp; deerskin. Satyavati that night called Ambika\nto her&nbsp; side and in secret commanded her\nto go and lie with&nbsp; Vyasa. She was\nreluctant to have a <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> union with&nbsp; that\nold and ugly sage. Yet obeying the orders of her&nbsp; mother-in-law she did so shutting her eyes\nduring the&nbsp; whole period. The result was\nshe got a child born&nbsp; blind who became\nknown later as Dhrtarastra. The&nbsp; next day\nSatyavati ordered Ambalika to go and <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lie</span> with Vyasa. Ambalika on entering the\nbed chamber went pale on seeing the ugly Vyasa and the result was&nbsp; she got a child that was pale white in\ncolour. That&nbsp; child became known as\nPandu. The third day Satyavati asked her servant-maid to go and <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lie</span> with Vyasa.&nbsp; She did it with pleasure and she remained\nhappy and&nbsp; cheerful during the whole\nperiod. The result was she got a beautiful child who became an intelligent\nscholar of&nbsp; great wisdom. He was known\nlater as Vidura. (Chapters 1, 63, and 105, Adi Parva) .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PUNJIKASTHALA. A nymph.\nShe was the servant- maid of Brhaspati. One day she was collecting flowers or\nher Guru in a garden when a set of young men and women came to the garden for\namorous sports.&nbsp; They were roaming about\nin the garden in pairs doing&nbsp; all sorts\nof <span style=\"background-color: white;\">erotic</span> acts and Punjikasthala stood watching&nbsp;\nthem for some time with <span style=\"background-color: white;\">passion </span>aroused in her. She&nbsp; returned to the asrama thinking all the way\nabout her&nbsp; miserable lot of having no\nhusband to enjoy a similar&nbsp; life. She was\nfull of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust</span> when she returned to the asrama and on seeing Brhaspati she caught\nhold of him&nbsp; by the hand and pleaded to\nsatisfy her<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> passion</span>.&nbsp; Brhaspati was angry\nat this improper request and&nbsp; cursed her\n\"You have become rotten. You have be- come <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful </span>by seeing the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>\nsports of others. May you be born as a monkey. Get out of this aframa.\"&nbsp; Punjikasthala came to her senses and\nregretting her&nbsp; hasty act begged her Guru\nto grant her release from&nbsp; the curse.\nBrhaspati felt pity on her and said \"Go and&nbsp; enjoy to your full <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>life with a lover\nwhom you&nbsp; like best. Then you will get a\nson from the vitality of&nbsp;&nbsp; Siva. When\nthat son is born you will be released from&nbsp;\nthe curse and you will go to heaven.\"&nbsp; She became immediately a monkey girl named\nAnjana&nbsp; and started living in a forest of\nthat name itself. She&nbsp; fell in love with\na monkey boy named Kesari there and&nbsp; lived\nfor many years enjoying an <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> life. She did not get a child even after\nseveral years and then she&nbsp; prayed to\nSiva for a child.&nbsp; It was at that time\nthat Parvati and Paramevara&nbsp; played<span style=\"background-color: white;\">\namorous</span> sports in the form of monkeys and&nbsp;\nParvati became <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant</span>. Parvati expressed reluctance&nbsp; to be the mother of a monkey child and then\nSiva by&nbsp; his divine powers deposited his\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> virile through&nbsp; Vayubhagavan (god\nof wind) into the womb of&nbsp; Anjana who was\nthen praying to him for a child. Coming to know of this through Narada and\nfearing&nbsp; that his lordship over the\nmonkeys would be lost if such a monkey were born to Anjana Bali poured into the\nbelly of Anjana molten liquid of pancaloha (five metals). Anjana was not the\nleast injured and she&nbsp; gave birth in due\ncourse to a monkey son who became&nbsp; the\ncelebrated Hanuman, the life-force of the RamaRavana tussle. (Purvakanda, Kamba\nRamayana;&nbsp; Kiskindha Kanda, Valmiki\nRamayana).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The prajapatis, who\nunderstood the wish of Brahma,&nbsp; after\nmutual consultation said: \"You emerged churning&nbsp; our minds. Therefore, you will become famous\nunder&nbsp; the name Manmatha ( he who churns\nthe mind) . You will lay low Siva's haughtiness and conceit. Oh ! best among\nmen, Daksa, chief among the prajapatis, will give you a wife.\"&nbsp; Happily pleased at the above words of Brahma\nKama&nbsp; held up in his hands the bow and\narrows of flowers&nbsp; and decided to shoot\nfive arrows, i.e. harsanam (pleasing or gladdening), Rocanam (attracting or\ntempting),&nbsp; mohanam (deluding or\ninfatuating) , sosanam (weakening) and maranam (killing). He decided to use the\narrows first against Brahma and then against the prajapatis. Accordingly the\narrows shot forth and Brahma&nbsp; and all the\nprajapatis overwhelmed by<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> sexual </span>passion stared at Sandhyadevi. Sandhya also\ngot excited and&nbsp; from her body sprouted\nup 49 parts; 64 kalas (arts) also were born from her. She used incessantly\nagainst&nbsp; The leaders of the world (Brahma\nand others) who were downed by the arrows of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>passion, arrows&nbsp; dear to Manmatha. The expressions of Brahma\nmade&nbsp; Sandhya sick with love. Siva, who\nwas just then travelling along the sky, seeing&nbsp;\nthe boisterous exhibitions of passion by Brahma and&nbsp; others alighted there. He ridiculed Brahma\nfor his dis- play of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">passion </span>towards his own daughter Sandhya and&nbsp; spoke further like this: \"This Kama too\nis a fool. He&nbsp; tested his arrows here\nitself, he has no sense of propriety&nbsp; and\ndiscretion.\"&nbsp; Brahma was thoroughly\nashamed at the words of Siva.&nbsp; He\nperspired and swept with his hands the drops of&nbsp;\nsweat that oozed from his body. With great difficulty he&nbsp; controlled his passion and gave up Sandhya.\nFrom the drops of sweat falling on the ground from the body&nbsp; of Brahma were born the pi trs called\nAgnisvattas and&nbsp; the Barhisadas, the\nformer 64,000 in number and the latter 4,80,000. Drops of sweat from the bodies\nof the prajapatis also fell on the ground and from them were&nbsp; born the Devas. The pi trs called Sornapas\nare the sons of Kratu; those called Svakalikas are the sons of&nbsp; Vasistha; sons of Pulastya are called Ajyapas\nand&nbsp; Havirbhuks are the sons of Aiigiras.&nbsp; Brahma, who was angry that Kama shot his\narrows&nbsp; against him in the presence of\nSiva cursed the former&nbsp; that he would be\nburnt to ashes in the fire of Siva's&nbsp; eyes,\nand Kama trembling with fear at the curse prostrated at the feet of Brahma and\nwept Then Brahma&nbsp; said that though he\nwould die in the fire of Siva's eyes, he would be born again. From the drops of\nperspiration that fell on the ground&nbsp; from\nDaksa's body arose a beautiful woman, and Daksa&nbsp;\ntold Kama that the woman, his daughter would&nbsp; become famous as Rati devl. Daksa gave Rati\nDevi&nbsp; to Kama to be his wife. Thus did\nRati become&nbsp; Kama's wife. (For the second\nbirth of Rati see under Pradyumna and for other details see- under Kama.)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ARgfl-K6M_g/XF1DY5hn_7I/AAAAAAABft0/YPua1TCYYtoHRApG2NaOwbd51zbOeAJWwCLcBGAs/s1600/imagdxes.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"225\" data-original-width=\"225\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ARgfl-K6M_g/XF1DY5hn_7I/AAAAAAABft0/YPua1TCYYtoHRApG2NaOwbd51zbOeAJWwCLcBGAs/s400/imagdxes.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n################<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As&nbsp; desired by her, the King sent her with\nseveral other damsels. The young women went to the forest and made a&nbsp; floating asrama in a boat in which they\nsailed in the river by the side of Vibhandaka's asrama. They stopped the boat\nclose to the asrama and one of the girls enter- ed the asrama when Vibhandaka\nwas not there. She had a talk with RsyaSrnga in the course of which she&nbsp; used all the amorous enchantments ofher <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sex</span>\nto captivate the young Muni. She told him that she was the daughter of a Muni,\nliving in an asrama, three yojanas away.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SAiSlRAYAlMA. A\nMaharsi. The famous Kalayavana was his son, born to him by his wife Gopa.ll.\nSaiSirayana was the priest of King Trigarta. Once the king ordered the sage to\nhave <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>union with his wife Vrkadevi to test his virility. (HarivarMa, \\;\n35; 12).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SHANKARACHARYA &nbsp;prepared himself for the study of the science of\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>love. Just at that time a King called Amaruka&nbsp; died. After asking his disciples to take\nespecial care of his body Sankara entered by yogic power the dead&nbsp; body of Amaruka. The dead King came back to&nbsp; life and his people felt very happy about the\nmysterious happening. Sankara, who had thus entered the body of King Amaruka,\nlived in the palace enjoying&nbsp; all royal\npleasures. He gained practical experience in the matter of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> love from the\nqueens in the palace..<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Sudeva now permitted her dead husband to be\ncremated and meditating upon her chastity she jumped into the funeral pyre. But\nwithin minutes Savana came alive out of the fire with his wife and rose to the\nsky&nbsp; with her. He stayed in the sky for\nanother five days&nbsp; and on the sixth day\nhad the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>act again with&nbsp; her. His<span style=\"background-color: white;\">\nsemen</span> dropped on earth from the sky. The&nbsp;\nKing then with his wife went to Brahmaloka. Samada, Nalini, Pusyati,\nCitra, Visala, Harita and Alinlla, all of them wives of munis saw the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span> in\nthe sky and when it fell into the water they thought it was amrta, which\nconferred eternal youth, and with&nbsp; the\npermission of their husbands swallowed it. As soon&nbsp; as they swallowed it their divine effulgence\nwas diminished and their husbands, therefore, abandoned them.&nbsp; Those women delivered seven children, who\ncried&nbsp; fiercely and that sound filled the\nentire universe. Then&nbsp; Brahma appeared\nand asked the children not to cry and&nbsp; also\ntold them that they would come to be called Maruts. Brahma himself called them\nMaruts. They&nbsp; were the Maruts of the\nfirst Svayambhuva Manvantara.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Parvati did not at all\nrelish the action of the devas and spoke to them thus: \"You prevented my\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> inter- course entered into with the desire to have a son. Therefore, in\nfuture you will not have children by your&nbsp;\nwives.\" Parvati cursed the earth also as follows: \"You will\nbecome one of various forms and also a wife&nbsp;\nto many people. You, who prevented me from having&nbsp; a son, will not enjoy happiness from\nchildren.\" (Valmiki Ramayana, Balakanda, Canto 36).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Birth of Subrahmanya.\nBecause of the power of&nbsp; Siva's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>\nconsumed by Agni, his glow began getting&nbsp;\ndiminished. Agni complained of it to the Devas who&nbsp; sent him over to Brahma. On his way to Brahma\nAgni&nbsp; met Gangadevi whom he told thus:\n\"I can in no way bear this <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> of Siva and if I get rid of it, it will\nburn the entire world. So, you please take charge of it so that you will have a\nnoble son. Ganga 's reply to&nbsp; this was\nsimply to ask Agni to throw the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span> into her waters and Agni did so. As the<span style=\"background-color: white;\">\nsemen</span> had remained&nbsp; with Agni for nearly\n5000 years, his flesh, blood&nbsp; hair, eye\netc. had become golden in colour and hence&nbsp;\nAgni came to be called from that day onwards&nbsp; Hiranyaretas.&nbsp;\nTime passed by and the semen of Siva became a burden&nbsp; to Ganga. She complained about that to\nBrahma.&nbsp; Brahma asked her from whom she\nhad received the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>. Ganga detailed her story to him and concluded&nbsp; by saying that though it was 5000 years since\nSiva's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>was put into her, she did not deliver yet. Then Brahma told her as\nfollows : \"You go to the Udaya&nbsp; mountain\n(where the sun rises). There is a forest there, a forest hundred crores of\nyojanas in extent, where&nbsp; Sara, a\nparticular variety of grass ( Saccharam munja&nbsp;\nRoxb) grows. You deposit the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> there and a male&nbsp; child will be born after 10, 000 years. As\ndirected by Brahma Ganga went to the Udaya&nbsp;\nmountain and deposited the foetus there through her&nbsp; mouth.&nbsp;\nBy the power of Siva's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> all the trees and animals&nbsp; and birds in the forest became golden in\ncolour. When 10,000 years were completed a child, as effulgent&nbsp; as the rising sun, was born and Subrahmanya\nwas the&nbsp; child. The child cried in a\nthunderous voice and six divine Krttikas who came that way saw the child and taking\npity on it vied with one another to breast-feed&nbsp;\nit. Since the child looked at the six Krttikas one after the other it\ndeveloped six faces and since it was breast-fed by Krttikas it came to be named\nKarttikeya as well.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-oO1AMGixN90/XF06fB7cEPI/AAAAAAABfss/VmFUPepY_IISKqLlYaDjmr2RBpRnhjXEACLcBGAs/s1600/imgages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"194\" data-original-width=\"259\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-oO1AMGixN90/XF06fB7cEPI/AAAAAAABfss/VmFUPepY_IISKqLlYaDjmr2RBpRnhjXEACLcBGAs/s400/imgages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n##################<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Visravas, son of Brahma\nand Kaikasi daughter of Suma.li lived in the forest called Slesmataka. Once\nKaikasi had a<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> sexual </span>union with Visravas at an&nbsp;\nuntimely hour. As a result of this union, Kaikasi&nbsp; gave birth to four children at intervals of\none Yama&nbsp; each. These children were,\nRavana, Kumbhakarna,&nbsp; Vibhisana and\nSurpanakha. (Kamba Ramayana, Bala&nbsp; Kanda).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;My name is Somaprabha. There is my elder\nbrother Devaprabha who lives on the Malaya mountain. My brother had a wife\nnamed Rajavatl. Once all the three of us went to worship in a Visnu temple at a\nplace called Siddhavasa. At that time my sister-in-law sang a devotional&nbsp; song. A Siddha who was enchanted by her song\nwas&nbsp; looking fixedly at her. Enraged at\nit, my brother asked&nbsp; the Siddha why he\nwas staring at his wife with <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful</span> eyes. The innocent Siddha was naturally\nprovoked by&nbsp; the question and pronounced\na curse that my brother&nbsp; and his wife\nwould be born in human wombs and in that birth, he would see his wife having\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>union&nbsp; with a stranger. When I\nheard my brother being cursed&nbsp; I became\nvery angry. I hurled a toy elephant which was in my hand at the time, at the\nSiddha. He then&nbsp; cursed me also to become\na white elephant just like the toy with which I hit him<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once a few nymphs came\nto bathe in the Mahakall pond and as per the instructions of Mahakala,\nThinthakarala took away their robes while they were bathing. He demanded a\nnymph named Kalavati in return for their robes and finding no other way they\ngave him&nbsp; Kalavati.&nbsp; Kalavati thus became the wife of a Man due to\na curse of Indra. Once she praised <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> enjoyment with men on earth and\ndecried the same with Devas. Indra heard&nbsp;\nit and he cursed her \"Then lei her become the wife of a man on earth\nand enjoy the pleasures there.\" All this story Thinthakarala learned from\nKalavati. She added&nbsp; she wanted to go to\nDevaloka the next day for a dance&nbsp; with\nRambha. Thinthakarala consented and he also went&nbsp; to Devaloka and saw the dance, sitting along\nwith the Devas. When Rambha's dance was over, there was the dance&nbsp; of a goat. Seeing that Thinthakarala said to\nhimself:&nbsp; \"Why, this is a goat I\nused to see daily in Ujjayini. How&nbsp; did\nit come here to dance?\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">########################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He obtained a boon from\nBrahma that his death would occur only when the Visnu Kavaca was removed from\nhis body and the&nbsp; chastity of his wife\nwas lost. At that time Sankhacuda&nbsp; and\nTulasi met each other in the forests and were&nbsp;\nmarried. Sankhacuda, brilliant and majestic, went&nbsp; about with Tulasi in <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> sports creating\njealousy even among the devas. His arrogance gave innumerable troubles to the\ndevas and they along with Brahma and Siva approached Mahavisnu for a remedy.&nbsp; Visnu then sent Siva with his spike to kill\nSankhacuda&nbsp; and he himself started to\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">molest</span> the chastity of his wife&nbsp; Tulasi.\nSaiikhacuda took leave of Tulasi to go&nbsp; and\nfight with Siva. When Tulasi was thus left alone,&nbsp; Mahavisnu in the form of Sankhacuda\napproached&nbsp; Tulasi and after some\npreliminary talks entered into <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>acts. Tulasi found some difference in the\nusual&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> sexual </span>methods and suspecting foul\nplay jumped up to curse the impostor. At once Mahavisnu appeared in&nbsp; his true form and said \"You have been\ndoing penance&nbsp; for a long time to get me\nas your husband. Your&nbsp; husband Sankhacuda\nwas the chief of my Parsadas,&nbsp; Sudama. It\nis time for him to go back to Goloka getting himself released from the curse.\nBy this time Siva&nbsp; would have killed him\nand he would have gone to Goloka as Sudama. You can now abandon your body&nbsp; and come with me to Vaikuntha to enjoy life\nas my wife. Your body will decay and become a holy river named&nbsp; Gandaki: your hair will become Tulasi plant\nthe leaves of which will be held sacred in all the three worlds.\" ulasi\nthen changed herself into the form of LaksmI and went to Vaikuntha with\nMahavisnu. (9th Skandha, Devi Bhagavata)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iRJqoXhdnOs/XF1DutndnmI/AAAAAAABfuA/s3qiBTkGm-kWs9HBHwokKCiZs7S1KQqmwCLcBGAs/s1600/05035d5ssea88c214993619db50134fa817e6d67-wm.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"920\" data-original-width=\"640\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-iRJqoXhdnOs/XF1DutndnmI/AAAAAAABfuA/s3qiBTkGm-kWs9HBHwokKCiZs7S1KQqmwCLcBGAs/s400/05035d5ssea88c214993619db50134fa817e6d67-wm.jpg\" width=\"277\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n##################<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Love of Vayu. Once\nBhagavan Vayu happened to see the six beautiful daughters of Kusanabha, a king,\nand he was excited<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> sexually</span>. As the princesses refused to satisfy his desire,\nVayu changed the damsels into hunchbacks, by a curse.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Visnudatta stood\nundecided, but the others pressed him&nbsp; on\nand they continued their journey. Next day by evening they reached a village of\nforest tribes. After walking through the village they reached the house of a\nwoman.&nbsp; They got her permission to stay\nthere for the night.&nbsp;&nbsp; They all lay in a\ncorner. Immediately all slept. Visnudatta alone lay awake. When the night\nadvanced, a man entered the house. The woman and the man&nbsp; talked for a while and carried on <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span>\nsports, and&nbsp; they lay together and slept.\nA light was burning in the room. Visnudatta saw everything through the cleavage&nbsp; of the shutters, and thought. &lt;( I am\nsorry that we have come to this house. He is not her husband. Sure ! she is a\nharlot.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AMOGHA. Santanu\nMaharsi's wife. Once Brahma&nbsp; visited\nSantanu Maharsi's Asrama. As the Maharsi was&nbsp;\nnot at home, it was Amogha who received the guest&nbsp; with due reverence. Fascinated by the\nirresistible charm of Amogha, Brahma had an involuntary emission of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal</span>\nfluid. He felt ashamed of his own weakness and left the Asrama immediately. The\nMaharsi&nbsp; who returned to the Asrama soon\nafter, came to know&nbsp; from his wife whose<span style=\"background-color: white;\">\nsemen</span> it was. He asked Amogha to accept Brahma Deva's precious <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> and not to\nlet it be wasted. Being a devoted wife, she accepted it, but&nbsp; unable to bear the divine <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnancy,</span> she\ndeposited it in the water lying in the valley of the Yugandhara mountain. From\nthat time, it became a place of holy bath, known as Lohita. It was by bathing\nin this holy&nbsp; water that Parasurama\nwashed away his sin of annihilating the Ksatriyas. (Padma Purana, Srsti Khanda,<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ASVATTHAMA. ) Birth and\ngenealogy. The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>of Bharadvaja Rsi fell into the hollow of a bamboo and\nfrom there was&nbsp; born Drona. As per the\ninstructions of his father Drona&nbsp; married\nKrpi, daughter of the sage, Saradvata. The&nbsp;\ngood-natured Krpi gave birth to Asvatthama. (See under Drona for\ngenealogy). (Chapter 130, Adi Parva, M.B.)<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#########################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bhrgu was born again in\nVaivasvata Manvantara. This second birth was at the famous Brahmayajna of\nVaruna. Hie was reborn from fire, as Brahma's son. This child who was born from\nBrahma's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>which f</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">ell in the sacrificial\nfire, was brought up by Varuna&nbsp; and his\nwife Carsani. Consequently Bhrgu is referred to as \"Varunaputra\" and\n\"Carsanlputra\" in some&nbsp; Puranas.\nSince he was born at Varuna's yaga he is sometimes called \"VarunI\nBhrgu\".</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Everybody who witnessed\nthe sacrifice of Paramesvara, who was in the&nbsp;\nform of Varuna, was greatly pleased. Seeing the pleased&nbsp; celestial maids standing in rows passion\narose in Brahma.&nbsp; He had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal\n</span>discharge. Aditya (the Sun) took the&nbsp; earth\non which the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> fell and threw it into the sacrificial fire, which blazed\nfuriously. Brahma who became the offerer of oblation had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">discharge </span>again. He\ngot it in the sacrificial ladle and with recitation of spells<span style=\"color: red;\"> offered&nbsp; it in the sacrificial fire</span> as if it was ghee.\nThe powerful <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> contained the three attributes of Sattva, Rajas&nbsp; and Tamas. From the attribute of Rajas arose\nthe living world which had activity as its purpose. Radiance&nbsp; is the quality of Sattva which entered the\nliving and nonliving world. It gives light to everything. It also gives the\npower of discrimination. From the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> offered&nbsp;\nin the fire, three sons with body and the attributes of&nbsp; demi-gods came out. The male who had\noriginated from&nbsp; the flame called\n'Bharjana' became Angiras. The male who originated from the burning coals\nbecame Kavi..<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BRHASPATI. The teacher\nof the devas (Gods). 1) Birth. The father of Brhaspati was Angiras, the son of\nBrahma. Brahma grew amorous, at the sight of some celestial maids who were\npresent at a sacrifice performed by Rudra ; and he had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal </span>flow. Brahma put\nthe<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span> in fire. From that fire the devas such as Marici, Bhrgu, Angiras and\nothers were born.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seeing this Indra was\nflurried. So he sent the celestial maid Alaihbusa to break the penance of\nDadhlca some- how or other. Alarhbusa came to the hermitage of Dadhlca and\nbegan to dance and sing. When the hermit saw her he grew lustful and<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> seminal</span>\ndischarge occurred to him. The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> fell in the river Sarasvati, who be- came\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant</span> and in due course gave birth to a child. She took the child to the\nhermit Dadhlca and told him the story of the child. The hermit was much\npleased.&nbsp; He took the child and embraced\nit and blessed the river Sarasvati thus : \"Brahma, the gods and the\ncelestial maids will be pleased if your water is offered as oblation.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Angiras, the son of Brahma, had two sons,\nUtathya and Brhaspati. One day when Utathya was away from home, Brhaspati\napproached his elder brother's wife, Mamata, who was <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant </span>at the time, and\ntried to have <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> union with her. But she tried to dissuade him and said\n\"The child in my womb, born from Utathya's<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen </span>has already mastered&nbsp; Vedas and Vedarhgas. Your<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen </span>is also\nequally powerful. How can my womb bear the combined force of the two <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semens</span>? So\nplease refrain from this attempt of yours.\" But even after hearing these,\nwords of his&nbsp; sister-in-law, Brhaspati\nwas not able to control his&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">passions. At the time\nof the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">intercourse</span>, when the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> of Brhaspati entered the womb, the child\nwithin&nbsp; it cried out \"Father ! this\npassion is improper. Two&nbsp; persons have no\nplace here. So withdraw your <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>.\" Brhaspati did not heed the request.\nThe child in the womb repelled the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> that entered the womb with his foot\nand it dropped on the floor. Brhaspati who&nbsp;\nbecame angry, cursed the child. As a result, the boy&nbsp; was born blind. He got the name \"Dlrghatamas\"\n. because he was born blind. (M.B. Adi Parva, Chapter 104) .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bharadvaja went to\nbathe in the river. When he got into the river he saw the celestial maid\nGhrtaci. The celestial maid ran away as soon as she saw the hermit. But her\ncloth was caught in grass and slipped off her body.&nbsp; When the hermit saw the complete form&nbsp; ' of her body&nbsp;\nwhich was bright and beautiful, he had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal </span>discharge.&nbsp; The discharged <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>was kept in a Drona\n(trough). A child was born from that and he was named&nbsp; Drona, who was brought up in the hermitage.\n(M. B. Adi Parva, Chapter 13).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1mEpPgJeNdo/XF06I1IkC9I/AAAAAAABfsg/M-K9_18poAg74aJQrW43uEzrU29-sJP-wCLcBGAs/s1600/ffydownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"375\" data-original-width=\"500\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-1mEpPgJeNdo/XF06I1IkC9I/AAAAAAABfsg/M-K9_18poAg74aJQrW43uEzrU29-sJP-wCLcBGAs/s400/ffydownload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While Siva and Parvati\nassumed I he form&nbsp; of monkeys and enjoyed\nthemselves in the forest Parvati&nbsp; got\npregnant, and Siva took the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span> from the womb&nbsp;\nand gave it to Vayu (wind God.) Vayu deposited it in the womb of Anjana,\nwho delivered a son named Hanuman. Siva assumed the form of an elephant\n(tusker) and Parvati that of a she-elephant. Parvati delivered a son in the\nform of an elephant. That son was named Ganapati. (Uttara Ramayana)<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vyasa did not like the\npresence of Ghrtaci. Fearing the curse of Vyasa she assumed the form of a\nparrot and flew away.&nbsp; The beauty of\nGhrtaci as also the flight of the parrot&nbsp;\nkindled erotic feelings in Vyasa and <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal </span>emission&nbsp; occurred. The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> fell on the stick used\nfor producing fire, and without knowing the fact he went on&nbsp; using the sticks for producing fire. And,\nthen did&nbsp; appear from it a son of divine\nlustre. That son became&nbsp; reputed in later\nyears as sage Suka. (Devi Bhagavata, Prathama Skandha).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once sage Bharadvaja\nwas taking his bath in the Ganga., Ghrtaci also came to bathe. On the banks of\nthe river her clothes caught something and were removed from their position.\nThe sight of it caused <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal </span>emission to the Sage. The&nbsp; <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> thus emitted was kept in a Drona,\n(bamboo cup)&nbsp; and when it was due the\nDrona broke and out&nbsp; of it came a child.\nIt was this child which, in later years, became so very famous as the great\nDronacarya.&nbsp; (Adi Parva, Chapter 149) .\nOn another occasion also, the sight of Ghrtaci caused <span style=\"background-color: white;\">emission</span> in Bharadvaja, and\nSrutavati or Sruvavatl was the noble daughter born out of it. (Salya Parva,\nChapter 48, Verse 63)<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many and different are\nthe stories about the birth of Hanuman told in Puranic literature, and they are\nbriefly noted below.&nbsp; (1) The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen\n</span>discharged by Siva, whose erotic&nbsp; feelings\nwere excited by the sight of Visnu disguised&nbsp;\nas MohinI was received by the Saptarsis and deposited . in the womb of\nAnjana, and Hanuman was born out of it. (Siva Purana, Satarudrasamhita).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#########################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Paramesvara and Parvati once had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">intercourse</span>\nat Vitala, a section of Patala and their <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>formed itself into the river\ncalled Hatakl. (Bha-gavata, 5th Skandha) . HAVANA. One of the eleven Rudras.\n(AnuSasana Parva, Chapter 150, Verse 13).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#########################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The River Ganga\ndeposited Siva's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> on a high peak of Himavan and Subrahmanya was born from it.\n(Kama Parva, Chapter 44, Verse 9) .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Saradvan was born as the son of&nbsp; Sage Gautama. Saradvan started a penance for\nacquiring divine arrows. Devendra who was alarmed, sent the Apsara woman\nJanapati to obstruct his tapas. Deeply&nbsp; affected\nby her irresistible charm and fascinated by&nbsp;\nher temptations, he had an involuntary emission of&nbsp; <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>, which fell on the Sarastamba and split\nitself into two parts. Two children a boy and a girl, were born&nbsp; from it. The King's servants brought them to\nHastinapura. The boy was named Krpa and the girl was named Krpi. (M.B. Adi\nParva, Chapter 130).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##########################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then Agni deprived them\nof the power of speech by a&nbsp; curse. After\nthat he went and hid himself on the Mandara mountain. Elephants and parrots\ndisclosed the secrets of Agni, who was hiding within the hollow&nbsp; of the trunk of a tree. Agni deprived them of\ntheir tongues by a curse. At last the gods discovered Agni.&nbsp; They sent him at once to Siva to stop him in\nhis amorous dalliance. Agni succeeded in his mission by&nbsp; his intense heat. Siva transferred his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>\nto Agni who&nbsp; became pregnant. Being\nunable to bear its weight Agni&nbsp; deposited\nit in the river Gariga, who at the behest of&nbsp;\nSiva himself, left it in the woods on the Mahameru mountain. Siva's\nattendant bhulas (spirits) offered Puja to it there. After a thousand years a\nboy with six faces (Subrahmanya) was born out of it. He was suckled by the\nKrttikas employed for that purpose by&nbsp; Parvati\nand the boy grew up with astonishing rapidity&nbsp;\nwithin a few days. Having been suckled by the&nbsp; Krttikas, the boy got the name\n\"Karttikeya\".<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a hermitage in the\nthick forest on the shores of Iksumatl lived a sage, Mankanaka performing\npenance. One day the beautiful nymph Menaka, came there from above. As a wind&nbsp; blew, her upper garment was displaced. Seeing\nher&nbsp; bare body, Mankanaka had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">emission</span>.\nThe<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen </span>of the sage fell into a Kadali (plantain) tree and from&nbsp; there arose a maiden, extremely beautiful.\nBecause she was born from Kadali she was called Kadallgarbha.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This Naraka is for the\ntorture of those who perform Yaga by killing cows to display their wealth and\nsplendour. They will have to remain there uring the whole term of their\npunishment under the constant flogging of Yama's servants. (18) Laldbhaksam.\nThis is the Naraka for lustful people. The lascivious fellow who makes his wife\nswallow&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span>, is cast into this hell.\nLalabhaksam is a sea of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>. The sinner lies in it feeding upon <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> alone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Though born in a family\nof Sages Saradvan evinced more interest in Dhanurveda. He performed penance in\nthe forest, with bow and arrows deposited by his side. As his penance gathered\nintensity the Devas got alarmed. To break his penance Indra&nbsp; deputed the Devata called Janapadi to the\nearth and&nbsp; she appeared before Saradvan\nand danced, dressed only&nbsp; in one piece of\ncloth.<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> Emission </span>occurred to him. But,&nbsp; wisdom\ndawned on him immediately and leaving behind&nbsp;\nhim the bow, arrows and deer skin he quitted the&nbsp; place.&nbsp;\nThe <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>discharged by him fell on the arrow which&nbsp; broke into two giving birth to a male child\nand a&nbsp; female one.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rtadhvaja, son of\nSvarocisa Manu had seven heroic&nbsp; sons.\nThey went to Mahameru and began to worship&nbsp;\nBrahma for gaining Indra's place. Indra was alarmed.&nbsp; He sent the Apsara woman Putana to the sons\nof Rtadhvaja to obstruct their tapas. There was a river flowing&nbsp; by the side of their asrama. Rtadhvaja's sons\ncame to the river to take their bath. Just at that time, Putana,&nbsp; also came there and began to take bath. At\nher sight,&nbsp; the young men had an\ninvoluntary emission of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>. Sankhim, wife of the crocodile MahaSarikha\nswallowed&nbsp; it. The princes whose tapas\nwas interrupted returned&nbsp; to the palace.\nPutana returned to Indra and reported the matter.&nbsp; After some years, Sankhini happened to be\ncaught in a fisherman's net. The fisherman caught her and informed Rtadhvaja's\nsons about his catch. They took her to the palace and put her in a tank there.\nIn due course&nbsp; Sarikhini gave birth to\nseven children. Immediately&nbsp; after that\nshe attained moksa. The children began to cry &nbsp;for mother's milk, moving about in the water.\nThen&nbsp; Brahma appeared to them and told\nthem not to cry&nbsp; and assured them that\nthey would become the Devas of&nbsp; \"Vayu\nSkandha\". He took them up to the sky and put&nbsp; them in Vayuskandha. These children were the\nMaruts&nbsp; of the Svarocisa Manvantara.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;################</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vasistha was pleased to\nhear that and he circumambulated Brahma and prostrated before him and then went\nto the asrama of Mitravarunas. He then abandoned his body there and merged with\nthe brilliance of Mitravarunas. One day Urvagi with&nbsp; her companions came to the asrama of\nMitravarunas&nbsp; and attracted by her charm\nthey spent a night with&nbsp; her. Their <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>\nat one time fell into a jar nearby and from it were born two people, Agastya\nand Vasistha, (Skandha 6, Devi Bhagavata).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SarasvatidevI came to\nthe place of his residence in the guise of a very attractive woman. Mankana had\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal</span> emission on seeing her and the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> fell on the surface of the water.\nThe sage stored the water with <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> in a pot and soon seven sons were born\nfrom it.
