They&nbsp; all became sages named\nViiyuvega, Vayubala,&nbsp; Vayuha,\nVayumandala, Vayujvala, Vayuretas and&nbsp; Viiyucakra.\n(Chapter 83, Vana Parva and Chapter 38,&nbsp; Salya\nParva).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">########################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The soul of Vasistha\nparted from his body on account of the curse of Nimi, saluted Brahma, went to\nthe asrama of Mitravarunas and got mixed with their effulgence. Meanwhile\nUrvas'I one day came to the aSrama of Mitravarunas, who had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal</span> emission at\nher sight. The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> fell into a pot. The pot duly burst open and there emerged\nfrom it Agastya and&nbsp; Vasistha. Nimi\nreturned to the Yajna hall and told the munis&nbsp;\nabout the curse on him of Vasistha. While the munis were helplessly\nlooking on, Nimi's body got separated from the soul and fell down. The munis\nplaced the dead body in an uncovered coffin, kept it free from putrefaction\nwith the help of medicines and mantras<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###########################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once Sri Krsna met\nRadhadevI at Rasamandala and in seclusion they spent in <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>sport the period\nof one day of Brahma. Then Krsna selecting an auspicious time dropped his vital<span style=\"background-color: white;\">\nfluid </span>into her womb at the end of the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>sport. Tired by the prolonged\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">carnal</span> sport and shaken by the impact of the hot <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> RadhadevI pers pired\nprofusely and the exhaustion produced deep and long breaths. The whole universe\nwas covered with her sweat and her sighs became the goddess of the life-giving breaths\nof all created animals. From the left side of goddess was born Vayupatni and to\nher were born the Pancapranas. Besides these, another five younger pranas were\nalso born. From the sweat of the Devi was born Vavuna and from the left side of\nVaruna was born&nbsp; Varunanl. (9th Skandha,\nDevi Bhagavata).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus the jivatma takes\nthousands of births going to and from the moon. The jivatma coming back from\nthe moon evolves from a plant to man. Plants are the food of man and the soul\nentering the plant enters the purusabija (<span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>virile) through food. The souls\ncoming out as rebirths do accept wombs according to a definite principle. In the\norder of the merit of their good deeds on earth&nbsp;\nthey are born in Brahmin, Ksatriya, Vaisya or Sudra wombs. The souls\nwith great sins are born as worms and insects. This passage of the soul from\nearth to Candra and vice versa is called Pitryana.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was at that time\nthat Parvati and Paramevara played <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> sports in the form of monkeys and Parvati\nbecame<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> pregnant.</span> Parvati expressed reluctance to be the mother of a monkey\nchild and then Siva by&nbsp; his divine powers\ndeposited his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> virile through&nbsp; Vayubhagavan\n(god of wind) into the womb of&nbsp; Anjana\nwho was then praying to him for a child. Coming to know of this through Narada\nand fearing&nbsp; that his lordship over the\nmonkeys would be lost if such a monkey were born to Anjana Bali poured into the\nbelly of Anjana molten liquid of pancaloha (five metals). Anjana was not the\nleast injured and she&nbsp; gave birth in due\ncourse to a monkey son who became&nbsp; the\ncelebrated Hanuman, the life-force of the RamaRavana tussle. (Purvakanda, Kamba\nRamayana;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(ii) The Sage Gautama\nalias Saradvan experienced <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal</span> emission on seeing Rambha and from the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>\nwas born KrpI whom in due course of time Dronacarya married. (\nKathasaritsagara, Madanamancukalambaka, Taranga 6) .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day, Rksarajas went\nto a lake to quench his thirst. Seeing his own image reflected in the water, he\nthought&nbsp; it was some enemy and jumped\ninto the lake, to attack him. But he soon realized his mistake and&nbsp; returned to the shore. As soon as he came out\nof the&nbsp; water, he felt that he had become\na woman. Seeing her&nbsp; fascinating beauty,\nIndra and Surya were filled with&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> lustful</span>\npassion. Both of them had involuntary emission&nbsp;\nof <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>. Bali was born from Indra's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> which&nbsp; fell on the head and Sugrlva was born from\nSurya's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> which fell on the neck of Rksarajas. Towards the&nbsp; end of the night, Rksarajas lost his female\nform and re- gained his former shape as a male. At once he took the&nbsp; two children with him to Brahma and told him\nthe whole story. Brahma sent a messenger with Rksarajas&nbsp; and had him anointed king of Kiskindha. After\nthe time of Rksarajas, Bali became king of Kiskindha.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once sage Vibhandaka\nhappened to see Urvasl at Mahahrada. At the very sight of her, the sage had an nvoluntary\nemission of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>. The<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen </span>fell in the water and just then a female deer came\nthere to drink&nbsp; water. It swallowed the\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>with water and in due&nbsp; course\nbecame <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant</span> and gave birth to a human&nbsp;\nchild. But the child had the horns of a deer. Consequently Vibhandaka\nnamed the boy \"RsyaSrnga\". <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is mentioned in\nMahabharata, Salya Parva, Chapter 51, Verse 7, that Sarasvata was the son of\nDadhica. Dadhica once happened to see the celestial maid Alambusa and became\nexcited, and <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal</span> discharge occurred to him. The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> fell in the river\nSarasvati. The river became <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant</span> and delivered a child. This child grew up&nbsp; and became the famous hermit named Sarasvata.\nAfter the death of the hermit Dadhici, due to scarcity&nbsp; of rain a great famine occurred which lasted\nfor twelve&nbsp; years. When the famine became\nunbearable all the hermits on the basin and banks of the river Sarasvati&nbsp; began to migrate to other places leaving all\ntheir possessions behind, to save their lives. But Sarasvata&nbsp; alone remained on the banks of Sarasvati,\nliving on&nbsp; fish obtained from the river,\nengaged in meditation and study of Vedas.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Satyavati was the\ndaughter of the celestial maid Adrika. Because of a curse she lived as a fish\nin the river Ganges. Once the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> of King Uparicaravasu happened to fall in\nthe Ganges and this fish swallowed it in consequence of which it became&nbsp; <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant</span>. A fisherman caught this fish and\ncut it. He&nbsp; ot two human babies, male and\nfemale from the stomach of the fish. The fisherman gave the two&nbsp; infants to the jKing who took the male child.\nThis&nbsp; child later became the Matsya King.\nThe female child &nbsp;had the smell of fish.\nThe King called her MatsyaGandhi (She who has the smell offish) and gave her&nbsp; back to the fisherman, who took the child to\nhis hut&nbsp; and brought her up as his\ndaughter. As the child was dark in complexion the fisherman called her Kali.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Sudeva now permitted her dead husband to be\ncremated and meditating upon her chastity she jumped into the funeral pyre. But\nwithin minutes Savana came alive out of the fire with his wife and rose to the\nsky with her. He stayed in the sky for another five days&nbsp; and on the sixth day had the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>act again\nwith her. His <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> dropped on earth from the sky. The&nbsp; King then with his wife went to Brahmaloka.&nbsp; Samada, Nalini, Pusyati, Citra, Visala,\nHarita and&nbsp; Alinlla, all of them wives of\nmunis saw the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span> in the sky and when it fell into the water they thought it\nwas amrta, which conferred eternal youth, and with the permission of their\nhusbands <span style=\"background-color: white;\">swallowed </span>it. As soon&nbsp; as they\nswallowed it their divine effulgence was diminished and their husbands,\ntherefore, abandoned them.&nbsp; Those women\ndelivered seven children, who cried&nbsp; fiercely\nand that sound filled the entire universe. Then&nbsp;\nBrahma appeared and asked the children not to cry and&nbsp; also told them that they would come to be\ncalled Maruts. Brahma himself called them Maruts.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#########################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SRUTAVATl. Daughter of\nBharadvaja Muni. Once Bharadvaja happened to see the Apsara woman Ghrtaci and\nhe had an involuntary emission of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>. Srutavati was born from that <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>.\nShe observed an austere tapas with the object of getting Indra as her husband. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once Siva and Parvati\nstarted the marital act and it did not come to a close even after a hundred divya\n- years, with the result that the world shook like anything. Frightened at this\nthe Devas requested Siva to stop the act and he obliged them. Then he asked\nthem who would bear the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> which had been&nbsp;\ndischarged and they replied, \"Let earth itself bear the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>.\"\nAccordingly it was discharged on the earth.&nbsp;\nIt filled and over-flowed forests and mountains.&nbsp; What next was the problem. Ultimately the\nDevas&nbsp; asked Agni (fire) to consume it.\nWhen Agni consumed&nbsp; and burnt it down\nabsolutely, the ashes thereof formed into a white hill and it became a forest.\nParvati did not at all relish the action of the devas and&nbsp; spoke to them thus: \"You prevented my\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> inter- course entered into with the desire to have a son. Therefore, in\nfuture you will not have children by your wives.\" Parvati cursed the earth\nalso as follows: \"You will become one of various forms and also a wife to\nmany people. You, who prevented me from having a son, will not enjoy happiness\nfrom children.\" (Valmiki Ramayana, Balakanda, Canto 36).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ejFiOOUS62Q/XF059J0NAOI/AAAAAAABfsc/tPeEnvv88rEYCi83XVJzQJP0TIemUdyQQCLcBGAs/s1600/dddownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"225\" data-original-width=\"225\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ejFiOOUS62Q/XF059J0NAOI/AAAAAAABfsc/tPeEnvv88rEYCi83XVJzQJP0TIemUdyQQCLcBGAs/s400/dddownload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Birth of Subrahmanya.\nBecause of the power of Siva's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>consumed by Agni, his glow began getting&nbsp; diminished. Agni complained of it to the\nDevas who&nbsp; went him over to Brahma. On\nhis way to Brahma Agni&nbsp; met Gangadevi\nwhom he told thus: \"I can in no way&nbsp;\nbear this <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> of Siva and if I get rid of it, it will burn the entire\nworld. So, you please take charge of it so that you will have a noble son.\nGanga 's reply to&nbsp; this was simply to ask\nAgni to throw the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span> into her waters and Agni did so. As the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> had\nremained&nbsp; with Agni for nearly 5000\nyears, his flesh, blood hair, eye etc. had become golden in colour and hence Agni\ncame to be called from that day onwards Hiranyaretas.&nbsp; Time passed by and the semen of Siva became a\nburden&nbsp; to Ganga. She complained about\nthat to Brahma.&nbsp; Brahma asked her from\nwhom she had received the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>. Ganga detailed her story to him and concluded&nbsp; by saying that though it was 5000 years since\nSiva's<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen </span>was put into her, she did not deliver yet. Then&nbsp; Brahma told her as follows : \"You go to\nthe Udaya&nbsp; mountain (where the sun\nrises). There is a forest there, a forest hundred crores of yojanas in extent,\nwhere&nbsp; Sara, a particular variety of\ngrass ( Saccharam munja&nbsp; Roxb) grows. You\ndeposit the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> there and a male&nbsp; child\nwill be born after 10, 000 years. As directed by Brahma Ganga went to the Udaya&nbsp; mountain and deposited the foetus there\nthrough her&nbsp; mouth.&nbsp; By the power of Siva's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> all the trees\nand animals&nbsp; And birds in the forest\nbecame golden in colour<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n#################<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Skanda was born from\nthe <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> of Siva which&nbsp; fell into Agni.\nSo he got the name Skanda. (Skand fall). (M.B. Vana Parva, Chapter 225, Verse\n16) .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The sage Vyasa once\nwished to have a son. So he began to worship Siva for the purpose. His desire\nwas to have a son who would combine in him&nbsp;\nthe essential qualities of fire, earth, water, air and ether&nbsp; He did tapas for a hundred years. Because of\nthe&nbsp; austerity of his tapas, his locks of\nhair began to blaze&nbsp; like flames of fire.\nAt last Siva appeared and blessed him to have a son according to his wish.&nbsp; After receiving his boon, Vyasa returned to\nhis asrama. Soon after his arrival there, an Apsaras named GhrtacI came there\nin the form of a parrot. On seeing her eauty Vyasa had an involuntary emission\nof<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span>.&nbsp; Suka's birth was from this\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>. (For further details see Para 2, under GhrtacI).&nbsp; 2) Sukd's Boyhood. It was Siva who performed\nthe Upanayana (wearing the sacred thread) ceremony of&nbsp; Suka. Since he was born out of the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>\nwhich was&nbsp; the result of the fascination\nfor a parrot, the boy was named \"Suka\".<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">######################<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day the king\ndecided to go to hunt. On the same day his wife had her <span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">monthly course.</span> Still\nwithout changing his programme he started for the forest. Even after entering\nthe forest the thought of his wife lingered in his mind. The forest was in full\nbloom as it was Spring. Seeing this the king grew amorous and sat under a tree.\nA mild breeze was blowing.&nbsp; Instantly the\nking had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal </span>flow. He collected the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>in the leaf of a tree and sent it\nto the queen&nbsp; through an eagle. Thinking\nthat to be some food, another eagle got near and a quarrel arose. The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>&nbsp; fell in the river Yamuna. A fish named Adrika\nswall- owed it. (See under Adrika). A fisherman caught that&nbsp; fish. He got a male child and a female child\nfrom the&nbsp; stomach of the fish. That girl\nis the famous Satyavati<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The aggrieved Vasistha\nwent to his father Brahma and complained about the curse. Brahma told Vasistha.&nbsp; \"You penetrate the brightness of Mitravarunas\nand&nbsp; stay there. In due course you will\nget a birth which is not of a womb.\" Hearing these words, Vasistha reached&nbsp; the hermitage of Mitravarunas. &nbsp;He left his body there and fused himself into\ntheir effulgence. During this period Urvasi came to that hermitage. Seeing her,&nbsp; Mitravarunas had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal</span> flow. The<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span> fell\nin a&nbsp; pot. From the pot two bright and\nhandsome sons were&nbsp; born. The first of\nthem was Agastya and the second&nbsp; Vasistha.\n(Devi Bhagavata, Skandha 8).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prajapati Bhrgu, who\ndied in the sacrifice of Daksa took birth as the son of Varuna and CarsanT.\nDevi Jyesjha, the daughter of Priest Sukra was another wife of Varuna. The\nchildren ofJyesfha were&nbsp; Bala, Sura the\nSuranandini andAdharmaka the destroyer of the elements. The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> of Varuna\nfell on Valmlka (White-ant-hill) from which the great hermit&nbsp; Valmlki was born.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VAYUCAKRA. A hermit. It\nis mentioned in Mahabharata, Salya Parva, Chapter 38, Stanza 32, that this\nVayucakra was born from the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> kept in a pot by the hermit called Mankanaka.\nFrom this same pot some&nbsp; other hermits\nsuch as Vayubala, Vayujvala and others were born. (See under Mankanaka, Para\n3).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">########################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is mentioned\ninMahaBharata, Vana Parva, Chapter 231, Stanza 16, that once the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>of Siva\nfell scattered over the trees and that these goblins were born from that. Human\nflesh is the food of these goblins. It is said those who want&nbsp; children need only worship these Vrddhikas.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When king Vasu of Cedi\nwent to the forest for hunting, he saw the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">coition</span> of animals and he had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal\n</span>discharge. The king sent that <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> to his queen. But on the way it fell in the\nriver Kalindi and was eaten by a fish. This fish was a celestial maid&nbsp; named Adrika transformed to fish by a curse.\nThe fish conceived and got into the net of a fisherman, who lived on the banks\nof Kalindi. When this fish was cut open a male and a female infant were seen\ninside..<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Birth rituals and\nceremonies, according to the custom, were conducted by Vyasa. As he was born\nfrom the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen </span>discharged at the sight of the Suka (parrot) the infant was\nnamed Suka. As soon as he was born Suka began to grow by divine power and\nshortly became a boy of shining radiance. After investiture with the&nbsp; Brahma-string, the boy was sent for education\nto the hermitage of Brhaspati, the teacher of the devas. Suka&nbsp; completed his education with Brhaspati and\nhaving&nbsp; performed Samavarta and offering\nof gift to the teacher,&nbsp; he returned home\nto his father.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#####################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Varuna approached\nUrvasi with lustful desire, but rejecting him Urvashi accepted Mitra. Varuna\nhad <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal </span>flow and this<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span> was taken and kept in a pot. At the sight of\nthis, remorse and passion arose Urvasi and the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span> of Mitra already received in\nher womb <span style=\"background-color: white;\">oozed</span> out and fell on the ground. This also was collected and kept in\nthe same pot along with that of Varuna. After a few days the pot broke open by\nitself and two babies came out. One was Agastya and the other Vasistha. As\nthese two were born of the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> of Mitra and Varuna, they came to be known &nbsp;as Maitravarunis later..<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#######################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the dikpalakas\n(zone guardians of the universe) including Siva participated in the yaga. Seeing\nthe beautiful wives of the sages Siva had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">emission</span>.&nbsp; Taking the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> in his hand he put it into\nthe fire. Agni carried it to Ganga and requested her to take it for conception.\nThough she at first refused she took it, became<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> pregnant </span>and finally delivered\na male child&nbsp; whom she threw into the\nforest Saravana. It was this child who became known as Karttikeya or\nSubrahmanya later on. (Chapter 85, Anusasana Parva, M.B.).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#######################</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a Sudra scoffs a\nKsatriya his tongue should be cut off. If a Sudra advises a Brahmin, he may\ninflict any punishment on the Sudra.&nbsp; If\na Sudra wronged a Brahmin, the Sudra might be&nbsp;\npunished by cutting off the organ which was employed&nbsp; in the crime. If one spat at a Brahmin, the\ntwo lips of the culprit might be cut off. If a man passed urine on a Brahmin\nthe culprit would have his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">penis </span>cut off. If a Sudra sits on the seats of the\nupper classes his buttock will have to be cut off.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(13) Vajrakantakasdli.\nThis Naraka is for the punishment&nbsp; of\nthose who have unnatural <span style=\"background-color: white;\">intercourse </span>with cows and&nbsp; other animals. Here, the guilty people are\nmade to embrace iron images full of diamond needles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###########<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(15) Puyodakam. This is\na well, filled with <span style=\"background-color: white;\">excreta</span>, urine, blood, phlegm etc. Brahmanas and others who\nhave <span style=\"background-color: white;\">intercourse</span> with women of low caste against&nbsp; customs, ordinances etc. vagabonds who wander\nabout&nbsp; irresponsibly like animals and\nbirds and other such&nbsp; sinners are cast\ninto this Naraka.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ParvatI and one day\nwhile bathing in a pond in the garden she sent Sulaksana to fetch some clothes\nfor her. Siva who was then in Parvati's chamber alone, lost his control when he\nsaw the beautiful Sulaksana and had&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> intercourse</span>\nwith her. The maid was perplexed and then Siva assured her that she would give\nbirth to a child only after her marriage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###########<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was here that the\ngreat sage, Gautama, lived with his beautiful consort, Ahalya. Once Indra had\nan <span style=\"background-color: white;\">intercourse</span> with her privately and Gautama coming to know of the misdeed\ncursed her and turned her into&nbsp; stone. By\nthe curse of the same sage Indra lost his&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\">\ntesticles</span>. Greatly aggrieved by this loss Indra prayed to god Agni for\nhelp and on the advice of Agni the&nbsp; devas\nremoved the deformity by placing a goat's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">testicles </span>instead.\" (Slokas 48\n&amp; 49, Bala Kanda, Valmiki&nbsp; Ramuyana).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: red; color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\"><b>ANDWAAAH CHALA GAYA REEEH !</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">It was in this forest situated in Arhbadi that\nSri Krsna with his cowherd chums conducted his childhood exploits. There was a\nvery huge tree of name Bhandlra in this forest and it was under this great tree\nthat Krsna and his friends met daily for their <span style=\"background-color: white;\">play</span>. This forest is on the northern\nbank of Gaiiga in front of Kesighatta in Vrndavana. The Puranas proclaim that\nit was here that Brahma conducted the marriage of Krsna withRadha. (Chapter 38,\nSabha Parva, Daksinatya Pa jha, M.B.).</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once Sri Krsna and his\nconsort Radha were amusing themselves by<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> amorous </span>pleasures in a remote and\nsecluded place. When they were tired they wished to drink some milk. At that\ntime, Sri Krsna&nbsp; created by his will\npower, the cow Surabhi and the&nbsp; calf\nManoratha, from the left side of his body. Sri- daman milked that cow into a\nnew earthen pot and when Sri Krsna was drinking it, the pot fell down and he\nmilk was spilt all over the floor. The milk which spread over an area of 100\nyojanas, became a lake called \"Kslrasagara\" for Radha and her maids\nto bathe&nbsp; and enjoy water-sports.\nNumerous cows were born from the pores of Surabhi and they were presented to\nthe Gopas by Sri Krsna. (Devi Bhagavata, 9th Skandha).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;At the advent of the spring the melody&nbsp; of Krsna's flute rendered the Gopa women\nlove-lorn. He went to Vrndavana with his flute, and all the Gopa women, both\nmarried and unmarried followed&nbsp; him. Krsna\nmade a futile attempt to send them back to their houses. But, the love-sick\nGopa women did not. Suddenly Krsna disappeared from among them, and the Gopa\nwomen mad with love roamed about Vrndava- na with Radha calling \"O Krsna !\nKrsna !\" Suddenly&nbsp; Krsna appeared\nbefore them. He entered the waters of the Kalindi with them and <span style=\"background-color: white;\">satisfied </span>them.\nSri Krsna&nbsp; thus explained Bhaktiyoga to\nthe world. (Bhagavata, 10th Skandha).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Krsna once went with\nViraja, the GopI woman, to the hall of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">enjoyment</span> ( rasamandalam ) &nbsp;Knowing about&nbsp;\nit Radha followed them to the hall, but both of them&nbsp; were not to be seen. On another occasion when\nRadha found Viraja in the company of Krsna and Sudama&nbsp; she, in great anger, insulted Krsna whereupon\nSudama&nbsp; cursed her to be born in human\nwomb and experience the pangs of separation from Krsna. (Narada Purana 2. 8;&nbsp; Brahmavaivarta Purana. 2. 49) and Radha\ncursed him&nbsp; in turn to be born in the\ndanava dynasty. It was on&nbsp; account of\nthis curse of Radha that Sudama was born as the asura called Sankhacuda.\n(Brahma Vaivarta Purana, 2. 4. 9. 34) .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Due to a curse of Radha, Sudama, the cowboy,\nwas born on earth as a demon&nbsp; named\nSankhacuda. He did penance sitting at BadarikaSrama and obtained Visnukavaca.\nAnother object of&nbsp; his was to marry\nTulasi. He obtained a boon from&nbsp; Brahma\nthat his death would occur only when the Visnu Kavaca was removed from his body\nand the&nbsp; chastity of his wife was lost.\nAt that time Sankhacuda nd Tulasi met each other in the forests and were&nbsp; married. Sankhacuda, brilliant and majestic,\nwent&nbsp; about with Tulasi in <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> sports\ncreating jealousy even among the devas. His arrogance gave innumerable troubles\nto the devas and they along with Brahma and Siva approached Mahavisnu for a\nremedy. Visnu then sent Siva with his spike to kill Sankhacuda&nbsp; and he himself started to <span style=\"background-color: white;\">molest</span> the chastity\nof his wife&nbsp; Tulasi. Saiikhacuda took\nleave of Tulasi to go&nbsp; and fight with\nSiva. When Tulasi was thus left alone, Mahavisnu in the form of Sankhacuda\napproached&nbsp; Tulasi and after some\npreliminary talks entered into <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> acts. Tulasi found some difference in the\nusual&nbsp; <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> methods and suspecting foul\nplay jumped up to curse the impostor<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##########<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Once Sri Krsna duped Radha and took the\ncowherdess Viraja to trie region of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">loveplays</span>. A mischievous maid informed\nRadha of this. Radha ran to the dancing garden and searched for the couple. Sri\nKrsna had made himself invisible. So she&nbsp;\ncould not find him. She found out Viraja. Radha opened her eyes wide and\npretended that she was about to curse her. Viraja was terrified and she melted\nand be- came a river; full of anger Radha went home. (Devi Bhagavata, Skandha\n9) .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">AMOROUS SPORTS MEANS\nFUCKING !<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">AND LIKE ZAKIR NAIK\nVETTMA MANI KNOWS WHICH CHAPER , WHICH KANDA , WHICH PURANA \u2013WOKAY ?</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ANAUPAMYA. Wife of Banasura.\nOnce she developed an<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> amorous i</span>nterest in Narada. which led to some&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">domestic quarrels.\n(Padma Purana, Adikfinda, Chapter 14).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Atala is the first world\nof Patala. There reigns Bala, the son of Maya who is the famous&nbsp; but haughty magician. He has cieated 96 Mayas\nwho are capable of granting all kinds of desires. Even now certain persons who\nare interested in the practice of&nbsp; Black\nmagic, learn some of these 96 arts and practice them. When this mighty fellow\nopens his mouth for yawning, three groups of women known as PumScalls,&nbsp; Svairinis and KaminTs emerge from his mouth.\nHe has with him a rasayana called hataka with which he can eaisly entice and<span style=\"background-color: white;\">\nseduce</span> all who enter Atala and to strengthen them for satisfying his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust</span>.\nAfter enticing&nbsp; them with it, he enjoys\nuncontrolled pleasure with&nbsp; them,\nshowering on them his amorous glances, bewitch-ng smiles and embraces. (Devi\nBhagavata, Asjama Skandha)<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-BBLWl9hUEGc/XF2bVlKMEaI/AAAAAAABfvM/Jpp20plKZeogBhQHeoAZCSoRxG3QNgXpQCLcBGAs/s1600/imaM3Dges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"194\" data-original-width=\"259\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-BBLWl9hUEGc/XF2bVlKMEaI/AAAAAAABfvM/Jpp20plKZeogBhQHeoAZCSoRxG3QNgXpQCLcBGAs/s400/imaM3Dges.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bali is the son of\nIndra. There is a story about the birth of Bali as follows: SllavatI who was\ndevoted to her husband once carried&nbsp; her\nhusband Ugratapas who was a leper, on her shoul- der to the house of a harlot\none night. On the way&nbsp; they saw the\nhermit Animandavya, who had been&nbsp; placed\non a trident by the order of the King, beating&nbsp;\nhis limbs with agony. Lying on the trident he saw&nbsp; Ugratapas. Seeing the amorous nature of\nUgratapas Animandavya cursed him that before sunrise he would&nbsp; die. SilavatI who was a woman of great purity\nand&nbsp; loyalty hearing the curse said,\n\"Let the Sun not rise tomorrow.\"&nbsp;\nNext day, though it was time the sun did not rise. The&nbsp; night prolonged. Aruna the charioteer was\nready at the&nbsp; usual time but saw the Sun\nsitting motionless. Wasting time was intolerable to the charioteer. So he\ndecided to make the best use of the time at his disposal by&nbsp; witnessing a little of the dance of the\ncelestial beauties&nbsp; in the realm of the\ndevas. But males had no admittance&nbsp; there.\nSo Aruna took the shape of a beautiful woman&nbsp;\nand got in. Seeing a new person, very beautiful to look at, sitting in\nthe midst of the celestial maids Indra&nbsp; grew\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>. He secretly took her to a dark place&nbsp;\nand a son was born out of that<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> coition</span>. That son is Bali. When Aruna\nreturned the Sun was standing full of anger. Being afraid of him Aruna\nconfessed everything&nbsp; to the Sun. When he\nheard the whole story the Sun expressed his desire to see that figure which\nAruna had adopted. Accordingly Aruna again became a woman.&nbsp; The Sun also had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">coition </span>with her and Sugriva\nwas&nbsp; the son born out of this <span style=\"background-color: white;\">coition</span>.\nBali and Sugriva were brought up by AhalyadevI in the hermitage of Gautama.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The swans who were the&nbsp; vehicles of BrahmidevI were dancing in one\nplace,&nbsp; intoxicated by drink. Canda, the\ncrow, who was Alambusa's vehicle, also joined their company. Completely&nbsp; absorbed in their delirious raptures, the\nintoxicated swans indulged so freely in their <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous </span>pleasures with&nbsp; Canda that they became<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> pregnant.</span> At last when\nthe&nbsp; merry-makings ended and all of them\ndispersed, the swans became aware of their plight and informed Brahml about it.\nThe gracious goddess (Brahml) told them that in their present state they were\nunable to discharge&nbsp; heir duties in\ndrawing her chariot and so they were allowed to go and enjoy themselves\nwherever they liked. After this she entered into a trance. The swans in the\nfullness of time, gave birth to twentyone sons.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The father of Brhaspati was Angiras, the son\nof Brahma. Brahma grew amorous, at the sight of some celestial maids who were\npresent at a sacrifice performed by Rudra ; and he had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal</span> flow. Brahma put\nthe <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>in fire. From that fire the devas such as Marici, Bhrgu, Angiras and\nothers were born.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Growing amorous on the\nwife of elder brother. A story stating how Bphaspati begot a son by the wife of\nUtathya is given in Skandha 9 of Bhagavata. Mamata, the wife of Utathya, was\npregnant. Brhaspati had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">coition </span>with her when her husband was away. The mother\nand the child in the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">womb</span> who opposed the act of Brhaspati were cursed. Mamata\ngave birth to two children. Fearing that her husband might cast her out&nbsp; she left the son of Brhaspati in the forest\nand was about to go, when there was a divine voice from above, \"Mudhe,\nBharadvajamimam bhara dvajarh Brhaspate.\" \"You senseless woman, bring\nup this one born of the two. Brhaspati, bring up this one born of the two.\"\nHearing this ethereal voice Brhaspati took the&nbsp;\nchild and gave him the name Bharadvaja and brought&nbsp; him up. After that the child was given to\nemperor &nbsp;Bharata. The famous archer Drona\nwas the son of this Bharadvaja.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.Anjana. the mother of&nbsp; Hanuman was a servant of Brhaspati in her\nprevious&nbsp; birth. Her name then was\nPunjikasthall. She once went&nbsp; to fetch\nwater. At that time many Vidyadhara young&nbsp;\npeople, both male and female, came there and engaged&nbsp; in <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous </span>acts. Punjikasthall witnessed\nthese love- scenes for a long time and then returned home. It is mentioned in\nKampa Ramayana that Brhaspati&nbsp; cursed her\nto be born in the next birth as a female&nbsp;\nmonkey.&nbsp; Anjana gave birth to\nHanuman. When he grew up&nbsp; Hanuman desired\nto learn Vedas and Sastras (scriptures). Hanuman approached Brhaspati to learn\nfrom&nbsp; him. But Brhaspati was not prepared\nto teach a monkey who jumped about everywhere<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6oXIMa7W83o/XF2bL38XlBI/AAAAAAABfvI/FbOWaFu3gkwjXlbNonU8m0hI_cFHSP7iwCLcBGAs/s1600/ima50ges.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"237\" data-original-width=\"213\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6oXIMa7W83o/XF2bL38XlBI/AAAAAAABfvI/FbOWaFu3gkwjXlbNonU8m0hI_cFHSP7iwCLcBGAs/s400/ima50ges.jpg\" width=\"359\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brhaspati the teacher-priest\nof the devas&nbsp; had a very beautiful wife\nnamed Tara. One day seeing&nbsp; the handsome\nfigure of Candra, Tara became <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>. Candra was the Disciple of Brhaspati. It\nwas not right on the part of the wife of the teacher to feel <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous&nbsp;</span> towards a disciple. Brhaspati came to know of\nthe&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">affair and sending for\nCandra asked him to return his wife. Both Candra and Tara did not pay any heed\nto Brhaspati. Both sides were about to engage in a battle. The devas arrayed\nthemselves on both sides. Seeing</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">that\nthis was not an honourable thing some devas</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">tried for a compromise. Finally Candra returned Tara</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">to Brhaspati. At this time Tara was <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant</span>.\nBoth</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Candra and Brhaspati claimed the\npaternity of the</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">child in the womb of\nTara, who witnessed that Candra</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">was the\nfather of the child. All accepted the words of</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;\n</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Tara. Budha was the child Tara gave birth to</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Budha grew up to be&nbsp; a youth. During the period the King Sudyumna\none day entered Kumaravana (a forest) and was changed to a woman. When the King\nbecame a woman the name&nbsp; adopted was I\nla, who grew <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> of Budha. The&nbsp; famous\nKing Pururavas was the son born to them.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When once Dharmaputra\nwas&nbsp; closeted with Pancali in <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>\ntalks Arjuna by mistake entered the room and was thus compelled as per&nbsp; a previous mutual agreement to go on a\npilgrimage for a&nbsp; year. During this exile\nhe married the serpent girl Ulupi.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At the invitation of\nIndra Arjuna went to devaloka&nbsp; and\nCitrasena taught him dance and music. It was&nbsp;\nduring this visit that Arjuna threw a cold blanket on the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>\napproaches of Urvasi and was consequently&nbsp;\ncursed by her to be an eunuch. It was through Citrasena&nbsp; that Indra sent word to Urvasi to console\nArjuna and&nbsp; give relief from the curse.\n(Chapters 45 and 46, Vana Parva).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suktimatl was a river\nflowing through the capital city&nbsp; of the\nkingdom of Uparicara. Once the mountain&nbsp; Kolahala\ndriven by<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> amorous</span> desires subdued Suktimatl.&nbsp;\nThe next morning on finding no river in its place the people were\nsurprised. The news reached the ears of the King. He became furious and rushing\nto the mountain&nbsp; gave it a hard kick. It\ncreated a hole in the mountain&nbsp; and the\nriver flowed through it<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-J1c8MNOFogw/XF2a4EhpsuI/AAAAAAABfu8/b26gnBUH_dwWJ0EUbNZiCsTeOTN8GxWcACLcBGAs/s1600/downFFR5load.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"230\" data-original-width=\"219\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-J1c8MNOFogw/XF2a4EhpsuI/AAAAAAABfu8/b26gnBUH_dwWJ0EUbNZiCsTeOTN8GxWcACLcBGAs/s400/downFFR5load.jpg\" width=\"380\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day, Siva and&nbsp; Parvati began their <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> dalliance. They\ndid not&nbsp; stop it even after a hundred\nyears. The whole world&nbsp; egan to shake to\nits very foundations. Fearing that the world might perish, the dcvas, as\nordered by Brahma prayed to Agni, to interrupt the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous </span>play&nbsp; of Siva and Parvati. Agni, who understood\nthat it was&nbsp; not possible to achieve\ntheir object, fled and concealed himself under water. The Devas went out in\nsearch&nbsp; of Agni. By that time, the\ncreatures in the water who could not bear the heat of Agni, told them the\nsecret. Then Agni deprived them of the power of speech by a&nbsp; curse. After that he went and hid himself on\nthe Mandara mountain. Elephants and parrots disclosed the secrets of Agni, who\nwas hiding within the hollow&nbsp; of the\ntrunk of a tree. Agni deprived them of their tongues by a curse. At last the\ngods discovered Agni.&nbsp; They sent him at\nonce to Siva to stop him in his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> dalliance. Agni succeeded in his\nmission by&nbsp; his intense heat. Siva\ntransferred his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen t</span>o Agni who&nbsp; became<span style=\"background-color: white;\">\npregnant</span>. Being unable to bear its weight Agni&nbsp;\ndeposited it in the river Gariga, who at the behest of&nbsp; Siva himself, left it in the woods on the\nMahameru&nbsp; mountain. Siva's attendant\nbhulas (spirits) offered Puja to it there. After a thousand years a boy with\nsix faces (Subrahmanya) was born out of it. He was suckled by the Krttikas\nemployed for that purpose by&nbsp; Parvati and\nthe boy grew up with astonishing rapidity within a few days. Having been\nsuckled by the Krttikas, the boy got the name \"Karttikeya\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;There was a lake there on the banks&nbsp; of which was sage Devala engaged in penance.\nHuhu,'le Gandharva had once come to this lake with a number of Apsara women and\nthey indulged in <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous&nbsp; </span>sports, which\nDevala did not like. He cursed Huhu and&nbsp; tusned\nhim into a crocodile, and the crocodile lived in the same lake. Indradyumna who\nwas turned into an elephant, stepped&nbsp; into\nthe lake to drink water when the crocodile caught&nbsp; hold of its hind leg. Neither did the\nelephant yield nor&nbsp; the crocodile leave\nthe former free. Their tug of war&nbsp; ontinued\nfor 1000 years when Mahavisnu appeared on the scene, killed the crocodile and\nsaved the elephant. At once the elephant was re-transformed&nbsp; into Indradyumna and he attained Vaikuntha\n(the abode of Visnu) . (Bhagavata, 8th Skandha)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the course of&nbsp; his wanderings through the forest as a\nRaksasa, Kalmasapada happened to come across a Brahmana youth&nbsp; engaged in<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> amorous </span>pleasures with his wife\nAngirasi.&nbsp; The King caught hold of the\nyouth and killed him. His&nbsp; wife, the\nBrahmani wept loudly and after cremating her&nbsp;\nhusband's body in a funeral pyre, jumped into it and&nbsp; burnt herself to death. Just before her death\nshe pronounced a curse on Kalmasapada that if he touched&nbsp; any woman in future he would die immediately.&nbsp; After the death of the Brahmana couple, the\nsin of&nbsp; Brahmahatya (killing of Brahmana)\ncontinued to pursue Ka Imasapada in the form of a terrible monster<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;As years passed and Kama grew up into a youth,&nbsp; Mayavatl began to make <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> advances\ntowards&nbsp; him. Looking upon her with\nregard due to a mother,&nbsp; Kama was\ndispleased with these advances. Then she told him what Narada had disclosed to\nher about their rela- tions in the past life. She advised him to kill Sambara&nbsp; and to leave the place for Dvaraka as soon as\npossible.&nbsp; As advised by her, Kama killed\nSambara and both he and Mayavatl went to Dvaraka in a Vimana and paid&nbsp; their respects to their parents there. In the\npresence of a large number of sages, Kama was christened \"Pradyumna\".\nAniruddha, the husband of Usa, was the son of Pradyumna<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kjCfCdGIK20/XF2atW2ksOI/AAAAAAABfu4/B0dhQzE4p80rUJf8lL1uRIqxBy96J8aRwCLcBGAs/s1600/dowCWnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"236\" data-original-width=\"213\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kjCfCdGIK20/XF2atW2ksOI/AAAAAAABfu4/B0dhQzE4p80rUJf8lL1uRIqxBy96J8aRwCLcBGAs/s400/dowCWnload.jpg\" width=\"361\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Jamadagni's wife,\nRenuka swept and cleaned the Asrama and went to the river Reva to fetch water\nand Parasurama was left behind in the Asrama.&nbsp;\nWhen she reached the river bank, she saw Kartaviryarjuna&nbsp;&nbsp; indulging in <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous </span>pleasures with his\nwives in the water. She waited unobserved on the bank for some&nbsp; time and after they had left the place, she\nstepped into the river. But since the water was muddy, she had to go to another\nplace in the river to get clear water. There also she lingered for a few\nminutes, looking at the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> amusements of Citraratha, King of Salva,&nbsp; with his wives. It was only after they had\ndeparted&nbsp; that she was able to return to\nthe Asrama with water. Meanwhile Jamadagni who had returned to the Asrama&nbsp; earlier was angry at her delay and was\nwaiting impatiently for her arrival. As soon as she reached the Asrama,&nbsp; the sage, in a fit of fury, ordered Parasurama to cut&nbsp; off her head and the latter\nobeyed him.
