( Brahmanda Purana, Chapter 58).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In the country of Kosala there was once a\nbrahmin named Gathi. He went to the forests and standing there in water in a\npond, immersed up to his neck, started doing penance. For eight months he did\npenance thus and then Mahavisnu appeared before him and asked him what boon&nbsp; he wanted. The brahmin said he wanted to see\nMayadevi. Visnu granted the boon and disappeared. Several years passed after\nthat and nothing happened. One day the brahmin as usual went to bathe in a\npond. When he took a dip in the waters he forgot all his prayers and mantras.\nThere was a change of mind. He&nbsp; felt he\nwas lying dead in his house. Relatives were&nbsp;\nsitting around weeping. His wife was in tears and was&nbsp; holding his legs. In an atmosphere of\nmourning, his own&nbsp; people weeping\nbitterly carried his body to a frightening&nbsp;\nburial ground and put it on a funeral pyre. It was burnt&nbsp; to ashes. He then felt himself in the womb af\na Candala&nbsp; woman living in a village near\nHunamandala. 'the foetus developed and a black boy was born. The boy&nbsp; grew passing the stages of infancy, childhood\nand boy- hood and became a man, black and stout. He started enjoying <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span>\nlife with a beautiful candala girl. The&nbsp; <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>\nplays were done on leaf-beds, in ' creeper-huts, bushes and in caves and soon\nmany evil-natured sons were born to him.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Garuda could understand\nhim because of&nbsp; he power of the pill and\nso flew swiftly back to Mahavisnu and told him what he saw. Mahavisnu knew that\nParvati had been deceived by&nbsp; Jalandhara.\nSo he decided to cheat Vrnda, wife of Jalandhara. Mahavisnu filled with <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous\n</span>desires, avoiding MahalaksmI, covering his head with a&nbsp; yellow scarf and taking the figure of another\nperson by&nbsp; his yogic powers stepped out\nof his abode taking Ananta&nbsp; for his\ncompany. He went to Durga.ka.nana the abode o</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">f Vrnda. They\nconstructed an asrama there and the wild animals like the lion, tiger, boar,\nbear and monkey became their disciples taking human form. Then Visnu</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">created mental agony in Vrnda to attract her\nto his as\"rama. Vrnda started getting <span style=\"background-color: white;\">hot</span> and her maids</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">fanned her continuously and anointed her with\nsandalwood paste</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nalayani alias\nIndrasena was the wife of Maudgalya. Even though the wife was young&nbsp; and the husband old, Nalayani was very\nchaste. The&nbsp; sage became very old,\ngrey-haired and rugous, skeletonlike with a foul smell emanating from his body.\nHe&nbsp; was always in an angry mood. Still\nNalayani stuck to him as a chaste, loving and dutiful wife. As time&nbsp; passed on Maudgalya became a leper. One day\nwhile&nbsp; the sage was eating, a finger of\nhis broke and fell into the rice. With great calmness and devotion Nalayani&nbsp; removed the finger from the rice and ate the\nrice. Greatly pleased at this act of hers the sage asked her&nbsp; what boon she wanted an 1 she replied she\ndesired to have an <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous </span>life with him as Pancasarira. Maudgalya granted her\nthe boon and they both travelled the whole world enjoying an <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> life. When\nthe sage took the form of a mountain Nalayani became a &nbsp;&nbsp;river and when the sage took the shape of a\nflowering&nbsp; tree she became a creeper on\nit. They spent&nbsp; thousands of years like\nthat and then Maudgalya became tired of a <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> life and returned to the&nbsp; ascetic life. Even after such a long period\nof erotic&nbsp; life Nalayani was still\nlustful and she resented the&nbsp; decision of\nher husband to go back to the life of a hermit. She begged her husband to continue\nthe same life for some more time. Maudgalya got cross when she thus caused\nhindrance to his penance and&nbsp; cursed her\nsaying that she would in her next life be born as the daughter of the King of Pancala when she&nbsp; would have five husbands to satisfy her <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust</span>.\nGreatly&nbsp; grieved at this curse she\npractised severe austerities standing in the midst of Pancagni. Pleased with\nher&nbsp; penance Siva appeared before her and\nblessed her sayng that she would be born in her next birth in a very&nbsp; noble family and she would then have five\nhusbands,&nbsp; good-natured, doing godly work\nand equal in valour&nbsp; to Indra. She then\npleaded that she should be granted the boon to remain a virgin during the\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">coitus</span> with each of her husbands. Siva granted that wish.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then a beautiful damsel&nbsp; appeared before him and the king talked with\nher and&nbsp; their conversation ended in the\nking requesting her to be his wife. The beautiful maiden consented on one&nbsp; condition that she should not be made to\ntouch water. The king agreed and by that time the king's followers came and the\nking took her to his palace in a decorated&nbsp;\npalanquin followed by his retinue. The king took her&nbsp; to a secret chamber and stayed with her\nallowing no- body to enter the room. The chief minister came to the palace and\nenqired what was happening there and&nbsp; the\nmaidens attending on the queen said that it was&nbsp;\nstrange that no water was allowed inside the room. Then the minister\narranged a garden with beautiful&nbsp; flowers\nand fruits with no water anywhere and a pond&nbsp;\nin the middle in which water was not visible from&nbsp; outside. He then went to the king and told\nhim of his arrangement and the king took his wife into the garden&nbsp; and started having <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous </span>sport with her\nthere. After some time they reached the pond ; water was not&nbsp; visible and so they entered the pond. The\nmoment&nbsp; they entered the pond they\ntouched water and the&nbsp; queen disappeared\nin the water. The King asked the&nbsp; water\nof the pond to be emptied and then he saw a frog sitting at the bottom. The\nking accused the frog&nbsp; of having eaten\nthe maiden and he started killing all the frogs of his state. The frogs became\nfrightened and&nbsp; hey went to their king\nand complained. The frog king in the garb of a maharsi went and requested the\nking to stop this massacre of frogs but the king refused to yield saying that a\nfrog had eaten his wife.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sati blossomed into a\nbeautiful maiden and all the Prajapatis joined together and made Siva marry\nher. The bride and bridegroom lived in the bride's house. At that time the sage\nDurvasas worshipped Jagadambika seated at Jambunada meditating on her and\nreciting the mayabija mantra. The devi was immensely pleased and appearing\nbefore him gave him the divine garland lying&nbsp;\nround her neck. The garland was highly perfumed.&nbsp; Honey flowed from it always. Wearing that\ngarland the sage travelled through air and reached the palace of&nbsp; Daksa, father of Sati, and gave that garland\nto him.&nbsp; Daksa received it with great\ndelight and took it to his bed-room and placed it there. That night Daksa\ninhal- ed the perfume of the divine garland and enjoyed an <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> sport with\nhis wife. This act made the garland&nbsp; impure\nand the latent curse in it made Daksa hate his daughter Sati and her husband\nSiva. After that Daksa&nbsp; conducted a Yaga\nand insulted Siva by not inviting either him or his wife. Sati, however,\nattended the Yaga&nbsp; uninvited and she was\ninsulted. Unable to bear the insult Sati leapt into the fire and committed\nsuicide<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZE45ou2MIJE/XF2aF3wlvtI/AAAAAAABfuw/_IoQcjJay_A-V08326gty1HfJyJA0gYbgCLcBGAs/s1600/imC4ages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"192\" data-original-width=\"262\" height=\"293\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZE45ou2MIJE/XF2aF3wlvtI/AAAAAAABfuw/_IoQcjJay_A-V08326gty1HfJyJA0gYbgCLcBGAs/s400/imC4ages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It was because of a\ncurse of Parvati that devas do&nbsp; not get\nsons by their own wives. There is the following&nbsp;\nstory behind that. Siva and Parvati went to the Himalayas after their\nmarriage and started living there. Siva and Parvati were so much engrossed in\ntheir <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> sport that they were oblivious of the happenings outside. After a\nlong&nbsp; time when their sport continued\nwithout a break the&nbsp; devas went in and\ninformed Siva that the whole universe was trembling by their sport and if Siva\nproduced a&nbsp; son the world would be\nincapable of bearing it and so he should withdraw from the act of producing a\nchild. Siva agreed and drew his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">virile </span>strength upwards.&nbsp; Parvati did not like that and she cursed the\ndevas that they would never have sons of their own wives. ( Chapter 84,\nAnus'asana Parva).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">PINGALA . A woman of\nthe city of Ayodhya. Once&nbsp; this woman\napproached Sri Rama with <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>&nbsp; intentions\nand Sri Rama who was strictly observing a vow of one-wife refused to satisfy\nher desire and said : \"During the incarnation of Krsna you will be born as\na&nbsp; servant maid of Karhsa and then I will\nin my form as Krsna accept you.\"&nbsp; Slta\non hearing this cursed Pingala. She said \"Oh&nbsp; beautiful woman who has approached my husband&nbsp; with <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> intentions, you will have three\nbends in your body when you are born next as the servant maid&nbsp; of Kathsa.\" Pingala weeping bitterly\ncraved for pardon and then Slta said that Krsna would make her&nbsp; perfect. (Vilasa Kanda, Ananda Ramayana).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The dramatic troupe\ncomprised among&nbsp; others many Yadava\nsoldiers, Sri Krsna, Pradyumna&nbsp; and his\nbrothers, all in disguise. Their drama was Ramayana. The performance was superb\nand even Vajranabha&nbsp; stood amazed at their\nskill. The troupe was encamped in another palace and treated as royal guests.\nThe companion maid of Prabhavati, Sucimukhl, united her with&nbsp; Pradyumna during the dark hours of the night\nand they spent the nights in<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> amorous </span>sports. The daughters of&nbsp; Vajranabha's brother, CandravatI and Gunavati\ncame&nbsp; to know of these secret meetings\nand they requested&nbsp; Prabhavati to find\nout suitable persons among the Yadavas for them also to enjoy with. Prabhavati\nintro- duced them to Gada and Samba both sons of Krsna.&nbsp; The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> sports of all of them continued\nfreely during the nights.&nbsp; When things\nprogressed so far, Indra and Krsna persuaded Pradyumna to kill Vajranabha<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Gandharvas and Kinnaras\nof both sexes lived&nbsp; inside the city. A\nGandharva of name Lalita fell in love with a Gandharva lady named Lalita and\nthey&nbsp; lived there happily enjoying\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous </span>sports. One day&nbsp; Pundarikamukha\nheld a music concert in which Lalita was asked to sing as the leading musician.\nHis love Lalita was absent at the assembly and Lalita could&nbsp; not sing or dance in proper form that day.\nKarkataka,&nbsp; a serpent chief, privately\ninformed his King the reason&nbsp; for the\npoor display of Lalita that day. The King got&nbsp;\nangry and cursed Lalita thus : \"Wicked one, you will be born as a\nman-eating raksasa. This is the penalty&nbsp; for\nthinking about your wife while singing for me.\"&nbsp; Lalita immediately became an ugly,\nfierce-looking&nbsp; demon<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day she was\ncollecting flowers&nbsp; for her Guru in a\ngarden when a set of young men and women came to the garden for <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> sports.&nbsp; They were roaming about in the garden in\npairs doing&nbsp; all sorts of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">erotic</span> acts and\nPunjikasthala stood watching&nbsp; them for\nsome time with <span style=\"background-color: white;\">passion</span> aroused in her. She&nbsp;\nreturned to the asrama thinking all the way about her&nbsp; miserable lot of having no husband to enjoy a\nsimilar life. She was full of<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> lust </span>when she returned to the asrama and on\nseeing Brhaspati she caught hold of him by the hand and pleaded to satisfy her\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">passion</span>. Brhaspati was angry at this improper request and cursed her \"You\nhave become rotten. You have be- come lustful by seeing the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> sports of\nothers. May you be born as a monkey. Get out of this ashrama.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-stnGcQW288A/XF2ZyyDMYBI/AAAAAAABfuk/f-RxCjFDNgE_JriAPeeBm-WB2vhZg2N1wCLcBGAs/s1600/downXXload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"225\" data-original-width=\"225\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-stnGcQW288A/XF2ZyyDMYBI/AAAAAAABfuk/f-RxCjFDNgE_JriAPeeBm-WB2vhZg2N1wCLcBGAs/s400/downXXload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Brhaspati felt pity on her and said \"Go\nand enjoy to your full <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span> life with a lover whom you&nbsp; like best. Then you will get a son from the\nvitality of&nbsp; Siva. When that son is born\nyou will be released from&nbsp; the curse and\nyou will go to heaven.\"&nbsp; She became\nimmediately a monkey girl named Anjana and started living in a forest of that\nname itself. She&nbsp; fell in love with a\nmonkey boy named Kesari there and&nbsp; lived\nfor many years enjoying an <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> life. She did not get a child even after\nseveral years and then she&nbsp; prayed to\nSiva for a child.&nbsp; It was at that time\nthat Parvati and Paramevara&nbsp; played\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> sports in the form of monkeys and&nbsp;\nParvati became <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant</span>. Parvati expressed reluctance&nbsp; to be the mother of a monkey child and then\nSiva by&nbsp; his divine powers deposited his<span style=\"background-color: white;\">\nsemen </span>virile through&nbsp; Vayubhagavan (god\nof wind) into the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">womb</span> of&nbsp; Anjana who was\nthen praying to him for a child. Coming to know of this through Narada and\nfearing&nbsp; that his lordship over the\nmonkeys would be lost if such a monkey were born to Anjana Bali poured into the\nbelly of Anjana molten liquid of pancaloha (five metals). Anjana was not the\nleast injured and she&nbsp; gave birth in due\ncourse to a monkey son who became&nbsp; the\ncelebrated Hanuman, the life-force of the RamaRavana tussle. (Purvakanda, Kamba\nRamayana;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############# <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">Brahma fell in love\nwith his daughter </span>and noticing the fact she turned away to the right side of\nher father. Then did a face appear on his right side. To avoid the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>\nlooks of the father, she slided off to both his sides, and faces appeared on\nthose&nbsp; sides of Brahma. Then Sarasvati\njumped up to the sky&nbsp; and a fifth face\nappeared on his head, turned upwards.&nbsp; Finding\nescape impossible she <span style=\"background-color: white;\">yielded </span>to the desire of&nbsp;\nBrahma and they enjoyed honey-moon for a hundred&nbsp; years. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##########<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day Visnu was\nsitting with his three wives and entertaining them with conversation when Devi Ganga\nlooked at Visnu <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorously</span>. Instantly a quarrel&nbsp;\narose among the three of them. When the row became&nbsp; uncontrollable, SarasvatI cursed Laksmi to\ntake birth&nbsp; in the earth as a plant.\nGanga cursed SarasvatI and&nbsp; made her a\nriver. SarasvatI cursed Ganga and made her a &nbsp;river. At the end of all these rows and curses\nVisnu&nbsp; stood up and said to Laksmi.\n\"Laksmi! you will take&nbsp; birth as the\ndaughter of Dharmadhvaja on the earth&nbsp; with\nthe name Tulasi. In order that the curse of Sarasvatl&nbsp; may come true, a plant called Tulasi (holy\nbasil) will grow up on the earth from a portion of you. While&nbsp; you are living as the daughter of\nDharmadhvaja, an asura named Sankhaciida born from my portion will marry\nyou.\"&nbsp; The curse was realized.\nSarasvatI and Ganga became Rivers<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahma who took birth as\nman, created Satarupa from his own body, without any decrease in its radiance.\nSvayambhuva&nbsp; (Brahma) appreciated the\nbeauty of Satarupa. He&nbsp; grew <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>. But\nBrahma was ashamed of his&nbsp; feeling, as\nSatarupa being half of his body, was his daughter. Being subjected to love and\nshame at the same time Svayambhuva stood there, looking at Satarupa. To avoid\nthe look of Brahma, Satarupa&nbsp; moved to\none side. Brahma had no courage to turn his face to that side. So another face\nsprang up&nbsp; on that side for him. Satarupa\nturned to four sides and Brahma thus got four faces. His <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amour</span> subsided. &nbsp;When the desire subsided, a man originated\nfrom&nbsp; Brahma. That man is Svayambhuva. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once in the village of\nNanda there was a<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> prostitute</span>&nbsp; named\nMahananda. Though she was a great devotee&nbsp;\nof Siva she was living the life of a prostitute for her&nbsp; livelihood. She was having a monkey and a\nhe-fowl&nbsp; as pets. She would adorn the\nnecks of her pets with&nbsp; he rudraksa\nnecklace (rosary) made of berry beads&nbsp; favourite\nof Siva and when she sang songs in praise of Siva those pets danced to the\ntune. One day a Vaisya came there. He had a diamond Siva&nbsp; linga with him. Mahananda felt a great fancy\nfor that and so promised the Vaisya that if he gave her the diamond linga she\nwould remain a faithful wife to him&nbsp; for\nthree days. The Vaisya agreed and the diamond&nbsp;\nlinga was kept in a very secure place That night when&nbsp; oth the Vaisya and Mahananda were sleeping\ntired&nbsp; after a hectic amorous sport, the\nhouse got fire and the&nbsp; diamond was burst\ninto pieces. The Vaisya greatly&nbsp; griefstricken\nby the loss of the diamond.jumped into the fire and committed suicide.\nMahananda faithful to the promise that she would remain his wife for three days\nstarted to jump into the fire and abandon her life. At&nbsp; once Siva appeared before her in person and\nsaid thus: \"Oh, Mahananda, do not commit suicide. I came to you disguised\nas a Vaiiya to test your devotion. You can now ask of me any boon.\"&nbsp; With tears of joy running down her cheeks she\nsaid she wanted to live with Siva. So Siva carried her soul&nbsp; to Kailasa. Not only that, Siva blessed the\nfowl and&nbsp; monkey and said they would be\nborn as devotees of Siva&nbsp; in their next\nbirth and attain moksa at the end of their&nbsp;\nlife on earth<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-osveGFO3-Qc/XF2ZlgSvkcI/AAAAAAABfug/Ftudf39u2dY_e07EZwWE0bpIoriHaIwFgCLcBGAs/s1600/dow44FXnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"195\" data-original-width=\"260\" height=\"298\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-osveGFO3-Qc/XF2ZlgSvkcI/AAAAAAABfug/Ftudf39u2dY_e07EZwWE0bpIoriHaIwFgCLcBGAs/s400/dow44FXnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At that time Sankhacuda&nbsp; and Tulasi met each other in the forests and\nwere&nbsp; married. Sankhacuda, brilliant and\nmajestic, went&nbsp; about with Tulasi in\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous </span>sports creating jealousy even among the devas. His arrogance gave\ninnumerable troubles to the devas and they along with Brahma&nbsp; and Siva approached Mahavisnu for a remedy.&nbsp; Visnu then sent Siva with his spike to kill\nSankhacuda&nbsp; and he himself started to\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">molest t</span>he chastity of his wife&nbsp; Tulasi.\nSaiikhacuda took leave of Tulasi to go&nbsp; and\nfight with Siva. When Tulasi was thus left alone,&nbsp; Mahavisnu in the form of Sankhacuda\napproached&nbsp; Tulasi and after some\npreliminary talks entered into<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> sexual</span> acts. Tulasi found some difference in the\nusual&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> sexual</span> methods and suspecting foul\nplay jumped up to curse the impostor<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.Arjuna&nbsp; reached Gangadvara. When he got down into the\nriver Ganga, he saw Ulupi the daughter of Nagaraja (King&nbsp; of the serpents). He asked her a few\nquestions. She&nbsp; told him thus : \"I\nam the daughter of the serpent&nbsp; Kauravya\nof the family of Airavata. I came to bathe&nbsp;\nin the river and when I saw you I grew<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> amorous</span>.\"&nbsp; Arjuna told her that Dharmaputra had imposed\non him&nbsp; celibacy for twelve months and\nthat it was not right to marry in the meantime. Ulupi argued with&nbsp; Arjuna and convinced him that it was not\nwrong to marry her. Arjuna married her. A son named Iravan was born to her.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once Agastya went to\nthe durbar of Indra. On the occasion Indra asked Urva'i to dance. In the midst\nof the dance she saw Jayanta, the son of Indra, and became <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> and her\nsteps went&nbsp; wrong. Narada who was playing\nhis famous lute called MahatI could not play well. Agastya got angry and&nbsp; cursed Jayanta to become a bud. He cursed\nNarada&nbsp; also. So his lute became the lute\nof the world<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: x-large;\">HAVE TWAT -- WILL DRIP !</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the Devas and the\nAsuras united together&nbsp; and churned the\nsea of milk, ever so many noble objects rose up to the surface of the sea.\nSeveral beautiful&nbsp; damsels also came up.\nVisnu grew <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> of them and thus thousands of sons were born by them. These\nsons who were born in the Patala (Nether world) , by and by, came up and began\nto do harm to the dwellers of the earth. At this time Siva took the incarnation\nin the form of an ox to study the situation properly. In this&nbsp; disguise Siva entered Patala and took by\nstealth the&nbsp; Sudars ana (the weapon of\nVisnu) and drove him to heaven.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This sight made Vrtra\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>. He approached Rambha and prayed to her to become his wife. Under that\nsandalwood tree Rambha asked him. \"Oh hand- some youth ! I am Rambha. I\ncame here with my&nbsp; maids to play. Who are\nyou, my Lord ?\"&nbsp; Vrtra :\n\"Beautiful maid ! I am the son of Kagyapa&nbsp;\nnd the friend of Indra. I enjoy half the position of&nbsp; Indra. I, Vrtra, have brought the three\nworlds under&nbsp; my control. I shall be\ncomplete in all aspects, if I could marry you.\"&nbsp; Rambha agreed to the marriage on condition\nthat Vrtra would not gainsay her in anything. They engaged&nbsp; in <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous </span>plays and Rambha made the Brahmin&nbsp; drink liquor in large quantities and he\nbecame unconscious. Indra took this opportunity and sent his thunderbolt which\ntook away the life of Vrtra. Instantly Indra&nbsp;\nbecame affected with sins such as Brahmahatya etc.&nbsp; ( Padma Purana, Bhumikhanda, Chapters 23 and\n24) .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Vyasa began\npenance, the celestial maids also commenced their work of hindering the\npenance. It was Ghrtaci who confronted Vyasa. She took the form of a parrot of\nfive colours and flew in front of Vyasa. The hermit was excited at the beauty\nof Ghrtaci and sat forgetting himself. As he sat there thinking of the infat\nuating beauty of the parrot, <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal</span> discharge occurred&nbsp; to him. He became a slave to this\ninfatuation, when he was engaged in making fire by attrition. In this <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>\nstate of mind he was quite unaware of the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> seminal </span>discharge or its falling on\nthe pieces of wood&nbsp; used for attrition.\nHe continued attrition. Then a very bright, divine person appeared from the\npieces of wood. At the birth of a person, without attachment to a womb, all the\nworlds were delighted. The hide of black antelope, water pot, hermit's rod etc.\nfell from the sky.&nbsp; Birth rituals and\nceremonies, according to the custom, were conducted by Vyasa. As he was born\nfrom the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> discharged at the sight of the Suka (parrot) the&nbsp; infant was named Suka<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\">HAVE PRICK -- WILL GET HOP</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ANAUPAMYA. Wife of\nBanasura. Once she developed an <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous </span>interest in Narada. which led to some&nbsp; domestic quarrels. (Padma Purana, Adikfinda,\nChapter 14).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Atala is the first\nworld of Patala. &nbsp;There reigns Bala, the\nson of Maya who is the famous&nbsp; but\nhaughty magician. He has created 96 Mayas who&nbsp;\nare capable of granting all kinds of desires. Even now&nbsp; certain persons who are interested in the\npractice of&nbsp; Black magic, learn some of\nthese 96 arts and practice &nbsp;them. When\nthis mighty fellow opens his mouth for yawning, three groups of women known as\nPumScalls,&nbsp; Svairinis and KaminTs emerge\nfrom his mouth. He has&nbsp; with him a\nrasayana called hataka with which he can eaisly entice and <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seduce </span>all who enter\nAtala and to strengthen them for satisfying his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust.</span> After enticing them with\nit, he enjoys uncontrolled pleasure with&nbsp;\nthem, showering on them his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> glances, bewitching smiles and\nembraces. (Devi Bhagavata, Asjama Skandha) .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XeBKNzlK5_A/XF00ppQKK4I/AAAAAAABfsE/oWDdhlr_RCEPO4Wuo_azCDKGcYVDt28UgCLcBGAs/s1600/i-felt-aDmorous.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"308\" data-original-width=\"250\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-XeBKNzlK5_A/XF00ppQKK4I/AAAAAAABfsE/oWDdhlr_RCEPO4Wuo_azCDKGcYVDt28UgCLcBGAs/s400/i-felt-aDmorous.jpg\" width=\"324\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Siva, once in his\nfierce and effulgent form (aspect)&nbsp; entered\nKesarl, the husband of Anjana and had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">coitus</span>&nbsp;\nwith her. After that Vayu (Wind-god) also had<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> coitus</span> with her. Thus as a\nresult of the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>act by both the Devas Anjana got pregnant.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Siva agreed to\nbeget a son to kill Tarakasura, at the request of the Devas. The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">coitus</span> between\nSiva and ParvatI for the&nbsp; purpose did not\nend even after a hundred years. Due&nbsp; to\nthe pressure of the process the whole world shook,&nbsp; and when the world appeared to get destroyed\nthe&nbsp; Devas asked Agnideva to persuade\nSiva to stop. But,&nbsp; afraid of approaching\nSiva Agni ran off and hid himself in the ocean. The Devas followed him, and\nanimals&nbsp; in the water which were burning\nwith the heat of Agni, told the Devas that Agni was hiding in the sea. But,\nAgni cursed them all to dumbness, and leaving the ocean hid himself on mount\nMandara. The parrots&nbsp; revealed this\nsecret, when Agni cursed them also and&nbsp; made\ntheir tongues fold inwards<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Maudgalya got cross\nwhen she thus caused hindrance to his penance and cursed her saying that she\nwould in her next life be&nbsp; born as the\ndaughter of the King of Pancala when she&nbsp;\nwould have five husbands to satisfy her <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust</span>. Greatly&nbsp; grieved at this curse she practised severe\nausterities standing in the midst of Pancagni. Pleased with her penance Siva\nappeared before her and blessed her say- ing that she would be born in her next\nbirth in a very&nbsp; noble family and she\nwould then have five husbands,&nbsp; good-natured,\ndoing godly work and equal in valour&nbsp; to\nIndra. She then pleaded that she should be&nbsp;\ngranted the boon to remain a virgin during the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">coitus</span> with each of her\nhusbands. Siva granted that wish.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So he decided to make\nthe best use of the time at his disposal by witnessing a little of the dance of\nthe celestial beauties in the realm of the devas. But males had no admittance there.\nSo Aruna took the shape of a beautiful woman&nbsp;\nand got in. Seeing a new person, very beautiful to look at, sitting in\nthe midst of the celestial maids Indra grew <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span>. He secretly took her to a\ndark place&nbsp; and a son was born out of\nthat <span style=\"background-color: white;\">coition</span>. That son is Bali. When Aruna returned the Sun was standing full\nof&nbsp; anger. Being afraid of him Aruna\nconfessed everything&nbsp; to the Sun. When he\nheard the whole story the Sun&nbsp; expressed\nhis desire to see that figure which Aruna had&nbsp;\nadopted. Accordingly Aruna again became a woman.&nbsp; The Sun also had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">coition</span> with her and Sugriva\nwas&nbsp; the son born out of this<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> coition</span>.\nBali and Sugriva were brought up by AhalyadevI in the hermitage of&nbsp; Gautama.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n################<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vaisya's son, one\nday, went out to the forest to gather fruits and roots for their food. At that time\nhis wife grew lustful and had <span style=\"background-color: white;\">coition </span>with the man without limbs. Gradually she\nbegan to dote on him. She decided to kill her husband who was an impediment on her\nway. She pretended to be ill. The Vaisya's son began&nbsp; to treat her. One day she took her husband to\nthe edge of a very deep well and said: \"See, there is a divine herb at the\nbottom of this well. I will be cured if I could eat it. This is what a goddess\ntold me in a dream yesternight\". Hearing this her husband made a rope, and\ntied it to a tree. Then he began to go down the well by the rope. She cut the\nrope and the man fell into the well<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From the passion of\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust</span> of Brahma, a daughter named Sarasvati was born and Brahma married her.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: x-large; line-height: 150%;\">HAVE DAUGHTER-- WILL FUCK !</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once Siva showed his\ndaughter Sandhya to Brahma who grew <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful </span>instantly; Siva insulted Brahma by showing\nthis ill-owned <span style=\"background-color: white;\">passion</span> of his to his sons (Brahma's sons). As a revenge Brahma\ncreated SatI and insulted Siva through Daksa. (Skanda, 2, 2, 26).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3eA_zxUKj70/XF038x6SZHI/AAAAAAABfsM/XMc7cdcvOB42tl34uAJeu7HgkDI0EEc2wCLcBGAs/s1600/doDDwnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"183\" data-original-width=\"275\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3eA_zxUKj70/XF038x6SZHI/AAAAAAABfsM/XMc7cdcvOB42tl34uAJeu7HgkDI0EEc2wCLcBGAs/s400/doDDwnload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One hundred beautiful\ndaughters were born to the King Kusanabha. One day while they were playing in\nthe jungle Vayubhagavan (wind-god) saw them and grew <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful</span>. But they did not\nyield to his request. So he got angry and cursed them and they became\nhump-backed. The King was very sorry. He presented his hundred hunch-backed\ndaughters to King Brahmadatta, who,by his divine power straightened their\nbacks. When&nbsp; they regained their former\nform they became the wives&nbsp; of\nBrahmadatta. This story occurs in Valmlki Ramayana, Balakanda, Sargas 32 &amp;\n33.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One day Brhaddhvaja\nhappened to meet with Kegini, the beautiful wife of king Bhimakesa. The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful\n</span>giant was about to take her away, when she told him thus : \"I hate my\nhusband very much. So I am ready to come with you, of my own accord.\" Taking\nher in his chariot the giant went to Gaiigasagara sarigama. When she learned\nthat this place was&nbsp; under the rule of\nher husband, she died of fear. Being&nbsp; unable\nto bear separation from KesSini, the giant also died. As these two had died at\nthe holy place of Garigasagara saiigama, both attained the world of Visnu. (\nSkanda Purana, Kriyakanda)<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dadhlca erected his\nhermitage on the bank of the river Sarasvati and began to do penance. The power\nof penance increased daily.&nbsp; Seeing this\nIndra was flurried. So he sent the celestial maid Alaihbusa to break the\npenance of Dadhlca some- how or other. Alarhbusa came to the hermitage of&nbsp; Dadhlca and began to dance and sing. When the\nhermit saw her he grew lustful and <span style=\"background-color: white;\">seminal </span>discharge occurred&nbsp; to him. The <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> fell in the river\nSarasvati, who be- came pregnant and in due course gave birth to a child. She\ntook the child to the hermit Dadhlca and told him&nbsp; the story of the child. The hermit was much\npleased.&nbsp; He took the child and embraced\nit and blessed the river Sarasvati thus : \"Brahma, the gods and the\ncelestial maids will be pleased if your water is offered as oblation.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###########<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brahma gave that devi\n(goddess) to Yajnapurusa (the god of sacrifice) so that the sacrifices of gods\nmight become fruitful. When Yajnapurusa saw that supernatural beauty he was&nbsp; overpowered by <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust</span> and swooned. The couple\nspent a hundred divine years in seclusion enjoying the company of each other,\nas a result of which devi became <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant</span>. The pregnancy matured in twelve\ndivine years and she&nbsp; gave birth to a\nchild which was named Phalada. It is this same Phalada, the son of Yajnapurusa\nand Daksina&nbsp; who awards fruits to all\nactions. The learned men say that Yajnapurusa, DaksinadevI and Phalada divide\nthe fruits of actions among the doers. (Devi Bhagavata Skandha 9).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mahavisnu was once\nengaged at Vaikuntha in a pleasant talk with his wives, Laksmi, Sarasvati and\nGanga when Gaiiga cast lustful eyes on Visnu, who, behind the backs of the\nother two wives returned the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> lustful </span>glances. Sarasvati could not put up with\nthat situation for a long time.&nbsp; Therefore,\nshe got up from her seat and beat Gaiiga.&nbsp;\nLaksmi tried to restrain Sarasvati lest the quarrel should&nbsp;&nbsp; become fiercer. Angered at this intervention\nSarasvati&nbsp; cursed that Laksmi be born on\nearth. Gaiiga got angry&nbsp; that innocent\nLaksmi was thus cursed, and she in her&nbsp; turn\ncursed that SarasvatI be born as a river on earth. SarasvatI did not take the\ncurse lying down, but cursed&nbsp; that Gariga\nalso be born as a river on earth and take&nbsp;\nupon herself the sins of the whole world.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mahabhisak, an emperor\nof the Iksvaku dynasty, went&nbsp; to\nSatyaloka after he had attained heaven, to worship&nbsp; Brahma. Ganga too happened to be there. In\nthe devotional atmosphere at Satyaloka a casual breeze&nbsp; removed Gariga's clothes slightly from\nposition, and Mahabhisak then cast a <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful </span>glance at her which she&nbsp; also returned. Brahma, who was observing this\nexchange&nbsp; of love got angry and cursed\nthat Mahabhisak be born&nbsp; as a King on earth\nand Ganga as his wife. Ganga&nbsp; prayed for\nredemption from the curse, and Brahma&nbsp; told\nher that she would regain her old status after she&nbsp; had delivered the Astavasus. As the\nconsequence of&nbsp; Brahma's cure Mahabhisak\nwas born as King Santanu&nbsp; in the solar dynasty\non earth and he married Ganga.&nbsp; (Adi\nParva, Chapters 96 and 97).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brhaspati once\napproached, on the crest of a wave of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust</span>, Mamata, his brother's wife who was&nbsp; pregnant then. The child from the mother's\nwomb said&nbsp; 'no' to the move. But,\nBrhaspati cursed the child and&nbsp; had his\nown way with Mamata. Thus two children&nbsp; developed\nin her womb. Just after delivering the child- ren the mother went away leaving\nthe child by Brhaspati behind. The Devas took charge of the forsaken&nbsp; child and named him Bharadvaja. Ultimately\nthey&nbsp; handed over the child (Bharadvaja)\nto king Bharata,&nbsp; the famous son of\nDusyanta. Children had already been&nbsp; born\nto Bharata by his three wives, but as all of them&nbsp; were found to be <span style=\"background-color: white;\">immoral </span>the <span style=\"color: red;\">mothers\nthemselves killed them.</span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Visasanam. This Naraka\nis for the torture of those who perform Yaga by killing cows to display their\nwealth and splendour. They will have to remain there&nbsp; during the whole term of their punishment\nunder the constant flogging of Yama's servants. (18) Laldbhaksam. This is the\nNaraka for<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> lustful </span>people.&nbsp; The\nlascivious fellow who makes his wife swallow&nbsp;\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span>, is cast into this hell. Lalabhaksam is a sea of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen.</span> The sinner\nlies in it feeding upon <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> alone.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I am the wife of\nNalakubara who is the son of your brother&nbsp;\nKubera. My name is Rambha. Your brother's son is your son too. So don't\ndo any harm to your son's wife.\"&nbsp; But\nRavana did not pay any heed to her words. He&nbsp;\nlifted her up and placed her on the round rock and&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> raped </span>her. Before dawn Rambha, who had become&nbsp; like the lake of lotus trodden by a mad\nelephant, went&nbsp; to Nalakubara and told\nhim everything. Nalakubara&nbsp; became very\nangry and cursed Ravana. \"You,&nbsp; who\nhave become blind with <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust</span>, shall not touch a woman who does not reciprocate\nyour love. If you do&nbsp; so your head will\nbe split into seven pieces.\" It was&nbsp;\nbecause of this curse that Ravana did not touch Sita though she was kept\nin his harem. (Uttara Ramayana;&nbsp; Mahabharata,\nVana Parva, Chapter 28) .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JX_jbLfjG_c/XF05J55OEAI/AAAAAAABfsU/I8Xf3-7MsI0lXwdIWwVHnOAMcc6N6EmRgCLcBGAs/s1600/dffownload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"195\" data-original-width=\"260\" height=\"298\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-JX_jbLfjG_c/XF05J55OEAI/AAAAAAABfsU/I8Xf3-7MsI0lXwdIWwVHnOAMcc6N6EmRgCLcBGAs/s400/dffownload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upabarhana lived on the\nslopes of the Himalayas performing&nbsp; penance.\nWhile Upabarhana was one day engaged in Sa- madhi fifty daughters of the\nGandharva called Citraratha&nbsp; passed that\nway, and they fell in love with Upabarhana, who was in Samadhi. He awoke from\nSamadhi on hearing the melodious songs of the fifty damsels who stood there\nwith palms joined in reverence. Upabarhana too fell in love with them, and he\nmarried all the fifty girls. He&nbsp; returned\nwith them to the palace and lived there for thousands of years. Once the\nGandharvas and the&nbsp; Apsaras were invited\nto sing the story of Visnu in Brahmaloka. Upabarhana accompanied them. He be-\ncame <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful </span>towards Rambha. The Prajapatis, who&nbsp; noticed it got angry, and Upabarhana\nwell-nigh dead&nbsp; due to their curse\nreturned home. He told his wives all that had happened to him. He spread a\ndarbha grass on the ground and lay on it and died. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When SatI who was\ninsulted at the Daksayaga was cousumed by fire a bereaved Siva sat inactive and&nbsp; moody at a lonely place. When this continued\nfor a long time Kamadeva (god of love) at the request of&nbsp; the other devas sent arrows agJnst him and\nmade him&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> lustful.</span> Siva then started\nrunning passionately calling&nbsp;&nbsp; the name\nof his wife and finding her nowhere jumped&nbsp;\ninto the river Kalindl to commit suicide. (The&nbsp; waters of Kalindl became black from that time\non- wards). Kalindi was unable to bear the burden of&nbsp; the soul of Siva and so he had to get out to\nthe shore&nbsp; and run again. At this time\nKamadeva sent another&nbsp; arrow, unmadastra\n( arrow of intoxication) also against&nbsp; Siva.\nSiva could not bear the impact of the two&nbsp;\narrows together and he laboured under great strain. Just then he saw\nPancalika son of Kubera coming that way. Siva then made him understand his\ndifficulties and requested him to take charge of the force of the arrows from\nhim. Pancalika did so and saved Siva&nbsp; from\nhis toil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;At first he cut down one&nbsp; of the trees standing tall and straight and\nto the&nbsp; surprise and astonishment of all\nthe fallen trunk of the&nbsp; tree disappeared\nand there in its place lay the dead&nbsp; body\nof a demon youth. It was the body of Sambhukumara, son of Surpanakha. He was\ndoing penance&nbsp; there when Sri Rama came\nthere with Sita and becoming <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful</span> at the sight of Sita he stood there as a\ntree. It was he who was cut down by Laksmana.&nbsp;\nSri Rama understood the thing that happened. He&nbsp; then explained to Sita and Laksmana many\nthings&nbsp; about the frauds and deceits of\nthe demons. After that&nbsp; they built their\nhermitage there and dwelt there for a long time. (Aranya Kanda, Kamba Ramayana)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Bala yawns three\nkinds of women&nbsp; will come out of his\nmouth. Pumlcalis (harlots),&nbsp; Svairims\n(adulteresses) and Kaminis (lustful maidens).&nbsp;\nThese women have a charm called Hafcaka to tempt&nbsp; all who enter Atala. This hataka is a\nrasayana which&nbsp; will excite <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual</span>\npassion in men so that the women&nbsp; can\nenjoy a <span style=\"background-color: white;\">sexual </span>life with them fora prolonged period.&nbsp; These women after enticing the men would live\nwith&nbsp; them enjoying a life of bliss\nproduced by bewitching side glances, charming smiles, <span style=\"background-color: white;\">erotic</span> embraces and\nexciting <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> talks. The men who live with them will be&nbsp; in such a state of bliss that they would say\nwith&nbsp; pride \"I am perfect, I am god.\nI am one with the might often thousand elephants.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6qpMMYjn06M/XF1EJs9L55I/AAAAAAABfuQ/RP4R-r6F1JgTG3oF9Ho7eKTW0MAsgOd7gCLcBGAs/s1600/sssats.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"358\" data-original-width=\"500\" height=\"286\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-6qpMMYjn06M/XF1EJs9L55I/AAAAAAABfuQ/RP4R-r6F1JgTG3oF9Ho7eKTW0MAsgOd7gCLcBGAs/s400/sssats.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###################</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She was the servant-\nmaid of Brhaspati. One day she was collecting flowers&nbsp; for her Guru in a garden when a set of young\nmen&nbsp; and women came to the garden for\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">amorous</span> sports.&nbsp; They were roaming about\nin the garden in pairs doing&nbsp; all sorts\nof <span style=\"background-color: white;\">erotic</span> acts and Punjikasthala stood watching&nbsp;\nthem for some time with<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> passion</span> aroused in her. She &nbsp;returned to the asrama thinking all the way\nabout her&nbsp; miserable lot of having no\nhusband to enjoy a similar&nbsp; life. She was\nfull of <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust </span>when she returned to the asrama and on seeing Brhaspati she caught\nhold of him&nbsp; by the hand and pleaded to\nsatisfy her passion.&nbsp; Brhaspati was angry\nat this improper request and&nbsp; cursed her\n\"You have become rotten. You have be- come <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful</span> by seeing the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> amorous\n</span>sports of others. May you be born as a monkey. Get out of this ashrama.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Urvasi taking the part\nof&nbsp; Laksmi started to dance but seeing\nPururavas before&nbsp; her she became<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> lustful\n</span>and made wrong steps. Narada&nbsp; who was\npresent at the function got angry and cursed her&nbsp; \"You will forget all you have learnt.\nNot only that,&nbsp; you will live as a creeper\nseparated from Pururavas for a period of sixty years.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once when Brahma was in\na state of meditation on the Meru mountain, tears rolled down from his eyes and&nbsp; he gathered the tears in his own hands. From\nthose&nbsp; tears, a monkey came into being.\nRksarajas was that monkey. One day, Rksarajas went to a lake to quench his\nthirst. Seeing his own image reflected in the water, he thought&nbsp; it was some enemy and jumped into the lake,\nto attack him. But he soon realized his mistake and&nbsp; returned to the shore. As soon as he came out\nof the&nbsp; water, he felt that he had become\na woman. Seeing her&nbsp; fascinating beauty,\nIndra and Surya were filled with&nbsp; <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful\n</span>passion. Both of them had involuntary emission&nbsp;\nof<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> semen</span>. Bali was born from Indra's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen </span>which&nbsp; fell on the head and Sugrlva was born from\nSurya's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">semen</span> which fell on the neck of Rksarajas.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">.During his wanderings&nbsp; Siva once came to the Vindhya mountain.\nKamadeva&nbsp; followed him there too and\nbegan attacking Siva with&nbsp; his arrows and\nto escape from the fierce onslaught Siva&nbsp;\ntook refuge in the terrible Daru forest. There Maharsis with their wives\nlived. Siva saluted them and re- quested for alms. But, the Maharsis only kept\nmum. They&nbsp; did not like their wives\nsaluting Siva. Siva went about&nbsp; the ashram a and all the women except Arundhati and&nbsp;\nAnasuya, followed him overcome by <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust </span>for him.&nbsp; Enraged at this, munis like Bhargava and\nAngiras cursed&nbsp; Siva that his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus\n</span>should drop to the ground. Immediately it fell down and Siva disappeared. The\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span>&nbsp; rent asunder the earth, reached\nPatala and rent the universe also. The whole universe shook at which&nbsp; Brahma met Visnu at Patala and enquired of\nhim the reason for the universal upheaval. Visnu answered him&nbsp; that the world shook because of the weight of\nSiva's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span>, which the maharsis had caused to be dropped.&nbsp; Then Brahma, along with Visnu, came to the\nspot&nbsp; where Siva's <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span> lay. At the\nsight of the limitless <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span> Visnu, in great wonder, descended to Patala&nbsp; mounted on Garuda. Brahma, on his plane, toured&nbsp; above. Both Visnu and Brahma returned to\nearth,&nbsp; having failed in their attempt to\nfind the end of the&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> phallus</span>. They then\npraised Siva, who appeared to them.&nbsp; They\nrequested him to take back his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span> from the&nbsp;\nearth. Siva insisted that he would do so only if the Devas agreed to\nworship his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus.</span> Visnu agreed to the suggestion. Brahma took the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span>,\ngolden&nbsp; brassy in colour. Thereafter\nMahavisnu created&nbsp; the four castes and\nvarious :'astraic texts for each of the&nbsp; castes\nto worship the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus.</span> The four texts are known&nbsp; as Saivam, Pasupatam, Kaladamanam and\nKapalikam.&nbsp; After making the above\narrangements Brahma and&nbsp; Visnu returned.\nSiva took back his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span>.
