(Vamana Purana, Chapter 6) .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UHWJE6uNikU/XF08Xbv1rXI/AAAAAAABfs0/yV6kY7hEpck4Ykp_pckwV-jvrGOCKmMRACLcBGAs/s1600/downlfoad.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"249\" data-original-width=\"203\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-UHWJE6uNikU/XF08Xbv1rXI/AAAAAAABfs0/yV6kY7hEpck4Ykp_pckwV-jvrGOCKmMRACLcBGAs/s400/downlfoad.jpg\" width=\"326\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Siva approached the\nBalakhilyas in the guise of a hand- some youth, wearing the Vanamala garland on\nhis head, holding the alms bowl in his hands and completely in the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">nude</span> and\nrequested for alms. The Womenfolk of the Advaitins were much attracted by the\nhand- some youth and came to him with a lot of fruits, roots&nbsp; etc. by way of alms. Siva wished them good\nand&nbsp; Parvati espied her smiling lord from\nher seat. After giving him alms the women spoke to him as follows : \"Oh !\nanchorite, what penance are you&nbsp; practising\n? You have no clothes on you, but you wear&nbsp;\nVanamala. You are a handsome sannyasl. If you&nbsp; have no objection, please tell us about\nyou.\" The&nbsp; sannyasl (Siva) answered\nthem by saying that his was&nbsp; a very\nsecret penance and could not be imparted to others. Especially in the presence\nof so many others it could not be revealed. So, you may please go. But,&nbsp; the women said that they wished very much to\nhear the&nbsp; secret, and they caught hold of\nhis hands saying 'Come'.&nbsp; The women were\novercome by<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> lust </span>and one of them&nbsp; caught\nhold of his neck, another of his hands, another&nbsp;\nof his knees, another of his hair and yet another of his waist. Seeing\nthe excitement of their wives the maharsis cried, 'Strike him' and struck down\nhis <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span>&nbsp; with sticks and stones. As\nsoon as the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus </span>was&nbsp; thus felled\ndown, Siva disappeared from the spot and&nbsp;\nreturned to Kailasa with Parvati. When the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span> fell down the whole\nuniverse shook&nbsp; and the maharsis were\nalarmed. A very intelligent&nbsp; maharsi\namong them said : \"We know not the real&nbsp;\nfacts about the great ascetic. Let us take refuge in Brahma. He may know\nthe facts.\" Accordingly the maharsis went to Brahma, who found fault with\ntheir ignorance and indiscretion and asked them to shed&nbsp; their anger and please Siva. Accordingly they\nwent to Kailasa and praised Siva, who appeared to them and&nbsp; told them as follows : \"You may now\nreturn. The&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> phallus</span> will belong to you.\nI shall be pleased if you&nbsp; would duly\ninstall it. Nothing will be impossible&nbsp; to\nthose who worship my <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span> with devotion. Even&nbsp; sins consciously committed will be removed by\nthe worship of my<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> phallus</span>. You install the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus </span>you&nbsp; struck down in the great pond of Sannihita.\nThat&nbsp; will achieve for you all your\ndesires. Even the Devas&nbsp; will worship it\nunder the name 'Sthanu'. Being install- ed at Sthanvis'vara it will be known as\nSthanvKvara&nbsp; also. Constant meditation\nupon Sthanu will remove all sins. The sight of Sthanu will bring about salva-\ntion.\"&nbsp; After this the maharsis,\nalong with Brahma, returned&nbsp; to Dam\nforest to carry the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus </span>to Sannihita. But,&nbsp;\nthey could not move it even by an iota. They returned&nbsp; again to Kailasa, but could not see Siva\nthere. When&nbsp; Brahma sat in meditation for\nsometime to know where&nbsp; Siva was, he saw\nin his mind Siva, in the guise of an&nbsp; elephant,\nstanding in the stream praised by munis.&nbsp;\nImmediately Brahma and others went there, but missed&nbsp; Siva there. But Parvati appeared there and\nserved&nbsp; them amrta (nectar). When they\nhad consumed the&nbsp; nectar they saw Siva\nstanding in the stream, and they&nbsp; spoke\nabout their difficulties to him.&nbsp; Siva,\nin the guise of the elephant, accompanied them to the Daru forest where he, in\nsport, took the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span>&nbsp; by his proboscis\nand installed it on the banks of&nbsp; the\nstream. All those who witnessed the installa- tion attained ultimate\nrealisation. Upon the<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> phallus&nbsp; </span>thus\ninstalled Brahma built another <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span> with stone. After a period that <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus\n</span>became one with the&nbsp; effulgence of the\nfirst <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus</span>. Those who saw that also achieved ultimate realisation.\nImmediately Brahma&nbsp; built, for the\npleasure of the Devas, seven <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phalluses</span> one upon the other, and sages attained\nultimate realis- ation by smearing their bodies with the dust of the&nbsp; <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phalluses.</span> The spot where the <span style=\"background-color: white;\">phallus </span>was\ninstalled became famous by the name Sthanutlrtha. (Vamana&nbsp;&nbsp; Purana, Chapter 45).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SlVA. I Wife of\nAngiras. Consumed by <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust</span> she once slept with Agnideva and then flew away in\nthe form of a she-kite. (Vana Parva, Chapter 225).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After the killing of\nTarakasura Subrahmanya became the object of too much of petting by Parvati with\nthe result that his life became unbridled and wayward. His <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lust </span>was everyday on\nthe increase and he committed even<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> rape</span> on Deva women, who were ultimately\nforced to complain about him to Parvati. Immediately she called Subrahmanya to\nher and showed her own image in all other women and he became so much repentant\nabout his past actions that he took the vow before Parvati that in future he\nwould look upon all women in the world as equal to her, his mother. (Brahmanda\nPurana 81<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When Satyavrata grew up\nhe&nbsp; became a lewd, <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful </span>imprudent man.\nOne day while he was leading such a contemptuous life, a marriage was being\nconducted in a brahmin house. Guests had assembled, the bridegroom had come and\nthe ceremony was about to start when Satyavrata entered the marriage hall and\ncarried away by force the bride to the shock of all those present there. Some\nof the Brahmin guests immediately went to Trayyaruna and told him&nbsp; what a shameful crime his son had committed.\nThe enraged father at once sent Satyavrata out from the palace.&nbsp; Satyavrata left the country altogether and\nwent and&nbsp; stayed in a <span style=\"color: red;\">colony of harijans.</span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Harhsa, the King of\nGandharvas (semi-gods) had a general of the&nbsp;\narmy called Durmada. He was a dangler. He had an&nbsp; eye on Urvasl. She was the wife of Pururavas\na famous King. On several occasions Durmada followed Urvas i, with <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lustful\n</span>desire. He had expressed his <span style=\"background-color: white;\">amour</span> for her on several occasions. But Urvasl did\nnot pay any heed&nbsp; to his words.&nbsp; One day Pururavas and Urvasl were present in\nthe durbar of Indra. Pururavas and Urvasl had signalled a rendezvous for that\nnight at the corner of the Nandana Park. Durmada understood this. He called a&nbsp; celestial woman named Unmada to his side.\nThey made a plan and accordingly Unmada disguised herself as Urvasl and Durmada\ntook the guise of Pururavas and&nbsp; both of\nthem entered Nandana park. Pururavas went to Unmada and <span style=\"background-color: white;\">conjugated</span> with her. In\nthe same way&nbsp; Urvaii received Durmada,\nmistaking him for Pururavas.&nbsp; After the<span style=\"background-color: white;\">\nconjugation</span> Durmada laughed loud as if he&nbsp;\nhad played a trick on Urvas\"!. Urvasl understood everything.\nPururavas also arrived there. Urvasl cursed&nbsp;\nDurmada to take birth in the earth as a Raksasa and cursed Unmada to be\nborn in the earth as the daughter&nbsp; of a\nKing and she said that at that time she would love one man and become the wife\nof another man. The&nbsp; aggrieved Durmada\nand Unmada prayed for liberation from the curse<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-o4CgxlkuR7k/XF0-eM6-F2I/AAAAAAABfs8/CWLAKlZeg14_2GAhBgxEAx2EMz0bC53HQCLcBGAs/s1600/dow887nload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"194\" data-original-width=\"259\" height=\"299\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-o4CgxlkuR7k/XF0-eM6-F2I/AAAAAAABfs8/CWLAKlZeg14_2GAhBgxEAx2EMz0bC53HQCLcBGAs/s400/dow887nload.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Iksvaku&nbsp; begot three sons, Danda, Vikuksi and Nimi.\nAfter his father's death Danda became king of the country bet- ween the Vindhya\nand the Himalayas. In the course&nbsp; of a\nhunting expedition once Danda saw and was immediately attracted by the charms\nof Ara, daughter of&nbsp; Sukra maharsi. He\ncommitted <span style=\"background-color: white;\">rape </span>on her and she&nbsp; told her\nfather about the attack by Danda. The Maharsi asked his daughter to do tapas,\nand further told&nbsp; her that he would burn\nDanda's kingdom by a rain of&nbsp; fire. Ara\ndid tapas, and at the behest of the Maharsi&nbsp;\nIndra destroyed Danda's kingdom by a downpour of^ rain of fire.\nAfterwards this place became a terrible&nbsp; forest\nwhere neither birds nor animals lived, and came&nbsp;\nto be known as Dandakaranya. (Uttara Ramayana).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">CANCALAKSI II. A'\nvidyadhara girl'. Once while she was concentrating her mind in prayer over\nMahalaksmi,&nbsp; Ravana, King of the\nRaksasas, committed <span style=\"background-color: white;\">rape</span> on her,&nbsp; and she\ncursed him that he should die on account of&nbsp;\nMahalaksmi herself and accordingly at last he was&nbsp; killed by Rama on account of Sita, the\nincarnation of&nbsp; Mahalaksmi. (Karhpa\nRamayana).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Danda once went to a\nVaisnavite temple to commit&nbsp; robbery.\nWhen he reached the steps of the temple he&nbsp;\nwiped his legs which were wet, on the ground and a&nbsp; small depression that was there, was levelled\nby the&nbsp; drawing of his legs. He broke the\nlock with an iron rod and entered the temple. Inside the temple he saw Krsna, clad\nin yellow robes <span style=\"background-color: white;\">lying </span>on a beautiful cot, with his spouse Radha. The thief\ninstantly bowed before the&nbsp; spouse of\nRadha. By this act his sins were washed away.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once when the wife of\nUgrasena was in her<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> menses</span> she&nbsp; went to\nthe garden with her &nbsp;&nbsp;companions. Then a\nGandharva named Dramila disguised as Ugrasena&nbsp;\nwent to her but she knew the trick and cursed him&nbsp; that he would go to hell. But Dramila\ncommitted<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> rape</span> on her and then left the place making her <span style=\"background-color: white;\">pregnant. </span>When the\nchild was born Ugrasena's wife greatly hated&nbsp;\nthe child got of an evil deed and cursed it saying that the child would\nbe killed by a member of the family&nbsp; of\nUgrasena. Thus Kamsa was the son born to the wife&nbsp; of Ugrasena by the Gandharva, Dramila. It was\nbecause&nbsp; Kamsa was aware of it that he\nbehaved very badly to Ugrasena and Krsna. (10th Skandha, Bhagavata).<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-nNrtcoG_m8g/XF0_GNQYmZI/AAAAAAABftE/uxsA25f8_NwiUYdcYrCT5rpBjpQmCyTwwCLcBGAs/s1600/menstrua99tion-sucks-period.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"740\" data-original-width=\"600\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-nNrtcoG_m8g/XF0_GNQYmZI/AAAAAAABftE/uxsA25f8_NwiUYdcYrCT5rpBjpQmCyTwwCLcBGAs/s400/menstrua99tion-sucks-period.jpg\" width=\"323\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">################<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Narakasura made\nPragjyotisa his capital and ruled over the asuras as their emperor for a long\ntime, all the while terrifying the Devas. Once&nbsp;\nthis asura <span style=\"background-color: white;\">raped</span> Kaseru the daughter of Tvasta. He&nbsp; brought sixteen thousand and one hundred\nmaidens&nbsp; from the women of the earth and\nthe world of gods. He&nbsp; made them captives\nat Audaka on the top of the&nbsp; mountain\nManiparvata.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VinayavatI grew into a\nbeautiful maiden and stayed in the asrama. One day by accident I &nbsp;happened to see her and attracted by her&nbsp; beauty tried to <span style=\"background-color: white;\">rape</span> her. She cried aloud and\nhearing&nbsp; the noise the sage came out and\ncursed me and turned&nbsp; me into a camel. I\npleaded for mercy and the sage&nbsp; said I\nwould be released from the curse when I was&nbsp;\nkilled by the future husband of Vinayavati, Puskaraksa&nbsp; by name<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While VedavatI, the\nonly daughter&nbsp; of sage Kusadhvaja, was\ndoing tapas to secure Sri Madhava as her husband. Ravana committed <span style=\"background-color: white;\">rape </span>on&nbsp; her and she cursed him thus : \"You and\nyour family&nbsp; will be ruined by Lord\nNarayana on account of me.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ravana once <span style=\"background-color: white;\">raped</span>\nMadanamaiijari, wife of Rtuvarman, who lived as an anchorite&nbsp; in the rnarutta forest, and the latter cursed\nthat Ravana would be killed by a man.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##########<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once on his way to his\nfather-in-law's&nbsp; house Sahasramukharavana\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\">raped</span> a Vidyadhara&nbsp; woman, CancalaksT,\nwho was performing tapas of&nbsp; Laksmidevi\nand Cancalaksl cursed him that Laksmidevi would kill him. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once Nala, the friend\nof Sudeva, and the relative of&nbsp; Dhumraksa,\nafter having drunk too much liquor, tried&nbsp;\nto <span style=\"background-color: white;\">rape </span>the wife of the hermit Pramati. All this happened while King\nSudeva was standing silently near Nala.&nbsp; Pramati\nrequested King Sudeva repeatedly to save his wife. Sudeva replied :&nbsp; ' The Ksatriya who could help&nbsp; the needy, could save your wife also. But I\nam a Vaisya.\" This arrogance of the King made the hermit angry. \"May\nyou become a Vaisya.\"&nbsp; The hermit\ncursed the King. Sudeva repented&nbsp; and\nrequested for liberation from the curse. \"When a Ksatriya steals away your\ndaughter you will recover&nbsp; the lost\nfeelings of Ksatriya.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">##############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SUTAPAS VI. A hermit\nwho was born in the dynasty&nbsp; of\nBharadvaja. Tiiis hermit had two wives. A son named Kalyanamitra was bora by\nPitrkanyaka, one&nbsp; of the two wives.&nbsp; The glamour of the second wife of Sutapas\nattracted&nbsp; the sun, who<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> raped </span>her once\nand from this, the son&nbsp; Asvinisuta was\nborn. On seeing that his wife was a&nbsp;&nbsp;<span style=\"background-color: white;\"> harlot</span>,\nSutapas abandoned her with her son. After- wards, at the instance of Sri Krsna,\nthe hermit&nbsp; received his wife and her son\nback. (Brahmavaivarta: 1 : 11).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6lhzbzox_Y4/XF1BrFJGM6I/AAAAAAABftM/IzrEZdY3EFMfFyTtx2-XBZy_kfIMrfyvgCLcBGAs/s1600/500ss323c5e7411.jpeg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"800\" data-original-width=\"533\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-6lhzbzox_Y4/XF1BrFJGM6I/AAAAAAABftM/IzrEZdY3EFMfFyTtx2-XBZy_kfIMrfyvgCLcBGAs/s400/500ss323c5e7411.jpeg\" width=\"266\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">#############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VAJRABAHU I. A\nnotorious asura. Vajrabahu was&nbsp; born of a\nVidyadhara-damsel named Caiicalaksi, when&nbsp;\nshe was <span style=\"background-color: white;\">raped </span>by the asura Sahasramukha. This&nbsp; Vajrabahu did penance before Siva and\nobtained Pasupatastra (a divine arrow) and an impenetrable armour.&nbsp; After this, he caught hold of Indra and bound\nhim.&nbsp; Subrahrnanya rescued Indra and\nkilled Vajrabahu.&nbsp; (Kamba Ramayana,\nUttara Kanda).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">###############<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-PnBYg1-drP4/XFymMioOwgI/AAAAAAABfr0/nMEZoApzywkuMsYKkRr5HgO4WbZY_0J4QCLcBGAs/s1600/gndw.gif\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" data-original-height=\"215\" data-original-width=\"215\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-PnBYg1-drP4/XFymMioOwgI/AAAAAAABfr0/nMEZoApzywkuMsYKkRr5HgO4WbZY_0J4QCLcBGAs/s400/gndw.gif\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b style=\"font-family: Cambria, serif;\">I AM SURE 99.9 % OF MY HINDU READERS BOTH\nMALE AND FEMALE MUST BE </b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 18pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">I ASK MODI/ RAJNATH SINGH/ AJIT DOVAL..<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/mistakes-deliberate-or-inadvertant-in_7.html?showComment=1549649979544#c6052176998052399971\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 8, 2019 at 11:49 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">OUR PURANAS WERE COMPOSED ENTIRELY IN SANSKRIT ( 100% ) AFTER THE MAHABHARATA WAR.. KRISHNA FIND A MENTION.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">18 MAHAPURANAS PURANAS ( SMRITIS ) WERE WRITTEN FOR HINDUS WHO HAS NO ACCESS TO THE VEDAS ( SRUTI ) ..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">SRUTIS ARE DIVINE AND AUTHORLESS IN ORIGIN..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">PURANAS WERE WRITTEN BY A MORTAL NAMED MAHARISHI VYASA 6000 YEARS AGO WHO ALSO WROTE THE MAHABHARATA IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE WAR..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">ALL HINDU GODS ARE COSMIC ALLEGORIES EXCEPT VISHNU AVATARS RAMA/ KRISHNA WHEN PURANAS WERE WRITTEN..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">VEDAS WERE PENNED IN 5000 BC--WHILE PURANAS WERE PENNED IN 4000 BC-- A MILLINIUM LATER..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THIS MEANS ANY REFERENCE TO THE PURANAS IN VEDAS ARE POISON INJECTED..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">EXAMPLE :</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\"The rk and saman verses, the chandas, the PURANA along with the Yajus formulae, all sprang from the remainder of the sacrificial food, (as also) the gods that resort to heaven. He changed his place and went over to great direction, and Itihasa and Purana, gathas, verses in praise of heroes followed in going over.\"</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\u2014\u2009Atharva Veda XV.6.10-11,</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">MAHABHARATA WAS HAPPENED DURING THE LIFETIME OF MAHARISHI VYASA.. THE SARASWATI RIVER DIED IN HIS TIME.. JUST BEFORE THE MAHABHARATA WAS GOT OVER..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">LYING JEWESS Wendy Doniger, dated the Markandeya Purana to 250 AD so as to include Buddha as the ninth avatar of Vishnu..and Linga Purana to 1000 AD , so as to poison inject Rothschilds FAKE and backdates heroes of the FAKE Bhakti movement..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The Sthala Puranas in TAMIL were created by Rothschild created FAKE Kanchi mutt.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: 16px;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/06/kanchi-mutt-creation-of-white-invader.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE REAL PURANAS DO NOT ADVOCATE BHAKTI-- ONLY SHRADDHA..IN ANY CASE PUURANAS ARE NOT RELIGIOUS TEXTS..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">THE REAL BUDDHA ( WHO BELIEVED IN VEDAS ) HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH MODERN BUDDHISM ( OF BUDDHA BORN IN 563 BC WHO ATE PIG AND DID NOT BELIEVE IN SOUL ) WE SEE TODAY..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WHEN THE WHITE INVADER CAME TO INDIA THERE WAS NOT ONE SINGLE BUDDHIST IN INDIA..</span></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">THE REAL BUDDHA WAS ADI BUDDHA BORN TO ANJANA OF FATHER HEMAJIT IN KIKATA, BODHGAYA IN 1900 BC..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">BUDDHA IS NOT A NAME --IT IS A TITLE MEANING \"LIBERATED ONE \"... ADI-BUDDHA REAL NAME IS SUGATA..HE WAS A MEMBER OF GRII SECT OF ADI-SHANKARACHARYA ..</span><br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">THE FAKE BUDDHA ( BORN IN LUMBINI , KAPILAVASTU, NEPAL ) OF FAKE ASHOKA FAME WAS NOT LIBERATED... HE STRUGGLED FOR SALVATION.. HIS LAST MEAL WAS PIG GIBLET..HIS MOTHER WAS MAYADEVI AND FATHER WAS SHUDDHODANA..</span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">RAJATHARANGINI WRITTEN IN SANSKRIT DESCRIBES ADI BUDDHA --THE REAL BUDDHA , WHO EXISTED DURING RULE OF THE SHISHUNAG DYNASTY( KRUTTIKA PERIOD ) , WAS A VEGETARIAN AND BELIEVED IN THE SOUL..&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/mistakes-deliberate-or-inadvertant-in_7.html?showComment=1549673399049#c1256286356543492132\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 9, 2019 at 6:19 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nIN THE PURANAS SOME WOMEN DIED IN FIRE ( BUT NOT AS A TRADITION OF SATI )..<br />\n<br />\n1) MADRI THE WIFE OF PANDU WHO BLAMED HERSELF FOR HER HUSBANDS DEATH AND JUMPED INTO THE FUNERAL FIRE .<br />\n<br />\n2) SATI THE FIRST WIFE OF SHIVA WHO COMMITTED SUICIDE IN FRONT OF HER FATHER BY SELF COMBUSTION , AGONIZED BY HER FATHER INSULTING HER HUSBAND SHIVA..<br />\n<br />\n3) WOMEN WHOM ARJUNA LED AWAY FROM DWARAKA BEFORE THE CITY SUBMERGED INTO THE SEA. ARJUNA COULD NOT REMEMBER THE PASSWORD FOR HIS ASTRA WHEN ATTACKED BY WOMEN ABDUCTING BANDITS..<br />\n<br />\nIN KERALA CHILDREN WERE SENT TO THE GRANDMOTHER DURING SUMMER SCHOOL VACATIONS BY THE PARENTS SO THAT THEY COULD HEAR THE PURANAS.. THOSE DAYS THERE WE NO COMPUTER GAMES .<br />\n<br />\nWE NEVER HEARD OF SUCH VETTAM MANI TYPE FUCKING AND SUCKING AND INVOLUNTARY SEMEN EMISSIONS.<br />\n<br />\nPURANA STORIES WERE SO POWERFUL.. IT WOULD TWANG OUR SOUL STRINGS ..<br />\n<br />\nLET ME NARRATE HOW WOMEN UNDER ARJUNAs CARE JUMPED INTO THE FIRE--WHEN HE FAILED TO PROTECT THEM..<br />\n<br />\nREAD THE PAST PART OF THE POST BELOW--<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2011/11/mahabharata-and-bhagawat-gita-4000-bc.html<br />\n<br />\nNOW FOR THE STORY ABOUT SHIVAs WIFE SATI COMMITTING SUICIDE BY SELF COMBUSTION ..<br />\n<br />\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/06/kottiyoor-temple-oldest-temple-and.html<br />\n<br />\nNOW REGARDING MADRI ..<br />\n<br />\nKRISHNA HAD THE UNOFFICIAL TASK OF KILLING 100 KAURAVA TEST TUBE BABIES WHO WERE BORN BY CLONING..<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2015/09/ethics-of-human-cloning-decided-6000.html<br />\n<br />\nIF YOU READ MAHABHARATA , KRISHNA USED DECEIT.. HE DID HIS JOB EVERY WHICH WAY, WITHOUT REACHING THE LAWS OF KARMA.. BUT HE GAVE ALL THE KAURAVAS WHOM HE KILLED MOKSHA..<br />\n<br />\nFINALLY HIS JOB DONE KRISHNA AWAITED HIS OWN DEATH BY A ARROW UNDER THE FOOT-- GENTLY PLAYING HIS FLUTE.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2014/10/king-vali-and-queen-tara-of-ramayana.html<br />\n<br />\nPANDAVAS WOULD HAVE HAD ALBINO BLOOD IF MOTHER KUNTI HAD SEX WITH PANDU ( AN ALBINO )--AND IN THAT CASE KRISHNA WOULD HAVE KILLED ALL 5 PANDAVAS TOO..<br />\n<br />\nBeautiful and intelligent Queen Kunti was the mother of Karna and the first three Pandava brothers Yudhishthira, Bhima, Arjuna. .<br />\n<br />\nShe was the step and the foster mother of Nakula and Sahadeva. Kunti was the sister of Vasudeva, the father of Krishna ..<br />\n<br />\nKunti used the boons given to her by Sage Durvasa ( by which she used to bear Karna) to bear three sons\u2014Yudhishthira (by Yama), Bhima (by Vayu), and Arjuna (by Indra).<br />\n<br />\nKunti ( a commoner) having warmed up to Pandu\u2019s second wife Princess Madri during their exile shared the mantra with her, on the condition that she only use it once.<br />\n<br />\nMadri cleverly summons the Ashvins, who give her twin sons Nakula and Sahadeva.<br />\n<br />\nAfter the death of Pandu and Madri, Kunti took care of all five Pandava children.<br />\n<br />\nKunti\u2019s marital life was also unusual. Having chosen Pandu as her husband in a svayamvara ceremony, she never had a child by Pandu. Pandu was an albino and was afraid that his children would also be Albinos.<br />\n<br />\nIn those days being born an Albino was considered a curse from bad karma of previous births.<br />\n<br />\nPandu knew that his wife Kunti had a son from Surya by the name of Karna.<br />\n<br />\nHe became adamant that Madri must also use the same divine mantra obtained from Durvasa<br />\n<br />\nWalking back a few steps--<br />\n<br />\nOnce Sage Durvasa visited Kuntibhoja. Being extremely pleased by the all comforts, patience, and devotion offered by Kunti, he offered her a mantra that would invoke any god of her choice and he would bless her with children.<br />\n<br />\nOut of impetuous curiosity, Kunti invoked the god Surya. Bound by the power of the mantra, Surya begot a child on her, and restored her virginity. To her surprise, Karna was born with his sacred armor on.<br />\n<br />\nOut of fear of the public, Kunti abandoned the child, who later became famous as Karna. On her swayamvara gorgeus Kunti chose King Pandu of Hastinapur, making her the Queen of Hastinapur.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"c1256286356543492132-rt\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"c1256286356543492132-ra\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c8161231372540992177\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/mistakes-deliberate-or-inadvertant-in_7.html?showComment=1549673499908#c8161231372540992177\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 9, 2019 at 6:21 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\nTara ( she was NOT a monkey ) , Mandodari and Kunti are the top three beautiful women in our Puranas..<br />\n<br />\nIn his mission to expand his empire, Pandu married Madri, a princess of Madra in order to secure the vassalage of Madra.<br />\n<br />\nAlbino Pandu could not make love with his wives<br />\n<br />\nOne day, Pandu, forgetting his curse, attempted to join physical relations with his wife Madri. But, as a result of rishi Kindama's curse, he died. Madri jumped into the funeral fire out of remorse.<br />\n<br />\nKunti stood helplessly in the forest with her children.<br />\n<br />\nAfter the death of Pandu and Madri, Kunti took care of all five Pandava children, taking them back to Hastinapur ..<br />\n<br />\nAs war approached, Kunti met Karna and in desperation to keep her children alive, asked Karna to join the Pandavas. Karna denied the offer, as he could not betray his friend. However, he promised Kunti that he would not kill any of his brothers except Arjuna<br />\n<br />\nKunti also asked Karna further promises, such as he should not use the same weapon twice against Arjuna, which were granted by Karna. In return, Karna requested his mother to keep their relationship a secret until the end of the war.<br />\n<br />\nHe also promised that at the end of the war she would still have five sons, the fifth one be either Arjuna or Karna himself. Despite supporting her children, Kunti stayed in the Kaurava camp along with her sister-in-law Gandhari.<br />\n<br />\nGANDHARI WAS THE MOTHER OF KAURAVAS AND WIFE OF BLIND KING DHRITASHTRA. SHE GAVE PREMATURE BIRTH TO A GREY LUMPEN MASS . SHE WAS INCONSOLABLE .<br />\n<br />\nVYASA AN EXPERT AYURVEDIC DOCTOR IMMEDIATELY DID CLONING AND CREATED 100 TEST TUBE BABIES OUT OF THIS MASS .<br />\n<br />\nKRISHNAs UNOFFICIAL TASK WAS TO EXTERMINATE THESE TEST TUBE BABIES WHO AND THEIR DESCENDANTS WOULD NOT HAVE A CONSCIENCE AND WOULD BE A BURDEN ON EARTH..<br />\n<br />\nONE OF THE 100 TEST TUBE BABIES WAS A FEMALE DUSHALA WHO MARRIED JAYADRATA THE KING OF SINDHU AND SAUVIRYA<br />\n<br />\nKRISHNA ENSURED JAYADRATAs DEATH BEFORE HE PRODUCED A BABY..NONE OF THE PANDAVAs WOULD KILL JAYADRATA BEFORE AS THEY WERE VERY FND OF DUSHALA.<br />\n<br />\nJayadrata was son of the mighty king Vridhakshatra.<br />\n<br />\nKing Jayadratha had a split personality disorder. One day when he was afflicted , Jayadratha tried to abduct Draupadi. The Pandavas freed Draupadi and wanted to punish ( not kill ) Jayadratha so that Dushala would not become a widow.<br />\n<br />\nBhima shaved Jayadratha's head leaving him with just five spots of hair on his head, before setting him free..<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2013/09/sikha-kudumi-choti-open-flag-of.html<br />\n<br />\nThis was equal to death -- Jayadratha decided to seek vengeance for what had happened to him. Jayadratha got an invite from Duryodhan for a war against Pandavas.<br />\n<br />\nIF PANDU THE ALBINO HAD PRODUCED BIOLOGICAL CHILDREN ( OF DEGRADED Y CHROMOSOME ) KRISHNA WOULD HAVE KILLED THEM..<br />\n<br />\nIN MALAYALAM AND ANSKRIT PANDU MEANS PALE.. HIS COMPEXION WAS LIKE A PALE WHITE LOTUS.<br />\nPANDUs MOTHER WAS AMBALIKA \u2013OF THE THREE SISTERS JODI AMBA, AMBIKA AND AMBALIKA<br />\n<br />\nAMBIKA WAS THE MOTHER OF BLIND KING DHRITARASHTRA AND GRANDMOTHER TO THE KAURAVAS.<br />\n<br />\nPARASHURAMA TRIED TO MAKE HIS DISCIPLE BHISHMA MARRY AMBA . HE REFUSED DUE TO THE VOW OF CELEBACY ( SO THAT HIS KING FATHER SHANTANU COULD RETAIN HIS HONOUR ) ..<br />\n<br />\nPARASHURAMA WITH A SHORT FUSE FOUGHT WITH BHISHMA WAS 23 DAYS. FINALLY BHISHMA SAID ENOUGH IS ENOUGH AND DREW HIS DEADLY PRASHAPASTRA \u2013 GODS GOT NERVOUS AND NARADA JUMPED IN AND DECLARED THE FIGHT A DRAW..<br />\n<br />\nFRUSTRATED AMBA JUMPED INTO A HOMAN FIRE TO SPITE BHISHMA.. THIS IS THE CONTINUOUS HOMAN FIRE WHICH IS SHOWN AS THREE FLASHES (MAKARAVILAKKU) AT SABARIMALA ..<br />\n<br />\nON MAKARA SANKRATI DAY DUSK , THE EXACT MOMENT WHEN BHISHMAs SOULS LEFT HIS MORTAL COIL WHILE ON HIS BED OF ARROWS.<br />\n<br />\nhttps://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/11/5900-year-old-sabarimala-this-planets.html<br />\n<br />\nThe entire cloned race of 100 Kaurava brothers were born out of one single mother the beautiful and chaste Gandhari, the princess of Gandhar ( modern day Kandahar in Afghanistan ).<br />\n<br />\nIn Sanatana Dharma EXTREMELY VIRTUOUS WOMEN had gifted powers .<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"c8161231372540992177-ce\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c2867108730801415333\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Those days nobody dared to question the wisdom of Bhishma.<br />\n<br />\nGandhari's brother prince Shakuni was terribly upset . He knew his dear sister was virtuous and she would blind fold herself as soon as she got married to the blind man.<br />\n<br />\nHe also knew his sister had a phobia- she was terrified of darkness . He knew his darling sister would die a thousand deaths every day.<br />\n<br />\nPrince Shakuni swore a terrible revenge.<br />\n<br />\nTo remind himself of this vengeance every minute of his day he plunged his dagger deep into his thigh and twisted it to sever the ligaments, and swore he would keep the wound festered and sustain a limp, till he destroyed Bhishma.<br />\n<br />\nGandhari never complained.<br />\n<br />\nWhen war was declared she lost her stately composure , ran and took her sword ( she was a good sword fighter ) .<br />\n<br />\nSuddenly knowing the futility of wielding a sword blindfolded , she cried out aloud -<br />\n<br />\nOFH GOD, I AM AS MUCH AFRAID OF THIS WAR AS I AM AFRAID OF THIS ENDLESS DARKNESS.<br />\n<br />\nGandhari could NOT see any of her 100 dead sons .<br />\n<br />\nThey kept dying every day of the Mahabharata war. Krishna watched her mourning each of her dead 100 CLONED sons.<br />\n<br />\nDuring the war Shakuni had plans to kill Bhishma-- provided Gandhari takes off her blindfold - but this chaste woman refused -- as her blindfolding herself was under OATH..<br />\n<br />\nFinally Sahadeva nailed Shakuni on the 18th day of the war.<br />\n<br />\nShakuni was a illusionist and that was how he could manipulate the game of dice.<br />\n<br />\nIn Kerala Shakuni is considered as a man of virtue , but he became a bad man only because of his extreme devotion to his own sister Gandhari -- -<br />\n<br />\n--there is a temple dedicated to Shakuni at Pavithreswaram in Kollam District, Kerala<br />\n<br />\nKing Ambi the traitor who helped Alexander the Great was a direct descendant of Shakuni.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/05/alexander-great-and-king-porus-hidden.html<br />\n<br />\nJust before Krishna blew his conch to kick start the Kurukshetra War , he ordered Yuyutsu ( the only NON-cloned son of Dhritarashtra to defect from the Kaurava camp to the Pandava camp.<br />\n<br />\nYuyutsu was one among the eleven warriors to survive the terrible war.<br />\n<br />\nFearing problems with Gandhari's pregnancy which had continued for almost two years, Dhritrashtra had a child from Sughada, a woman from Vaishya Varna, who is lady in waiting to Gandhari.<br />\n<br />\nYuyutsu was born on the same day as Duryodhana and was elder to Dushasana, other Kauravas and Dussala. Thus, contrary to popular perception, Dhritrashtra had 101 sons.<br />\n<br />\nThe only NON cloned son Yuyutsu was saved by Krishna- After the war, Krishna crowned him the King of Indraprastha.<br />\n<br />\nWhen the Pandavas decided to retire from the world at the start of the Kali Yuga and departure of Krishna, Yudhisthira gave him charge of mentoring young Parikshit who was made the king of Indraprasta.<br />\n<br />\nThis is what is written in Mahabharata -<br />\n<br />\nQueen Gandhari\u2019s ( mother of Kauravas ) foetus was broken up and put in 101 mudpots by Maharishi Vyasa . These test pots were carefully attended to by trained morphic field resonator parichaarakas for 'incubating' these test tubes \u2018<br />\n<br />\nThis is the first written example of test tube babies and 'stem cell technology' .<br />\n<br />\nDridharashtra's wife Gandhari gave birth to a lumpen mass of flesh which Vyasa cut into 100 pieces and kept each one in a pot. At the appropriate time, each piece was born as a son and thus a 100 sons were born to Gandhari. (Mahabharata, Aadhiparvam, chapter 114, sloka 17).<br />\n<br />\nBALLS TO DHARMAWIKIs SOURCE OF \u201c SEMEN SOAKED FACTS \u201c VETTAM FUCKIN\u2019 MANI.. As they did when Mahabharata talked about scalar howitzer weapons of mass destruction<br />\n<br />\nToday Hinduism has the last laugh.<br />\n<br />\nEven I know how to clone a baby and I am NOT a scientist.<br />\n<br />\nMorphogenetic fields are created by the patterns of physical forms. They help guide the formation of later similar systems where a newly forming system \"tunes into\" a previous system by having within it a \"seed\" that resonates with a similar seed in the earlier form.<br />\n<br />\nIf MAD MAN Charles Darwin were to know about DNA , be might go into a deep sulk!<br />\n<br />\nScience has proven that your hair follicles, dead skin etc\u2026 vibrates with your pattern after it leaves your body from hundreds of miles away.<br />\n<br />\nThey were able to detect changes in vibrations in case study on of a hair follicle that was hundreds of miles away from it owner when his mood changed.<br />\n<br />\nMorphic fields underlie the intelligent organization of proteins, cells, crystals, plants, animals, brains, and minds.<br />\n<br />\nThey help to explain habits, memories, instincts, telepathy, and the sense of direction. The structure of morphic fields depends on what has happened before.<br />\n<br />\nThey have an inherent memory and imply that many of the so-called laws of nature are more like habits.<br />\n<br />\nWhen the first jar was opened Gandhari took the baby out and named him Duryodhan.<br />\n<br />\nBut alas! As soon as the baby started crying all the beasts of the jungle started howling , jackals bayed- and many signs of ill omen were seen.<br />\n<br />\nEveryone was shocked and disappointed as this meant that the baby was not auspicious and would bring harm on the entire clan of the Kauravas.<br />\n<br />\nVidura spoke then and said that the child would have to be abandoned as the omens at his birth spell doom for the Kuru clan.<br />\n<br />\nHe said, \"The scriptures clearly state that for the good of the clan an individual can be sacrificed, for the good of the village a clan can be sacrificed, for the good of the country a village can be sacrificed and for the development of the soul, even the earth can be sacrificed.\" So for the good of the clan and of the country and of humanity, please sacrifice this son of yours.<br />\n<br />\nBut both Gandhari and Dhritrashtra were adamant that a baby could not cause any harm and much against Vidur's wishes kept the baby.<br />\n<br />\nAt the same time Bheema was born to Kunti in the forest.<br />\n<br />\nThe other children of Gandhari were taken out of the jars and now Gandhari had one hundred sons. All the sons grew up to be strong and powerful.<br />\n<br />\nDhritarashtra was half-brother of Pandu and Vidura, Vidura was raised and educated by Bhishma as the half-brother of Dhritarashtra and Pandu. However, since neither of his parents were of the royal blood, he was made counselor to his brothers, the kings, rather than a king himself.<br />\n<br />\nAfter the great war 6000 years ago, Yudhishthira appointed Vidura the prime minister with complete control of the government.<br />\n<br />\nHowever, following the carnage of the war and his own age, Vidura did not have the heart to govern. Soon after, he retired to the forests as an ascetic with his half-brother Dhritarashtra and his sisters-in-law Gandhari and Kunti.<br />\n<br />\nHe undertook severe penances and was the first of the royal ascetics to die.<br />\n<br />\nVidura is held to be a paragon of truth, dutifulness, impartial judgement and steadfast dharma. He is considered the embodiment of the inner consciousness of the Mahabharata.<br />\n<br />\nHe was the only one to object to disrobing of Draupadi.<br />\n<br />\nCapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c7505403650314571096\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; Verse 24, Chapter 7 of the Mausala Parva, states that Bhadra, one of the four wives of Vasudeva, father of Sri Krsna died by<span style=\"color: red;\"> jumping into the<br />funeral pyre of her husband.</span><br />\n<br />\nIn due course the brahmin died and <span style=\"color: red;\">his<br />second wife jumped into the funeral pyre</span> and ended her life.<br />\n<br />\nPandu died at the Satasrnga vana and<br />\nMadri observed sati by <span style=\"color: red;\">jumping into his funeral pyre</span> and burning herself alive.<br />\n<br />\nEven while he was in his death-bed Candrasri continued her affair with the paramour. When one day she was with her paramour thus, she was told that her husband was no more. At once she took leave of him, returned home and c<span style=\"color: red;\">ommitted suicide by jumping into the funeral pyre </span>of the husband. (Kathasaritsagara, Saktiyasolam-<br />\nbaka, Taraiiga 2).<br />\n<br />\nMy husband died that day and I (Nagasri) gave away my life jumping into the funeral pyre of my husband.<br />\n<br />\nHAIMAVATl III. A wife of Sri Krsna. When Krsna was cremated <span style=\"color: red;\">Haimavati also ended her life in the funeral pyre</span>. (Mausala Parva, Chapter 7, Verse 73).<br />\n<br />\nThe King caught hold of the youth and killed him. His wife, the Brahmani wept loudly and after cremating her husband's body in a <span style=\"color: red;\">funeral pyre,jumped into it </span>and burnt herself to death. Just before her death she pronounced a curse on Kalmasapada that if he touched<br />\nany woman in future he would die immediately.<br />\n<br />\n(iii) Anointed queens like Rukmini and JambavatI and some other <span style=\"color: red;\">wives of Krsna entered his funeral pyre</span> and ended their lives. (Mausala Parva, Chapter<br />\n7, Verses 73 and 74).<br />\n<br />\nDuring a winter when the forest was fragrant with flowers, Pandu forgot all about the Sage's curse and indulged in sexual joys with Madri, and immediately he expired. Kunti and Madri competed<br />\nwith each other to <span style=\"color: red;\">end their life in the funeral pyre</span> of their husband. But, as the sages and other relations<br />\ninsisted that one of them should live to bring up the children, Madri alone ended'her life, and Kunti returned<br />\nto Hastinapura with the five children. (Adi Parva, Chapter 125).<br />\n<br />\nVasudeva had seven wives named RohinI, Bhadramaninl, Madira, Ila, Rocana, Pauravi and Devaki (9th Skandha,<br />\nBhagavata) . Of these Devaki, Rohim, and Bhadra abandoned their lives by<span style=\"color: red;\"> jumping into the funeral pyre </span>of Vasudcva. (Sloka 18, Chapter 7, Mausala).<br />\n<br />\nWhen they cremated Rambha's body, <span style=\"color: red;\">she<br />jumped into the funeral pyre </span>and burnt herself to death.<br />\n<br />\nThe nymphs showered flowers on her from above and the dead body of Vrnda was cremated by Smaraduti and Smaraduti <span style=\"color: red;\">jumped into the funeral pyre </span>of Vrnda<br />\nand gave away her life. The nymphs made an image of her with the ashes from the funeral pyre and floated it on the river Ganga.<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">Indrasena jumped into the funeral pyre of her husband</span> and died. (Markandeya<br />\nPurana) .<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">It was the custom then that the wife should end her life in the funeral pyre of her husband </span>and so Kunti and Madrl came forward to do so. But Madri said that one of them should live to take care of the children. (CONTRADICTION :EARLIER MADRI DID IT ON SAGES' ADVICE)<br />\n<br />\nParasurama returned from Mahendragiri at once and cremated the dead body of his father. <span style=\"color: red;\">Renuka, his mother, jumped into the funeral pyre</span> and abandoned her life.<br />\n<br />\nIn the meantime a buffalo loved Mahisasura's mother and it attacked Rambha and gored him to death. The<br />\nYaksas burnt his dead body in a funeral pyre and the <span style=\"color: red;\">she-buffalo jumped into the pyre </span>and abandoned her life.<br />\n<br />\nAfter doing severe penance for a long time he merged with Parabrahman. font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/00472330782894146543\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Vikhyat Singh</a></cite><span class=\"icon user \" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/mistakes-deliberate-or-inadvertant-in_7.html?showComment=1549625466527#c5410849476748695556\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 8, 2019 at 5:01 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nOne day another buffalo felt a passion<br />\nfor Rambha's wife and in the fight that ensued Rambha was killed by it. Rambha's wife died in his funeral<br />\npyre.<br />\n<br />\nAs soon as she heard those words of Rama, Sita asked Laksmana to light a funeral pyre saying that the woman suspected by her husband should not live and so she (Sita) would quit her life in the very presence of Rama.<br />\n<br />\nAfter cursing Dasaratha that he too would die of separation from his son, the <span style=\"color: red;\">aged muni expired; his wife also died in his funeral pyre.&nbsp;</span><br />\nAt last, Sankara had to cremate his mother by himself without others' help. He made a pyre with plantain stems in the compound of his house, and <span style=\"color: red;\">cut his<br />mother's corpse INTO PIECES, carried the pieces to the funeral pyre</span> and thus cremated the body.<br />\n<br />\nThen a celestial voice said to her : \"Cry not. If you are really chaste and true, enter the funeral pyre along with your husband.\" To this Suveda<br />\nanswered thus : \"I cry because of grief that he died before making me the mother of a son.\" The celestial voice said to her again : \"You <span style=\"color: red;\">enter the pyre </span>without weeping. Your husband will have seven sons.\" Sudeva now permitted her dead husband to be cremated and meditating upon her chastity<span style=\"color: red;\"> she jumped into the funeral pyre.</span><br />\n<br />\nVapusman waited for an opportunity to take revenge and when a convenient moment came, he killed Narisyanta the father of Dama. Indrasena the mother<br />\nof Dama told him of his father's murder and then j<span style=\"color: red;\">umping into the funeral pyre</span> of her husband, she died.</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c2954737549122675752\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; border-bottom: 0px; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 8, 2019 at 8:21 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nPOISON INJECTED..</div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">THERE IS NOT A SINGLE INSTANCE OF SATI IN OUR PURANAS..</span></div>\n<br />\nDHARMAWIKI WILL CRY \" THIS MAY BE CAPTAINS OPINION \"..<br />\n<br />\nACCORDING TO DHARMAWIKI IT IS A \"FACT\" THAT OUR PURANAS ARE SOAKED IN SEMEN<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</li>\n<br />\n<br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c7389977499772816568\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/18265601721675424400\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Buddha Zorba</a></cite><span class=\"icon user \" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/america-caused-global-warming-with.html?showComment=1549557966630#c7389977499772816568\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 7, 2019 at 10:16 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\npage 760------ shukracharya shiva semen<br />\n<br />\n8 ) How Sukra lost his eye. Sukracarya lost one of his eyes during the time of Mahabali, the Asura King. Mahavisnu incarnated as Vamana and begged three feet of<br />\nearth from Mahabali. Since Sukra tried to obstruct it, Visnu put out one of Sukra's eyes with the point of a<br />\na darbha grass. (For more details see 3rd Para under<br />\nMahabali) . 9) Siva swallowed Sukra. Once Sukra invaded Kubera<br />\nand plundered all his wealth. The distressed Kubera<br />\ninformed Siva about it. Siva at once started up with<br />\nhis weapon, shouting \"Where is he?\" Sukra appeared on the top of Siva's trident. Siva caught hold of him<br />\nand swallowed him. Sukra who moved about in Siva's stomach found the excessive heat there, unbearable and<br />\nsoon became exhausted. In his helpless state he began<br />\nto worship Siva for his mercy. At last Siva permitted him to escape through his penis and Sukra thus came<br />\nout. (M.B. Sand Parva, Chapter 290).</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"c7389977499772816568-rt\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\">\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"c7389977499772816568-ra\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c7956943157977998625\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. text-decoration-line: none;\">February 7, 2019 at 10:13 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\npage 436 ----- sex change<br />\n<br />\n(iii) Kubera once cursed the Yaksa called Sthunakarna.<br />\nHe went to live in forest Amba the woman became a male by getting the penis of Sthunakarna. (See under<br />\nAmba and Sthunakarna).</div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c65301851825239971\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"http://lh3.googleusercontent.com/zFdxGE77vvD2w5xHy6jkVuElKv-U9_9qLkRYK8OnbDeJPtjSZ82UPq5w6hJ-SA=s35\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/18265601721675424400\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Buddha Zorba</a></cite><span class=\"icon user \" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/america-caused-global-warming-with.html?showComment=1549557613683#c65301851825239971\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 7, 2019 at 10:10 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\npage 195 ------ sexual sport --- krishna<br />\n<br />\nDAKSII^A.<br />\n<br />\nA daughter, born to Prajapati Ruci, by his wife Akuti. The first Manu was Svayambhuva, the son<br />\nof Brahma. He accepted Satarupa, his sister who be- came sinless by penance, as his wife. Satarupa gave birth<br />\nto two sons Priyavrata and Uttanapada, and two<br />\ndaughters, Prasuti and Akuti. Of these two daughters,<br />\nPrasuti was given to Prajapati Daksa and Akuti to Prajapati Ruci. Akuti gave birth to twins, a son named<br />\nYajfta and a daughter named Daksina. To Yajiia<br />\ntwelve sons were born by Daksina. They were a class of devas (gods) called the Yamas in the regime of Manu<br />\nSvayambhuva (Visnu Purana, Arils' a 1, Chapter 7).<br />\nNow Daksina is worshipped as a goddess. The same<br />\nDaksina was reborn in the Goloka under the name<br />\nSuslla. At that time she was a cowherd woman and<br />\nfriend of Radha. She liked to talk with Sri Krsna. One<br />\nday Radha saw her sitting in the lap of Sri Krsna,<br />\nengaged in sexual sports, in a secluded place. When<br />\nSuslla saw that Radha had found them out, she be- came dumbfounded with shame, and sat with bowed<br />\nhead. Sri Krsna slowly placed Suslla devi down and<br />\ninstantly vanished. The angry Radha cursed SuSila to become ashes if ever she entered the Goloka again. Then<br />\nRadha ran about everywhere in search of Sri Krsna,<br />\nbut he could not be found.<br />\nImmediately after the curse, Sugila got down from the Goloka and began to worship MahalaksmI with devotion<br />\nand meditation and very severe fast and vow. After a long time MahalaksmI appeared to her and blessed<br />\nher, and Sui'IIa became absorbed in MahalaksmI.<br />\nSince the absorption of Sus Ila devi, who was the rebirth of DaksinadevI, in MahalaksmI, the sacrifice of the devas (gods) became fruitless. They were much grieved.<br />\nThey all went to Brahma to find a solution. As the matter was serious Brahma meditated upon Visnu, who became pleased with Brahma and to save the dcvas, he<br />\nattracted DaksinadevI from the body of MahalaksmI<br />\nand gave her as a present to Brahma. Brahma gave that devi (goddess) to Yajnapurusa (the god of sacrifice) so that the sacrifices of gods might become fruitful. When Yajnapurusa saw that supernatural beauty he was<br />\noverpowered by lust and swooned. The couple spent a hundred divine years in seclusion enjoying the company of each other, as a result of which devi became pregnant. The pregnancy matured in twelve divine years and she<br />\ngave birth to a child which was named Phalada. It is this same Phalada, the son of Yajnapurusa and Daksina<br />\nwho awards fruits to all actions. The learned men say that Yajnapurusa, DaksinadevI and Phalada divide the<br />\nfruits of actions among the doers. (Devi Bhagavata Skandha 9).</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<br />\n<ol id=\"top-ra\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"c1497942754153195448\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img alt=\"\" src=\"http://lh3.googleusercontent.com/zFdxGE77vvD2w5xHy6jkVuElKv-U9_9qLkRYK8OnbDeJPtjSZ82UPq5w6hJ-SA=s35\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/18265601721675424400\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Buddha Zorba</a></cite><span class=\"icon user \" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2019/02/america-caused-global-warming-with.html?showComment=1549557119446#c1497942754153195448\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">February 7, 2019 at 10:01 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\npage 615 ------ hanuman's birth<br />\n<br />\nPUNJIKASTHALA. A nymph. She was the servant- maid of Brhaspati. One day she was collecting flowers<br />\nfor her Guru in a garden when a set of young men<br />\nand women came to the garden for amorous sports.<br />\nThey were roaming about in the garden in pairs doing<br />\nall sorts of erotic acts and Punjikasthala stood watching<br />\nthem for some time with passion aroused in her. She<br />\nreturned to the asrama thinking all the way about her<br />\nmiserable lot of having no husband to enjoy a similar<br />\nlife. She was full of lust when she returned to the asrama and on seeing Brhaspati she caught hold of him<br />\nby the hand and pleaded to satisfy her passion.<br />\nBrhaspati was angry at this improper request and<br />\ncursed her \"You have become rotten. You have be- come lustful by seeing the amorous sports of others. May you be born as a monkey. Get out of this aframa.\"<br />\nPunjikasthala came to her senses and regretting her<br />\nhasty act begged her Guru to grant her release from<br />\nthe curse. Brhaspati felt pity on her and said \"Go and<br />\nenjoy to your lull sexual life with a lover whom you<br />\nlike best. Then you will get a son from the vitality of<br />\nSiva. When that son is born you will be released from<br />\nthe curse and you will go to heaven.\"<br />\nShe became immediately a monkey girl named Anjana<br />\nand started living in a forest of that name itself. She<br />\nfell in love with a monkey boy named Kesari there and<br />\nlived for many years enjoying an amorous life. She did<br />\nnot get a child even after several years and then she<br />\nprayed to Siva for a child.<br />\nIt was at that time that Parvati and Paramevara<br />\nplayed amorous sports in the form of monkeys and<br />\nParvati became pregnant. Parvati expressed reluctance<br />\nto be the mother of a monkey child and then Siva by<br />\nhis divine powers deposited his semen virile through<br />\nVayubhagavan (god of wind) into the womb of<br />\nAnjana who was then praying to him for a child. Coming to know of this through Narada and fearing<br />\nthat his lordship over the monkeys would be lost if such a monkey were born to Anjana Bali poured into the belly of Anjana molten liquid of pancaloha (five metals). Anjana was not the least injured and she<br />\ngave birth in due course to a monkey son who became<br />\nthe celebrated Hanuman, the life-force of the RamaRavana tussle. (Purvakanda, Kamba Ramayana;<br />\nKiskindha Kanda, Valmiki Ramayana).</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal;
